Reviews.Title: “What a Sexy Room”
Reviews.Author: TravelMan90277
Reviews.Content: The hotel, which has you stranded out in the middle of airport wasteland nowhere, may charge an arm and a leg for meals and everything else, but the basic room, which can be had for a pretty decent price, is one of the sleekest, most modern and sexiest rooms I've ever seen -- even better than the pictures on the hotel website. The bathroom is separated from the rest of the room by sliding translucent doors (so you can open up the bathroom to the rest of the room). The shower is separate from the large soaking tub. The back of the shower and tub are mirrored, reflecting the sink mirror. The sink and counter is one piece of see-through glass. The bathroom lights have dimmer controls. The toilet and bidet are in their own closet. The furniture in the bedroom is sleek and modern. The bed and bedding are great. The rest of the hotel is sleek and modern too. The elevators are glass. A huge, central atrium rises above the ground floor lobby and restaurants. If you are stuck overnight at the Madrid Airport, and you want a fun room, this is the place. The hotel's free shuttle stops at all three terminals which are each some distance apart so that the shuttle bus comes only every 40 minutes or so. You don't need to call the hotel when you get out to your terminal's shuttle bus stop -- you just need to wait, and wait, outside, regardless of the weather.

Reviews.Title: “better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: travelersdepot
Reviews.Content: Somehow our inner calendars got confused and we arrived a day early for our pre-departure stay at the Hilton. Because of the extra day we were to stay there we decided on a club level room which offers free wifi and access to the club room and light food at breakfast and cocktail hours. Our spacious corner room had pleasing contemporary comfortable decor. The included breakfast buffet was above average and the staff friendly and helpful. Close enough by cab to the center of Madrid, it could be the place to stay if you have only a couple of days. The expensive water offered for sale in the rooms needs to go away. I can buy q bottle of very drinkable wine for that amount! KT

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of nowhere ... Not that great of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greg V
Reviews.Content: I don’t know where to begin … First, I have to say that for a Hilton, this was the worst Hilton that I have ever stayed in (and I’m a Diamond member). The service was very spotty. I asked for coffee for my room, and was told they did not have any. However, 3 days into my stay a coffee pack shows up. But I only got one coffee pack my entire stay. It also took 4 days before I finally got the newspaper delivered to my door. Other than that, I would grab one from the front desk on my way down to eat breakfast. I also got water put into my room twice … As far as breakfast, it was a good buffet. I asked on the first day if I could get an omelet, but was told they did not make them. Then on Monday (4 days into my stay) a person was behind the counter fixing omelets. Everything was very inconsistent … The fitness facility was lacking. There was one treadmill, one elliptical, and one stationary bike in a huge hotel. This was unsatisfactory for a hotel of this size. There was always a line, and you could tell that people were frustrated. In fact, a lot of the people that I talked to were very frustrated by this. As long as the weather is nice, you can run outside … but one of each piece of equipment? That’s not good … The hotel was out in the middle of nowhere. You had about a mile walk to the metro, or the hotel van could take you to the airport to the metro. But once you got to the metro you had about a 45 minute trip into the city of Madrid. This was fine, but if you are looking for a hotel in which you walk out the door and you are in the center of the city, then this is not the hotel for you. The lounge was ok … It was not the best that I have seen or been into. But overall, I was not very satisfied, and I know that when I’m back in Madrid that I will not be staying in this hotel. I will find someplace else …

Reviews.Title: “a great stop before the long flight home”
Reviews.Author: JandGBG
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this hotel numerous times and appreciate its closeness to the airport, the pool for relaxing in either coming or going for a trip and the amenities in the room. It is a pleasant walk to the subway and maybe a 10 min walk to a mall. The only disappointment this last time was the executive lounge. The staff were not warm and friendly and the food was not replenished. I highly recommend the morning breakfast in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for a late arrival or early departure”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne7759
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable and an ideal choice for the airport location if you have no need or desire to be in Central Madrid, and are coming off very late into, or leaving very early from, Madrid airport. We stayed there one night in April this year returning from a business trip in central Spain and found the location perfect for a very early start the next day. The taxi ride from the train Station at Chamartin was very quick, only 10 to 15 minutes, and cost €25 - good value for the 3 of us travelling. Checking in was effortless and the courtesy of the desk staff was exemplary. My Honours card had expired and a new one was created on the spot. We had prebooked this hotel at the rate of €144 per night which was very reasonable for the location and the standards offered. The rooms were vast and very well appointed. The bathroom was a stunning haven of peace and the furniture was beautiful. The only downside was the location of my room, located on a corner and facing the motorway. This was noisy till quite late in the night and then again, in the morning (though I did not care then having to get up at 4.30 am!). We had a light dinner in the restaurant and the food was tasty, in copious quantity although ordered from the starters menu, and reasonably priced. The service was excellent. There is wi-fi internet but this is not free. We did not use it. The hotel operates a shuttle to the airport which is free, and literally takes 5 minutes from door to door. Note that it is very advisable to pre-book this shuttle on arrival as you check in as there is limited space. The shuttle however does not start until 5 am, and this is a little short for some of the very early departures for airlines such as Ryanair. If your flight is before 6.30 am, you are advised to take a taxi earlier, and instead, as the shuttle will likely delivery you too late facing long queues, unless you have only hand baggage and no need to visit the check in desk. If you however have luggage to check in, beware. All in all, a very satisfactory location and level of service.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, but lacking”
Reviews.Author: Collgoss522
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed Hilton Airport in in Madrid for three days. Due to a last minute change in plans, we ended up in Madrid with no hotel reservation and after trying several other hotels, we decided to stay in the Hilton. They staff was helpful and accomodating and set us up in a very comfortable room right away. The decor is sleek and space efficient, and offer the details of a more spacious room by careful design. I found the room to be a wonderful space to relax after a busy day of museums and walking. The problem with this resort is mainly the location, and that it feels like an airport hotel. The lobby, though nicely decorated in the same sleek decor, has a feeling of a temporary stay. There is a conspicuous lack of warmth and home, and you get a distinct feeling that the hotel is intended for the occasional business trip or layover. The closest public transport is about a half mile away from the resort, and a bit obscure. Renting a car in Madrid seems not worth the cost as you spend most of your time walking, and parking seems to be an issue. It would be my impression that the Hilton could offer a shuttle to the Metro if not directly to some of the main attractions. It would go a long way to make the guests feel as though they are commited to housing visitors to the city, not just airport travelers. There is no restaurant to speak of at the Hilton, aside from their overpriced breakfast buffet. For about a third of the cost, you can get the metro to the San Miguel Market and get an amazing cappucino and something much more satisfying to eat. I did enjoy my stay there, was very comfortable, and again, the front desk staff were very helpful. It just lacked in a cohesiveness with the rest of the city, and would preclude me from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Follow-up Review”
Reviews.Author: PTJD01
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to stay here I did comment on this property about a year ago. I am starting to warm up to the location a little more, the walk from the Metro did not seem as far as it was a year ago. But its still a walk. The interior is very modern and clean. Did get my Diamond benefits, free wireless, free breakfast and Executive lounge access but no upgraded room. Did not notice this last time but unlike other Hiltons in Europe the Executive lounge does not serve much during the day. No wine or beer and just basic snacks during the day. The Booze and decent finger foods come out at 6:00pm. Good shuttle service to and from the Hotel. Oh, also did not know this on my last stay but Brasero Don Pedro, a highly rated Restaurant on TA is nearby but not within walking distance, will come to the Hotel pick you up and drop you off for no charge. I this this and it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: Caspermainecoon
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel usual Hilton amenities but rip off 26 euro breakfast and usual charge for Internet and water in the room Hilton need to enter the real world for non business travellers who can't charge these items and include them in the room rate

Reviews.Title: “Went out of their way to make our visit special”
Reviews.Author: WCWIII
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself exceeded my expectations. Nice and modern and very inviting. We chose it due to its being close to the airport. My understanding is that it is also close to transportation to get to the city center. If my next trip is to Madrid, even if it's for a few days, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here. Breakfast was also done very well with a very nice selection. There are some hotels that seem to go through the motions or are otherwise quite adequate, but then there are rare hotels like this one where you can tell they just put a little extra effort in and thus make the stay positive and memorable. I belong to HHonors and found the set up of the public space on their executive floor also very nice with a friendly attendant, nice refreshments, and comfortable seating. Internet access worked well - although, I did have to enter more than just a handful of characters for access. Of course, for this trip, we were in good moods already as we were celebrating our 20th. The hotel handled a special request for us and the staff were responsive to make things even better. I feel like we received a couple real gifts from the hotel and am very appreciative of their generosity to make the visit special for us - which it was.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Madrid Airport”
Reviews.Author: familyde
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Madrid Airport last week and had a very good experience! I arrived at the airport at 10:30pm, but I had to wait less than 5 minutes and a shuttle came to pick me up. At the hotel I was upgraded to an Executive Room and got free lounge access and breakfast, due to my HHonors Gold status. The lounge and the breakfast are both very nice and I would recommend it to everyone. The room is very modern and huge! It has a very nice and big bathroom with a seperate shower. I also used the swimming pool and it is very nice and relaxing. From the hotel you can easily walk to the next subway station within 10 to 15 minutes if you want to visit the city center. I will definitely stay here again when I will be in Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with terrible front desk.”
Reviews.Author: tripp2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for more than a week. Modern hotel with nice amenities. I wish the hotel was in downtown rather than the airport. The service is good. The breakfast is ok with enough choices. The only down side is with reception where the level of service is sub par.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for an Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarilynMonroe97
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a beautiful on the inside, nestled in an industrial location on the outside. The staff is friendly and efficient. The common areas are stunning. This is a great hotel for an overnight stay, but would not recommend it as a base for Madrid touring. It's a business person's hotel, as indicated by its price point. The room has an interesting design feature - the bathroom is shaped as a "cube" - two frosted glass doors close off the room. It's an efficient use of space and very cute! Several disappointments: (1) I booked two rooms for two people per room using my HHonors points (I am Diamond level). Upon check-in, they refused to assign both rooms to the concierge level and would only allow me and my husband access to the concierge lounge, but not the occupants of the other room. This is the first time I've encountered this with Hilton - all other hotels only treat the rooms as the Diamond level status. The hotel was not full, so really surprising that they took this stance. Not sure what they do when a Diamond member books two rooms for family - do they make teenage children occupy a room several floors below the parents? (2) The shuttle bus took almost 40 minutes to arrive a tthe airport for pick-up. (3) The location of the hotel is close to the airport, but close to little else. Madrid does not have a good subway system, so no metro stop was close by. The hotel does offer free shuttle service to one location in Madrid (not close to any of the tourist stops), but we did take the shuttle bus and walked several blocks to the nearest metro station to get to the Prado.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: KatRamos
Reviews.Content: I only had a day to spend in Madrid on a business trip so I opted for the Hilton Airport then took the Metro into the city. It has the excellent Hilton service from start to finish. I called the shuttle from the airport from the pay phone since my mobile didn't work there. They were there in 10 min. I was able to get checked and took a nap. The map to the Metro was easy and a nice short walk. The Metro ride is about 30-40 min. to get to Gran Via. But coming back to the Hilton that night where it was nice and quiet and I could get well rested before heading back to the airport the next day was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive architectures designed hotel”
Reviews.Author: WillyM
Reviews.Content: Very nice and quite hotel. Rooms are design very nicely and special look. Not a cheap hotel, but 5 minutes from the airport, and with a free shuttle offering back and forth the hotel. Interent is very expensive, even in europe terms. Nice beds, very comfort ones.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Madrid Airport”
Reviews.Author: Jere J
Reviews.Content: Madrid Airport Hilton outstanding as usual. Free airport shuttle runs on regular schedule so there is no long wait to get to the hotel. Check in procedure was simple and easy. Nice room, clean and comfortable. Pool with jets helped to relax after a long flight from the US. Breakfast was free and good, with plenty of variety. Staff was excellent, and provided great service. Highly recommend a stay at this hotel to decompress after a flight from the states prior to continuing on to other locations in Spain, or for that matter anywhere in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “I have been here many time, and will be returning many times...”
Reviews.Author: Dave A
Reviews.Content: I and other members of my team have been regular visitors here since the hotel opened in 2008, I personally have been here 3 times in the last 6 weeks and will be back again next week. Let’s be sure what this hotel is, it's an airport hotel, and therefore it is near to the airport, well terminal 1, 2 and 3. Nothing is near terminal 4 or 4s so it is no worse than any other hotel. There is a prompt hotel shuttle bus as well as a shuttle in to the centre of Madrid (i haven't tried this one so can't comment further). Typically, however, I hire a car and park in the hotel car park which is very convenient. So what sets this hotel apart for me, why do I keep returning? Well the restaurant is wonderful, food prepared beautifully, cooked perfectly and presented as a feast for the eyes. It won’t be the cheapest meal I have ever eaten but I have always feel it is one of the best value.. The bar is welcoming and pleasant and a good range of spirits are available, this used to be a stunning range which was always a pleasure to experiment with, but alas the diversity of rums and whiskies has been reduced, perhaps I didn't drink enough of them, very sad... Interestingly, two weeks ago they added a Heineken tap on the bar which is a welcome addition. So I suppose I should find something to temper this rather one sided review with, so you don’t think I am unduly favourable, and so might lack credibility... 1. The area to the side of the hotel, which does not seem to belong to the hotel, could do with some tidying, look out of rooms x01 to x09 on each floor of the main tower and it is fairly obvious what needs to be done. 2. The practice of Pre-authorisation on credit cards has gone wrong in the past and has locked Credit cards out... This usually solves itself and the staff and management are always most helpful in this regard. This seems to have been resolved now however... 3 The beer is too gassy, this is apparently due to the distance the beer has to be raised from the cellar to the tap, the larger the drop between tap and keg the higher the pressure of CO2 (or CO2 substitute) that needs to be applied to the keg to get it to flow out of the tap. This leads to higher CO2 absorption and therefore the more gas in the beer, which can leave you, the customer, somewhat bloated... Perhaps a visit from a beer dispense expert might provide a solution to resolve this... So 3 minor issues, 1 resolved 2 minor or quick to resolve... I really do recomend this hotel most highly...

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip to Madrid, Spain”
Reviews.Author: MikeCheshire
Reviews.Content: Visited Madrid on business. Stayed at the Hilton Madrid Airport hotel for 1 week. Very conveniently located. Reception staff are friendly, welcoming and pleasant. The rooms are quite classy, especially the layout and the bathrooms. Internet connection via WiFi was excellent and fast. The gym, though tiny, is well-equipped. The swimming pool is a great spot! The cuisine in the main restaurant is fabulous - i had some really good Spanish food; restaurant staff very friendly. Suggestion - could improve range of breakfast layouts. Overall, nice place. Will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “What a killer hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cobrandy
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel with well-appointed rooms. Frosted glass, cool sink and shower area, very comfortable bed, hardwood floors, clean lines and nice lighting. The room service was prompt and the sea bass with vegetables and the fruit salad were really nice. The fitness facility is great. not a lot of equipment, but what they have is nice. Although it was closed when I went to work out, it looks like they have a cool aerobics area. They have a dry sauna and a wet one. The wet one smelled really moldy and gross, but the dry one was great!

Reviews.Title: “not far from the airport”
Reviews.Author: professor_lone
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated not far from the airport and has a free shuttle which can get you there and back. There is also an Alameda del Osuna metro station about 10 minutes walk (it can get you to the centre of Madrid) but it is a bit tricky to find. If you have an early flight, the hotel is quite convenient, thought if you need to be at the historical centre, it will take you quite a lot of time to get there. The rooms are black and white with a modern bathroom with transparent glass sink and folding doors. I enyoyed the stay, the free shuttle was very concenient and the staff friendly

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Modern, Great Location, Free Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: blissmar
Reviews.Content: A very funky, modern decor to the max hotel. The staff was very knowledgeable and helpful. They suggested areas that were safe and fun to walk in the wee hours of the night. Airport Shuttle was free and prompt. I will defiently stay here again next time in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Building, Rooms, Location great, Service needs training”
Reviews.Author: JAUrlaub
Reviews.Content: Reservation done by booking.com, arraival late night, call for transfer, answer i can't tell you where the Bus is you have to wait maybe 25 minute. Missing staff training. thanks I take a Taxi. Check in fast and ok not more, The room fasion nice but cold, not preheated, sorry. Special order by Hilten Service via internet, sorry not delivered to the room, fresh fruits and sparkling water, next day Breakfast, 35 minutes in the Restaurnat nobody is asking you, coffee tea or any other services, the F&B Manager walking around he must be blind, nobody of the F&B Department likes to great you it seems this is a very strong sleeping Department, but finaly the Receptionist was very friendly and apologised for the missing services and the minibar was for free, thanks for that, the transfer from the Hotel to the Airport worked out perfect, thank you see u again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean and convenient but could improve on customer service”
Reviews.Author: Snowflakesnsun
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here and I was very pleased with my choice. Had a large room with king size bed, very comfortable and clean. The power outlets are close to the bed which meant I could comfortable work on my laptop in bed for a long time. Bathroom spotless and with modern amenities - mine had a tub and a separate shower. Close to the airport with easy access to the airport by the free airport shuttle; didn't have to wait long for it either. Downside: hotel is located in a office park close to the highway hence nothing interesting around for recreation. If you don't need to be near the hotel, I would not recommend this hotel. Poor service : had to wait a long time for service in the breakfast room both days + gave up on getting a drink one evening when the waiter took too long coming to my table (close to 20 minutes!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hilton Madrid”
Reviews.Author: JamSwiss
Reviews.Content: I was in Madrid for a conference in January and I can't wait to go back. Arrival: The airport shuttle arrived only a few minutes after I walked out of the terminal and it was a short ride to the hotel. Check-in: I arrived at 9am, after almost 15 hours of traveling I was worried that i wasn't going to get a room, but I checked in right away. Room: SPECTACULAR! For Europe it was a decent size, the design was lovely. I LOVED LOVED the bathroom, for Europe to have a tub is very rare and I just love the design of the bathroom. Beds were super comfy! I really liked the room. Only thing is that Wifi is not free and can be quite costly. I used 'business the 1st 2 days and then saved some money by using the 'economy' option. which is good for just checking emails. No issues with housekeeping, room was cleaned daily. Food: I had the breakfast 2 days during my stay. I didn't get the plan in my room rate (which is a good idea if you know you are going to have breakfast). Food was excellent. I had room service one night. It is a little pricey but food arrived quickly and was good. There is a mall about 15minutes walk from the hotel. Great shopping and not far at all. This hotel is great if you are going to IFEMA for a conference or need to be near the airport. The city is a bit far and can be expensive in a cab. but the metro is available at the airport. I did that once. Took the shuttle to the airport then the metro to madrid and back to the airport then I just hopped on the shuttle. Love this hotel and I'll be back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Funky building, great rooms. Slick and sharp.”
Reviews.Author: fishinwater
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a few minutes away from the terminals and a shuttle bus picks you up every 10 to 15 minutes. Very convenient if you need to be near the airport for an early departure. The outside of the building is nothing much but it is very nice architecturally on the inside. Main reception is once and there are many areas to relax drink and eat. The style is quite modern and they use a nice splash of colour. Service is very attentive and professional. Rooms are nicely designed and continue the stylish architecture and fittings. The main bedroom is good and the bathroom is quite uniquely extraordinary with numerous full length mirrors, glass sinks, dark couloir with blue lights and a bide. Seats and office area is again well appointed and modern. Overall, a very nice experience. Not in a nice part of town but a great place for a quick overnight visit.

Reviews.Title: “How to lose a frequent traveler over 4€ per day”
Reviews.Author: markdafedman
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, it's too bad the whole experience was marred by "policy". The hotel is new, fairly clean, and relatively well maintained. I woke up the first morning to a mini- bar flooding the room. The staff corrected this and replaced the mini- bar before my return that afternoon. The housecleaning service was not the best. One day, I watched the maid merely brush off the bedsheets, make a mad dash through the bathroom, and disappear in 4 minutes flat. There was always hair on the floor in the room in the corners and the carpeting outside the room was constantly dirty. The Hilton website is extremely non- intuitive, and logs users out after 10 minutes. Another nice touch, and really invites potential customers in. I stayed here for 7 days during a business trip based on the recommendations of a colleague. Upon checking in, I was informed that breakfast was an extra 20€, then I was informed that breakfast was included. No mention of a rate change was made. I signed their little check in form and everything was fine. My colleague had made parallel reservations and stayed a few days less than I, therefore he was not around at check out to make a correction. Upon getting back to the office and comparing notes, I found I was charged 4€ more per day. Upon calling the hotel, I was told that I did not get the government rate. Odd, considering that my colleague got the government rate, and he made reservations for both of us. I was informed that since I signed their little contract, they would not adjust the rate. Thanks so much, Hilton. I won't be returning to your properties in the future! At least Holiday Inn appreciates my business. Disappointing, indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Christos M
Reviews.Content: Hilton airport is an excellent hotel. Located close to Barajas airport, its convenient for business meetings or for overnight stays. Located 15 km from Madrid center. (metro takes about 30-40 min and taxi costs 20 euros to plaza de mayor or puerta del sol). Hotel provides a shuttle bus to transfer customers from the airport to the hotel that is easy to find and provides a very quick transfer. Hotel is modern, clean with great restaurant (astonished by the dishes), and well trained and efficient personnel. Rooms are great. Big, clean with a fantastic WC. They provide a dedicated PC used for web check in, which I found very helpful. Only negative comment is about some dirty spots at the corridors. Nothing important, probably a useless detail but in my opinion a perfect image is ruined. Nevertheless without hesitation, if they improve this area, Hilton airport deserves a 5/5 rating.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent airport hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Domer82
Reviews.Content: The primary reason to stay in this hotel is for business and needing to stay close to the airport. I would NOT recommend this hotel is you are travelling as a tourist. If you don't have a need to go into to downtown Madrid and have business on the outskirts on the north side of the city this is a very comfortable hotel. I have stayed here three times. The rooms are very modern and comfortable. The staff is very attentive and breakfast is the best of any airport hotel in the world. The shuttle service to and from the airport is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flaesb
Reviews.Content: Soaring lobby (artium style) with glass elevators. Current, new, modern, and a wonderful hotel. Room was large, as was marble bathroom. Breakfast was delicious and beautifully presented. Airport van takes 7 minutes to and from airport and is free. This hotel is not a perfect choice if you are visiting Madrid for sightseeing, but we did our last night at this hotel due to its proximity to the airport after a few days in Madrid at another wonderful hotel. There is a metro line a few blocks away, but it is quite a ride into the center of the city. One of the best "airport" hotels I have found.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lovely facilities for travellers passing through airport”
Reviews.Author: HighlandRacer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Madrid Airport overnight on a business trip. There is a free shuttle bus every 20 minutes but in the interests of time I jumped on a taxi which came to €25. The staff at reception were very friendly and kindly offered a free wifi voucher on request. I received a free upgrade to a 'relaxation room' - very spacious, jacuzzi bath and lots of space to work. Hassle free, good quality accommodation with and a gym to keep fit. The only downside is the lack of obvious running routes outside but that is not unreasonable for an airport hotel. I will definitely be staying here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Only wish it was connected to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Traveler8Colorado
Reviews.Content: We/I stay here whenever traveling through Madrid and have a stop over. The shuttle between the airport and the hotel is a bit of a pain but the service and rooms are excellent. Breakfast is pretty good and the lounge is nice. This stay I requested extra water to be sent up to the room at checkin. After 30 min of waiting up in the room, I called down to the desk and asked again. 45 mins later and another call, I spoke with the manager on duty who was very apologetic and ensured the issues were addressed and we received our water as requested. His response and service was ideal and hopefully he's addressed the root causes so going forward others don't experience the service gap as well. I will return to this hotel any time I need a place to crash between flights.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton makes the difference at the airport”
Reviews.Author: fran07Belgium
Reviews.Content: It is a 5 * Hotel and it makes the difference: big rooms, astonishing atrium, excellent breakfast buffet and very professional staff. Hilton Madrid puts the rest of the airport hotels in the shadow. Due to my HHonors gold status I obtained executive floor rooms. There is a lounge with free PCS (Macs!!!) and drinks, wine included. The breakfast buffet is close to perfection with a waiter always ready to refill your coffee. Reception staff very professional and friendly. Free shuttle transport to the airport terminals. Customers were mainly American travelling and connecting in premium classes. If you can afford it, it is a choice second to none at Madrid's airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Wonderful bathroom, Tasty Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TravelNowSwUsa
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here before a morning flight. The staff is very professional and multi-lingual. The architecture is very modern and the bathrooms are a wonder with both a deep tub and a big shower with strong water pressure. The breakfast buffet has a variety of foods along with someone who makes eggs to order. Worth paying extra to get to the Executive floor where from 6PM to 9 PM there are free drinks and tapas. Coffee, tea, snacks available other times. Free wifi in the rooms. The van to/from the airport are frequent. We will stay here again. Good sound insulation.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: VCUgrad
Reviews.Content: Very modern and contempory hotel which makes it appear very cold and stark. I did not particularly care for the decor, but it is nonetheless comfortable and quite. The staff is very friendly and extremely helpful. The airport shuttle runs very frequently which is convenient. The walk to the Metro station from the hotel is about 10-15 minutes; however, one can take the shuttle to the airport and pick up the Metro (or buses) there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and convenient hotel for Madrid Airport”
Reviews.Author: JMarpleInc
Reviews.Content: Whilst this is not the most attractive of hotels externally its location close to the airport, it is very convenient and the rooms very comfortable. They offer a free pick up/return service just outside the arrivals exit (a little to the left at T4, away from the long distance and local buses). They run roughly every 20 mins and journey time is about 15 minutes, dependent upon the order of terminal visits – check with reception. We found the check in staff very friendly and helpful. The bedrooms are modern and roomy with good showers, large baths and fluffy towels. The transparent basins can be a bit of a challenge as it’s not always easy to see where the flat surface ends and the curve of the basin begins so you may find things slipping inwards if you are not careful – not a big issue generally but annoying if it’s something that needs to stay dry. The hotel has an excellent Executive Lounge on the 4th floor open most of the day – there is internet access and printers, snacks in the afternoon and evening. The main restaurant on the ground floor is efficient and when we stayed offered champagne at breakfast – on its own or as a Bucks Fizz.

Reviews.Title: “Lush..and cozy!”
Reviews.Author: GyPsYs0uL
Reviews.Content: Awww is really all I want and need to say, but given that people want more, here goes it... Very clean, amazing staff, and the room is divine! I was looking forward to a night of rest and relaxation before heading home and I go it! The King standard room was a very nice treat. The bathroom has a bath(albeit small) as well as a shower. Very chic, very clean, and not expensive due to booking through Hilton Honors. the word "bueno" does not give it justice..more like PRIMO!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but where's the 5-star service ?”
Reviews.Author: cowchaser
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a 5 day stay at the Hilton Madrid and I should describe it as a mixed experience. The rooms and hotel interior are certainly up to standards but it's the staff that make it a less than 5 star experience. Checkin was smooth (although no help offered with our luggage) but after that we only encountered hotel staff that even appeared grumpy at times. Service with a smile ? Not at the Hilton Madrid, Any request for service especially during breakfast (f.e. asking for a cappuccino instead of the extremely strong standard brew) was followed but in a way that made it clear this was a bit too much to ask for. When one morning I pointed out that the floor underneath our designated table was littered with egg shells and other food remains we were offered another table that clearly had the same problem. A cleaning lady was called in and she made an argument with he waiter on why this couldn't wait until after breakfast.... not good... a clean floor is a must in any restaurant imho. Maybe the double use of tables is caused by the fact that most hotel guests are put in the corner closest to the kitchen making walking distance for the waiters less ? I should mention the food served at the breakfast buffet was of good quality. Swimming pool and gym are nice but the shower and floor in the changing room were just filthy, The rooms were kept tidy and clean but one night we found a carton card at the door that indicated we used the " don't disturb " sign so our rooms weren't cleaned. We clearly didn't use any " don't disturb" hangers at the doors so we just called the reception to get us some clean towels.which arrived after a couple of minutes. No explanation offered to why this had happened. I'm always happy to leave a tip on every stay when I get good service from house-keeping but was so surprised that while packing before checking out my wife found a "tip begging note" inside our suitcase. This is simply NOT DONE... period. Overall the staff made this an average experience in what could be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Madrid Airport lives up to what the name Hilton used to mean!”
Reviews.Author: merhabaabi
Reviews.Content: With its ultra-modern style, its soaring lobby and spacious rooms and excellent service, this Hilton provides all that a good hotel should. If you want an added experience, for a modest extra fee, book on the executive floor, where you'll be treated to a complimentary cocktail time with excellent hors d'ouevres, plus computer access and a breakfast buffet which is a work of art! And--the airport is barely 5 minutes using the hotel shuttle, which runs every 20 minutes! (Our only regret is that this time (our 3rd) we were not able to turn in our Sixt rental car, as Sixt had recently moved out of there).

Reviews.Title: “On your way to the city”
Reviews.Author: Nono_Minou
Reviews.Content: I was going to land very late and did not want to be downtown Madrid as I had a meeting some where in the middle between the airport and the city. I had been booked at the Hilton Madrid airport. A bit cold as hotel but certainly very well located for a conference or a larget meeting. The hotel is indeed big and modern but a bit cold. My room was excellent with a very nice bathroom (very important for me). The bed was good and the room in general. Very mordern and clean. The breakfast was nice in a very large open area. For a business trip or meeting yes the hotel is great. For a weekend with my wife then I would select a hotel downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value”
Reviews.Author: Stephen P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. Being from the states, this Hilton was amazing compared to even the highest end Hilton in the states. The rooms were gorgeous, the bathroom was huge and it felt like I was in a spa with the amazing shower. Even though the hotel is close to the airport (they have free shuttle service from the airport to the hotel). It was a short 10 minute walk to the train station where you can take the train and go into downtown Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Still one of my favourite airport hotels.”
Reviews.Author: evapor8
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd stay at this hotel. Booked during the December sale, I had a suite (room 211) with breakfast for EUR 187. I'm pretty sure I've stayed in this room before, and there are some things familiar and some differences: coffee table in lounge area has gone; glass doors between lounge and bedroom don't shut (or open!) There is now an iron and ironing board in the room; mini bar is well stocked but expensive; room service is expensive but some reasonable, tasty choices and served quickly; free wifi in room (for HHonors gold/diamond anyway.) Staff on the front desk are both pleasant and helpful. There's a shuttle bus too/from the airport terminals, and apparently there's one that goes into central Madrid. I love the styling of this hotel and will happily continue to use it, but there are a few loose ends that need tying up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business”
Reviews.Author: Lingwobe
Reviews.Content: A super modern hotel - quite a minimalist theme and quite a cool place to stay, the main hall is a huge (9 floor) cube with a polished floor which has a dramatic event, good modern gym facilities, stood out for me despite being in many Hiltons over many years. Food and staff where excellent. Its slightly out of town (was not a problem for me) so not best placed for the city centre which would be a pain on a tourist trip, but is 10 mins from the airport. One point to note - none of the taxi drivers seems to know how to get there so take a map print out or fire up Google maps in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: liveyourlifegood
Reviews.Content: After a very average stay at the hotels sister hotel in Barcelona I had better expectations of this hotel. The Hilton Madrid has five stars and the rate was quite cheap for a five star hotel but the location provides this price too. I arrived around 21.45 at the Madrid Barajas airport and after collecting my luggage I proceeded outside where it was 4 degrees Celcius. I waited at the bus stop for the hotels Shuttle bus. I had to wait about ten minutes before the new Mercedes van came to pick us up. The driver took our luggage and put it in the back and we seated in the little bus. The bus was very luxurious and after a 10 minute ride we arrived at the hotel. I took my luggage inside and proceeded to the Hhonors check in. Our 3 night stay was booked under Hilton Hhonors Gold membership. I had to wait a few minutes and I checked in with Ms. Mihaela. She was first very friendly and asked if I had a good trip etc. She explained some things in the hotel and told me there were two towers and I could choose in which one I wanted my room to be. I took the central tower and got a room on the 3rd floor. However she refused me access to the club lounge, refused give me breakfast instead, internet or a room upgrade. I was at all not happy with it but I then asked if I could speak with her supervisor. He was busy but she went to the offices behind the reception and then she said they made a big exception and I will get complimentary breakfast during my stay. I was not very happy but I was tired so I would arrange it next day. I took one of the three glass elevators to the third floor and my room was almost at the corner of the hotel. I entered my room and it was way too hot. I immediately put the air conditioning on the lowest but it still did not cool properly. On the right side of the room was a walk in bathroom with shower, bath, sink and another glass door with a toilet behind it. There was a mix from old and new bath products but in one of my towels was a hole in it. Opposite of the bathroom was a closet with safe. I had a big King bedded room with a big TV, desk and a very nice red chair. I had no view at all. I looked on the indoor swimming pool and other rooms from the other tower. There was no welcome drink, no fruit or not even a complimentary bottle of water in the room. Also there was a kettle but no tea bags or coffee. Next morning around 10.00 I proceeded to the main restaurant for breakfast in the atrium next to the Christmas tree. I had to wait a while before someone came and took me to a table but a man brought me to a table but did not ask if I wanted to drink something or did not even bring orange juice. I was sitting there for about 10 minutes and still nobody of the three staff members came to me and I had to watch people entering the restaurant and they are brought to the table and they get orange juice and they are asked if they want to drink something. After a while again, I asked if I could have a Hot chocolate. I had a look at the buffet. It was good and had a wide choice of charcuterie and especially the fresh smoked salmon was excellent. There are some juices and you can even make a fresh one yourselves. There is a chef and many hot dishes. I made a toast and when I sat at my table I got my hot chocolate. I received a small can of milk and a cheap bag with powder on my table. I was shocked to receive it in a 5 star hotel. I could not even expect this in a three star hotel and it was more like a self service highway restaurant breakfast. On my table were a few dirty and empty glasses and plates but everyone failed to take them away for me. I had to eat next to dirty plates. Food was filled by sometimes but service was nonexistent. Next after breakfast I proceeded to the reception because they sell small souvenirs I asked somebody from the reception for buying a Madrid Bull, and I asked if I needed to pay cash. He told me that it was the best thing to do. I so got my wallet from my room and asked to Mr. Hernan for buying the bull but he told me there were all sold out. The other receptionist tols there still where some so he looked and there were still some. It took a while but I received my small bull. Then I asked him the front desk supervisor. Mr. Martin came to me and I asked him about the lounge access and benefits and he immediately apologized for it and gave me a key card for access to the executive lounge and some internet vouchers. He was very, very friendly and helpful too. I asked to Mr. Luis for the shuttle bus and I reserved the shuttle bus to the city center at 12.15 just after noon. At 12.07 I got a telephone call from reception saying if I still wanted to come because everyone was waiting for me. I answered that I have still 8 minutes but I came downstairs. The bus was full but I was put in the front seat next to someone else and it was extremely tight and I felt closed in by the other guest. The driver had turned all air-conditioning and heating out so there was no air circulation in the car. After 20 minutes we arrived in the city center, close to the Prado Museum and other highlights. After diner around 21.00 I arrived back in the hotel and went to the club lounge. Strangely Ms. Mihaela, who checked me in was now working in the club lounge. The afternoon snacks were gone and there was still some drinks, chips and alcoholic drinks. The lounge was modern but not very big. There were two computers and a printer. Soft drinks and beers are available the whole day. Ms. Mihaela was very busy and stood alone in the lounge. There were some guests asking for difficult strong spirits so she had to take care of that but then there was nobody left in the club lounge so there were still some empty glasses and plates. When she came back she cleared everything and she did her outmost best. Sometimes another very friendly staff member takes some carts with empty glasses out of the lounge. Ms. Mihaela does her outmost best and everyone gets a very personal service and she is very guest minded, an excellent example how every staff member in the hotel has to be. Maybe in the weekend an extra staff member is needed in the lounge and in the morning in the restaurant. The club lounge closed at 23.00 and I went back in my room and slept well. Next morning again breakfast and I told Mr. Martin about breakfast previous day and he promised me it would not happen again. Unfortunately when I waited for getting a table I had to wait again 5 minutes before someone came to me and gave me a table. There is a clear sign saying wait here to be seated but I cannot wait forever. A lady brought me to a table but again did not gave me orange juice or asked if I wanted something to drink. Ten minutes later again nothing, nobody came or passed my table and again the manager gives orange juice and drinks to everybody but me when they enter the restaurant. I asked if Mr. Carlos would come and I confronted him with the fact I was waiting for someone to give me something to drink and asked why he brings orange juice but the other staff members don’t. He answered arrogantly that we have to order and if we do not order they assume I do not want to drink anything. I was shocked of his arrogant reaction. He left, without asking what I would like to drink. One minute later he turned around and asked what I would like to drink. I said I want a hot chocolate, but not a bag and milk on my table but one cup of hot chocolate. He did not understand me and came back 5 minutes later that he does not have a drink like that. I had to explain him that I want a cup with hot milk and powder in it and that stirred. He finally understood it and brought it to me later on. Food was again good but on a moment there were a lot of things empty, bread, jamon, fruit. Maybe it was a change of shift because ten minutes later everything was filled by again. I came back from the city center around 17.30 and headed for the club lounge. Again the friendly Ms. Mihaela was working in the lounge and was preparing for the evening snacks. She was working alone, very hard. The snacks were rather limited and it were not the best one I have eaten. There were some cakes and pastries and some breads and some hot snacks. I spoke the whole evening with some other guests and around 20.30 Ms. Mihaela came and asked if wee needed still something from the buffet as it closed a bit later. Ms. Mihaela was very caring about her guests but left sometimes when other people needed her downstairs. I asked her for a late check out and I got one at 15.00 and after that I printed my boarding card from the designated computer in the lobby, free of charge. Next morning last breakfast and I was greeted on time and brought to a table by the manager, Mr. Carlos and he informed me he could make fresh hot chocolate that day. In the afternoon I checked out with Ms. Ana and Ms. Mihaela and I took the shuttle bus to the airport. The hotel is located very close to the airport but no noise at all as the runway and paths of airplanes do not cross the hotel. There is a free shuttle bus to all terminals every 15 minutes. To reach the city center you can either take the very less frequent shuttle bus to the city center or walk 15 minutes to the closest metro and then sit in it for about 15 stops, 30 minutes. The hotel is located in the middle of nowhere but next to the metro station is a supermarket but no restaurants in the neighborhood. I would definitely stay again in the hotel if service is better in some departments. Some staff members are excellent like Mr. Martin and Ms. Mihaela, both a terrific example how everyone has to be. The hotel is an example for other ones with a Facebook and Twitter pages

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with wonderful airport shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: wpmchesternj
Reviews.Content: The Madrid Hilton at Barajas Airport is a superb hotel. My wife and I were returning to Madrid from a wonderful stay in Mallorca and needed an overnight "transitional" hotel before we flew home to the United States. The staff were very helpful, the shuttle service was superb, and they happened to have a special offer for breakfast/internet that saved significant Euros. We will certainly stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skibuff
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel! A very modern property with free shuttle (10 minutes) to the airport. I stayed the night before a flight back to the States and was impressed. The hotel staff were exemplary and fast to respond to any question or request.. The Front desk staff upgraded me to what they called a relaxation room. The room was huge by Euro standards and included a large jacuzzi tub, separate shower and a toilet / bidet area. It also included a separate work area with multiple outlets and lighting and a very comfortable office chair. This was in addition to another table and chair set and a makeup area for the ladies. Also included in the furnishings was an Eams style while leather chair and ottoman. The Executive lounge (courtesy access with my Gold status with HHonors status) was larger than most I have been in. Food and drink selections were good as was the self serve bar area which was available for about 4 hours in the evening. This definitely will be my hotel when flying from Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised! Upgrade for free!!! Everyone could have it”
Reviews.Author: UY2011
Reviews.Content: I was positively suprised at check in as the Recepcionist offered me to play a Quizz (Q&A) in order to redeem upgrade for free for this stay. I answered the 5 questions right and they gave me a better room. When I asked why me or why this action they said it's because you are a HH member and we wanted to recognise that you are loyal to Hilton" By the way, the questions were not so difficult, as they were honouring Guests from Spain they said I was able to answer them all right!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good - Speed is always Important specially in Airport Hotels and they complied.”
Reviews.Author: ArBy777
Reviews.Content: Hilton was nice enough to send me an email inviting me for a FREE upgrade (as HHonors Member), and I accepted. So this was already given before I got there, and I did not even have to ask for it. Thats how it should be for Elite members. I had obtained a good rate as I reserved/paid in advance, so with the upgrade (executive floor, FREE breakfast and Internet) the value for money was excellent. I arrived and did not even go to the room as someone was picking me up for lunch, and he called and asked me for a banana for his son, and the hotel was quick and efficient in getting it. Check in was VERY SPEEDY, though I had checked-in on line, and already had the room allocated. When I was checking in, I needed to send an email and they were very fast in giving me the access codes. The problem with the Internet was that you can only connect ONE item at a time, and my son was with me with his laptop and iPad, I had my Laptop, iPad and iPhone, so we had to take it in turns to connect. I arrived back at the hotel late at night, and we were checking out in the AM so I did not really see anything of the hotel, but what I did see was excellent. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were nice and big. The Twin room had TWO single beds, not TWIN beds. My son was in bed and the only problem, which I had seen in other reviews was finding the light switch of the toilet (I never did not at night nor in the morning). Due to the modern glass separations in the room (room/bathroom/toilet, the room is not adequate for sharing with people you are not too comfortable with). There was limited Shower-Gel for a twin room, and when you are in a hurry in the morning sometimes you can't afford to call house keeping and wait, so we had to use the soap bars - so it was not total chaos. Also by mistake there were 2 conditioners in the shower but no Shampoo. Breakfast was good though I only had tea and toast, but I checked the whole setup. The toaster was very good. The shuttle service was in time, and there was a large group, so it filled up, but the drivers/bellboy were quick enough to decide that the other coach should also go, and in one minute the problem was solved. Also the distance if you are going to T1,2,or 3 is very very near. T4 is further, but I think there are no hotels much nearer to T4. Overall EXCELLENT hotel for airport and if you get the prepaid rates an excellent value. All the staff were courteous, and efficient. Also noticed they had a car rental desk, which I did not use, but always nice specially in Airport hotels. Might even repeat even if I don't have an early morning flight. Great.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Otto O
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife had a terrible stay @ the Hilton Madrid. First of all the location.... I'm used to staying at other hotels from the Hilton Group and there unique selling point is said to be Location, Location, Location. This Hotel is situated next to an airport and highway, great location..... We were charged for using the minibar, which we did not use. After making a complaint to the General Manager (who reeked of alcohol (@ two o'clock in the afternoon)), he assured us that, after paying for our stay, I would receive a refund from the wrongly charged minibar costs on my bankaccount. It has been 2 weeks sinds our stay and I still haven't received a refund!! I will never stay @ this hotel again. Kind regards, O. Orkwal

Reviews.Title: “modern, clean and huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: MHL8488
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest Hiltons I have stayed in. Booked this hotel for an early flight out. Though I took a taxi to the hotel from the airport, I took advantage of the free shuttle on the morning of my flight. The food in the restaurant was excellent, the check in smooth and the rooms super clean and super quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, but hard to find shuttle at airport”
Reviews.Author: newflyer
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the Madrid airport at night I could not find anyone that spoke English to ask where to get the complimentary shuttle to this hotel and the signage was not very good. When I finally found it, it was the last spot of the que. The hotel was not very close to the airport but the driver got us there and back the next day. What a ride! I think this guy took 23 different turns. At one point we were going down a one way street or roadway and another car came directly at us with their flashers on, obviously lost. The shuttle driver was able to stop and let them go by us without incident. The hotel was clean, quiet and nicely appointed. The tv showed some English speaking channels, always a plus. I did not eat breakfast at the hotel as it was quite expensive, I got it at the airport instead. The bed was very comfortable and check out was easy and quick. The shuttle back to the airport was on time and worked out fine. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBATL
Reviews.Content: Perfect for business travel or airport stay-overs. New and modern, with extremely friendly staff. I wish more hotels were this nice for business travel. Even the free airport shuttle is new.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new and good value”
Reviews.Author: trinzeon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in November. Was upgraded to executive room on 5th floor as i checked in after 1 a.m. and regular rooms were taken. Well decorated (modern), but small room for executive room. Excellent bedding. All amenity bathroom. Good breakfast (though expensive). Effortless shuttle. Had to take a taxi because i arrived very late and that was total ripoff (25 euro). Staff very helpful and courteous. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Minttu M
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at Hilton Madrid have only positive things to say. Already my first touch with this hotels was very pleasant, as the airport shuttle bus driver welcomed me with a nice smile! Check in was very efficient and team extremely helpfull answering my questions. Distance from the city centre was absolutely not a problem, as the hotel has shuttle bus service and also the airport is well connected with public airport express bus. When I was on my way out, printing my boarding pass the connection was slow, the receptionist offered to take me to the executive lounge to print my document. Everyone in that hotel has a smile on their face ;)

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Efficient”
Reviews.Author: mrosen94
Reviews.Content: Oddly, i stayed at this hotel with my family on a recent visit to Madrid only because it was the local hilton option and not because we were utilizing the airport. The hotel, is impeccably clean, modern and well stocked. The executive floor is spartan but functional. The staffs are professional and attentive. the gym looks great and they have a beautiful pool but it was not heated so visiting in November made the water a little too cold for my children's liking. the highlight for me was the lobby bar which specializes in gin tonic variants and provided wonderful late hour drinks for us to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you need to stay near Barajas”
Reviews.Author: PassportandVisa
Reviews.Content: Stayed just for one night as we had an overnight transfer at MAD. The hotel has a very convenient shuttle and is only about 10 minutes from the airport. The room is ultra modern but comfortable. One thing I did not personally care for was the floor, it was a hard concrete type material (vs. hardwood or carpet) and not the most "warm" feeling. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was a great spread. Omlettes made on demand and any type of cuisine to suit your taste. Access to the Executive Lounge was also in our rate but wasn't really worth the extra cost, only a handful of items on offer and was completely deserted when we visited. As other posters have commented, only stay here if you need access to the airport. If time allows, I would recommend staying in Central Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not For The Shy”
Reviews.Author: travelman1370
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 421 of this hotel for one night; two weeks later we stayed in another room on the same floor. It is close to the airport but I would not stay here and try to sight-see in Madrid, you’re just too far away (the taxi ride from the train station in downtown Madrid to here was about 22E including tip). The hotel is ultra modern in design and you’ll either love it or hate it. There are two towers and all rooms appear to open off the atriums. Our room was smallish but they manage to fit in a desk and an easy chair; the space is extremely well used. The bed was a queen size. Check-in was efficient and polite both times. Things to keep in mind: first, this is evidently a conference center type of hotel. When the conference groups have dinner in the atrium you may hear some noise from that (not much but it’s there). If there are conference groups at the hotel you may also find that they have mobbed some of the facilities (this was the case our first night there). Another thing to keep in mind is that the room is ultra modern meets industrial in design. Our bathroom was enclosed in fogged glass panels. The toilet is behind another set of fogged glass panels. I wouldn’t want to share this room with someone that I wasn’t really comfortable with as there is little left to the imagination. The sliding glass panel doors don’t completely close all the way by design so you’re never going to have real privacy. The room has an adequate amount of storage. Everything you’ll need is here, including a kettle and a bedside clock (unusual in Spain based on my experience). Once the sun set our AC seemed to make progress on cooling down the room; the room get the brutal afternoon sun this time of year and really heats up. There is a tiny, tiny balcony outside our room and a door that actually opens onto it. Think more of a catwalk. I can’t imagine why anyone would want to make use of that tiny thing. My big disappointment with this hotel was the bar staff (this is also where you'll eat if you don't feel like a sit down dinner in the restaurant). If you ask them for something specific they’re quick to respond but they seem to have little, if any, initiative to do things on their own. Both of the times we were there (as well as friends of ours who were there earlier) we found that in the bar area you need to go get the bartender’s/server’s attention if you want anything. They’ll do what you ask but that’s it (it never seems to occur to them to ask if you want another drink, if you have everything you need, if there’s anything else they can get you, etc.). We found the same type of behavior in the dining area during the morning buffet. Extra expense: they charge 17E/day for internet, which is ridiculous. Drinks are over priced. The morning breakfast buffet is absurdly priced if you have to pay for it by itself but it seems you can get it at a discount either when you first book the room or when you first check-in, but you'll have to ask for it (when we asked at check-in they offered us a package price for breakfast and internet service). There is shuttle service between the hotel and the airport. Dining options are very limited here. So, bottom line, if you’re looking to fly out early and want a place for the night, and you’re not shy in the bathroom, this is an option. The high-tech design is interesting and fun to experience but I can’t say that I was impressed by it (allow extra time to find all the light switches). You may want to investigate less expensive and more friendly options if time allows. Heck, if time allows, I’d stay in Madrid itself.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport and that's it”
Reviews.Author: george01
Reviews.Content: The only redeming qualities of this glass montrosity of a hotel were the proximity to the airport and plenty of cava at breakfast. The reception staff were nasty, and I was given a room in the annex building which took for ever to get to, and they lost electricity and I couldn't find the room. I guess they couldn't care less that I was a HitonHomors member for a long time. The restaurants' staff were nice and helpful (try the garlic soup, nothing like one would immagine and quite tasty). The light switches in the bathroom are something else to find, another challenge.

Reviews.Title: “Clueless Concierge and poor HHonors Diamond service”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrank
Reviews.Content: I had a one night points stay from 3-4 November and I had a problem getting a response for availability of early check in followed by a "concierge" who directed me to an excellent restaurant for "cochinillo" that did not serve cochinillo, and swore they had never served cochinillo. This was followed by a front desk that did not provide me with a log-in for the internet and then insisted in coming to my room to provide the internet password rather than providing it over the phone. The elements may be there for a good hotel, but the leadership is failing!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great staff. Why can't it be downtown?”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAlli
Reviews.Content: I love how some of my favorite international Hiltons are airport hotels. Beautiful, modern, and comfortable...and nowhere near where you want to be. Such is the Hilton Madrid Airport. Obviously very close to the airport with a convenient shuttle that runs well into the evening, but not at all conducive for sightseeing. My reason for the stay was an overnight airport connection, so for me on this visit, the place was perfect. Staff at check-in were remarkably friendly and efficient. Executive floor room was quiet and comfortable. Executive lounge was large with a nice breakfast. Shuttle back to the airport was easy. My only complaint is that a hotel this nice isn't located near the city center.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: buoybell
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of airport hotels, but this is one of the best. As a Hilton Diamond member we were upgraded to an Executive "Relax" room. It was one of the nicest rooms I have stayed in at any Hilton. Bathroom was great, with Jacuzzi tub being a nice treat after a long day of travel. Breakfast was included with our room, and was great; a huge selection of foods from around the world. Staff were very helpful and friendly. My only compaint is that the hallways are very dark. Searching for the Ice Machine was an adventure, and trying to figure out the key slot in the dark was no fun. Otherwise, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place for a quick stopover”
Reviews.Author: csh68
Reviews.Content: My family of four (2 young kids) stayed in the hotel on 3rd week of October because we were meeting friends the next day at the airport. We caught the shuttle service at T2 (located next to the regular bus stop, not so prominent though). We checked into 2 double rooms, located at the convention wing, which was very quiet. Decor and facilities were new, indoor swimming pool was nicely warmed, with LED lights switching colors, making it a beautiful sight. Pool has a sitting area right in the middle for resting while staying in water, water jet at each end for a quick massage. Been to several Hilton hotels before, but the spread in Madrid was different, due to quality of sausages and ham offered. Would recommend if you need a quality hotel for a good rest in Madrid. Only complaint was lack of free WIFI, a common issue in Europe. Taxi to city area ranges between 12 to 20 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Good business class hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichardB100
Reviews.Content: If your on business and don't mind being a little out of the centre of Madrid, this a great comfortable choice. Modern, clean and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for an airport layover”
Reviews.Author: MenloMichael
Reviews.Content: This is a modern, comfortable Hilton that is a good choice for early flights out the next day to avoid an hour travel time from downtown Madrid. The hotel has a wonderful heated pool (as warm as a bathtub) with Jacuzzi-like jets built in. Outstanding blackout curtains in the rooms. I would stay here again for an early morning flight the next day. A hopefully one-time glitch: the airport shuttle is supposed to run every 20 minutes, but the shuttle we took was 25 minutes late. Fortunately we allowed plenty of time to get to the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Tbhines
Reviews.Content: Service was good and room was clean. Executive floor lounge was just "ok" though. Overall it was a nice stay though.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but there are better close to the Madrid airport”
Reviews.Author: Dianeinsf
Reviews.Content: I expected more from this Hilton given the glowing reviews, but this is a typical Hilton, just more modern. The staff are polite and the rooms are clean, but there is nothing memorable about it. Internet access is 22€ and breakfast is extra as well. Opt for another well-reviewed European hotel close to the airport with free Internet and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Go Out In Style”
Reviews.Author: SALMD
Reviews.Content: PRO...VERY PRO: Room and bathroom decor. Breakfast buffet selection. Dinner in the restaurant WAS ONE OF THE TASTIEST, WELL-PRESENTED, & GRACIOUSLY SERVED we had in Spain. Convenience to airport via free shuttle. Nice pool and adequate fitness facility. Average: Front Desk staff inconsistently informative, attentive. Cons: Expensive. Purchasable Wi-Fi. (Would agree with _Mundo_Traveler_11 review about both tepid tea water and glass interface between bathroom & beds

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, consider if "rejuvenation room" is right for you”
Reviews.Author: _Mundo_Traveler_11
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Hilton Madrid Airport. Pros: New building, friendly and well trained staff, nice architecture, nice music that they play in the public areas, excellent bus service to and from Barajas airport terminals. Diamond lounge is nice and I like the tapas that they give in the evening. Cons: I had a “rejuvenation room,” #301, which are larger size rooms located in the corners or the building. The room is big and has nice design, but the window in the bathroom does not have draperies or any way to block out the sun. Since the door from the bathroom to the room is also glass, it is impossible to make the room completely dark if you want to sleep in past sunrise. The exterior window on my room did not have a very good seal when closed and I could hear the traffic from the highway. The buffet breakfast in the atrium has a lot of food but not once during the 5 breakfasts I ate there was the “hot water” to make black tea actually hot. Each time I had to ask the waiter to go into the kitchen to bring me hot water. Also, some of the hot buffet items were always cold, like the baked beans, they were actually cold every morning too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and low cost for a Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: Ferinha
Reviews.Content: We had a layover in Madrid and needed to spend the night. When it comes to European hotels, it's often best to stay with a chain because you know what you're going to get. We had a great room on the 7th floor. Not much for a view in that area, but it was meticulously decorated with a very modern feel. The staff were all very helpful and seem to speak several languages. Shuttle service comes around every 25 minutes. The only reason this hotel didn't get 5 stars is because of a mix up at check out. It seems if you need the shuttle at 5AM that you need to reserve it as it starts regular rounds at 6. I had to shell out EUR 25 for a taxi to go 7 minutes. Annoying, but it certainly wouldn't be a reason for me to not sing the praises of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only one night here”
Reviews.Author: cheezewiz
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here whilst on lay-over. Hotle is very nice. Front desk was very good, a young man at reception was very helpfull, thank you . Room was more set up for bussiness, more so than vacation, and based on the location (by the airport, duh) would be perfect for its intended use. Be expected to pay 23 euro for a hamburger from the restaurant. Also, do not expect good service from the bar. We waited in the lounge for over 1/2 hour just to have our drink order taken. The restaurant girl finally came over (very nice, and apologetic) and took our order. She also brought our drinks and food when it was ready. I should state that the bar/lounge only had six patrons, it was not busy. The only time the bar waiter showed any intrest was when it was time to present the bill, 72 euro. Knowing that the restaurant girl would NOT recieve the tip, there was no tip given. We are Canadian, and we show great service with tipping. This would be our only negative remark. Would I stay here again?, Yes, yes I would. Read the other reviews, they are similiar to ours..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to the airport_Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Bazilu25
Reviews.Content: October 2011: Nice Hilton hotel with modern hotel features (especially the bathroom). Nice pool, nice rooms, friendly staff. Bar and restaurant didn't have what I would consider a great selection of food but rather expensive...Very close to the airport with free shuttle service. Would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bentdavi
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Airport Shuttle, Fantastic breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: SurfVacationer
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed here on our first and last nights of a two week vacation in Spain and Portugal. On the plus side, we didn't have to pay for the room, as we used our Hilton points to pay for it. On the other hand, the non-included charges were almost as much as a Hilton would charge for a room normally. We spent about 2 hours getting to the hotel from the airport. It's only about 5 minutes away, but nobody on the staff could articulate exactly how to get there, and in an airport (with a LOT of signs), it can be very confusing. The fact that the hotel had a sign about 1 foot long, posted at about waist-high at the turn-off, didn't help us find it at all. The service at this hotel is outstanding. maybe it's the friendly Spanish attitude, but we felt immediately that we were welcome and at home. The hotel was quite noisy, but that's less an issue with the hotel, and more an issue with the ten thousand teenagers staying there for World Youth Day 2011. But despite Hormonefest 2011, we still managed to have a quiet, relaxing night. The food is overpriced at this hotel, even for Spain. There is a separate charge for the executive lounge (even for Hilton Gold members like me), and the food in there was adequate at best. A few pieces of room temperature cheese, some cookies, and a few apples; this isn't what I paid an extra 20 Euros per night for. However, the wine might have made up for it...they have a pretty good selection. One tip-unless you ABSOLUTELY have to have internet, don't bother with buying the service. It costs too much for what you get, and is not that reliable. The beds (like most Hiltons) are extremely comfortable...if you need to sleep while you're on a business trip to Madrid, this is the place to do it. And once you find out how the he!! to get around the crazy industrial area the hotel is in, it's really convenient for air travel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a great place”
Reviews.Author: JSMinMN
Reviews.Content: It's by the airport so a bit out of the city. But what a first class place. Diamond upgrade to the exec floor and club was worth a bunch. Got a free room on points so not sure of the prices. Very modern and cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great proximity to Airport and a quick cab ride downtown”
Reviews.Author: conradstx
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times. My return itself is an endorsement of this property. Front desk staff were very good and accommodating. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The breakfast buffet selections are amazing and all delicious. The bar in the evening is decent but very expensive. I think this hotel could attract a much better and larger crowd at the bar if they lowered their prices by about 30 - 40%

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed and modern, extremely comfortable rooms, cool features in the bathrooms, and a delicious half American/ half Spanish style buffet breakfast (which was included in the rate we got online). Free shuttle to the airport. Great service. For an airport hotel, really couldn't ask for more. Of course, not the most convenient place to stay if you are trying to have a vacation in Madrid, but on the way out of the city this is worth a stop if it helps your travel schedule. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, unnecessarily expensive”
Reviews.Author: enixmatix
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located just a short (5-10 min, depending on what terminal) shuttle bus ride from Barajas Airport. I stayed one night while on business. For obvious reasons (it's an airport hotel) the area surrounding the hotel doesn't offer much excitement, you're virtually stuck among warehouses and what looks like factory buildings, so if you plan to base yourself beyond a one-nighter you'll be making a mistake. The big draw with this hotel would be the excellent rooms. I have to say the room are as good as you can expect at any 5 star hotel. They're slick, stylish, spacious, comfortable. Rooms are amazing, let there be no doubt. On the flip side of the coin I would point out a couple of major let downs: 1) The wi-fi is priced at an incredible 20 euros for 24 hours. Which is both unnecessary and annoying. Why charge such an extortionate fee for 24 hours in a hotel where the average guest probably just stays for a night, while waiting for a connection at Barajas. On a general note, there's nothing that annoys me more than hotels who charge for wi-fi, just hide it in the price by adding a couple of euros - it would stop people feeling short changed and ripped off. 2) The attitude of the receptionists was really hit or miss. The guy checking me in was quite professional and friendly, whereas his male colleague checking me out (early morning) got annoyed for some inexplicable reason and didn't even bother saying goodbye! Overall, I'd stay again for the comfort of the room (bed) but I'd expect Hilton to sort out the annoying snags.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pilot-Traveller
Reviews.Content: I simply cannot put into words how well I was looked after during my stay here last year. Staff were incredibly polite and friendly, and all service received at reception and in the bar was excellent. Airport transportation was frequent and free. The hotel is still quite new therefore all areas of the hotel and the rooms are immaculately clean and modern.
