I would advise an executive room to anyone staying on business, as the executive lounge facilities were also excellent. I never ate in the restaurant but availed of the room service several times and the food and wine was of high quality and reasonably priced for a Hilton airport hotel. During my stay the Spanish Air Traffic Controllers went on strike, causing a surge of hopeful travellers descending upon the hotel. I was impressed to see that they immediately deployed extra staff to reception and the bar and although they were fully booked, still dealt with every single tired customer politely and with the courtesy, helpfulness and respect that is sadly lacking in a lot of establishments nowadays. Would happily recommend, and will be returning on my next stopover in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a do over.”
Reviews.Author: teeby
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 with two teenagers and a pre-teen travelling through Spain in the summer of 2011. We stayed for 1 night at the Hilton Madrid Airport. This was the last night of a two week trip. First the positives: The hotel is near the airport and if you are waiting to catch an early flight then this is a good choice since there is a free shuttle that runs to the airport regularly. We also did not hear any airport noise. We visited the pool and found it to be ok the chairs were comfortable but weird. The rooms we had were satisfactory; we requested and received connecting rooms which is nice when travelling with a family. On the down side: the hotel is not convenient to central Madrid, it is about a 30 minute and 25 euro cab ride to get downtown. You can walk to the Metro, but this takes about 20 minutes crossing a busy highway and another at least 40 minute metro ride to Gran Via. There is nothing nearby such as restaurants, shops or attractions. The hotel overlooks a highway on the side we were on, so there is not much to see. The hotel restaurant was very expensive for a buffet and the selection is not very good. The bar was very expensive, as well. The hotel is not warm; it is poorly decorated and feels like you are in a public office building rather than a hotel. The hotel staff were terse they seemed more concerned with getting their work done than serving their customers! The worst part of this stay was that I am a Hilton Honors elite member and received no recognition or benefits whatsoever. As a result of our experience, I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: texasallan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite a bit away from most tourist sites. Once you get to the metro you can get anywhere in Madrid but getting to the metro from the hotel can be a problem. The hotel has a van that will drop you off but returning to the hotel they don't come to the closest metro stop. You need to go to the airport where the hotel van makes a stop. One night upon return we almost missed the last van pickup since they stop pickups at a certain time, I think around 11 pm or 12.am. If you got off at the closer metro stop to the hotel it is quite a walk and you need to take walking bridge across the highway. You also are walking in a closed industrial area maybe not good idea at night. The hotel was modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and very nice”
Reviews.Author: sandjcameron
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at this Hilton for an early morning international flight. Quite modern and very nice and comfortable. About 20 Euro cab ride to historic Plaza Mayor which is full of good sidewalk cafes and shops. Plan on 15 to 20 minute free shuttle ride to the airport. Shuttle leaves about every 20 minutes. Will also pick up at airport

Reviews.Title: “Great for overnight stop in Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: MiddleNameisTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on each end of our Spain trip and the hotel was perfect for our needs. The front desk staff went above and beyond to help us get our 2 families rooms on the same floor. The breakfast buffet was wonderful if a bit pricey. We were given good directions to walk to the subway to take one line right to the centre of Madrid for the few hours we had to explore. We had an excellent dinner at a small local restaurant on the way to the subway, again recommended by the hotel staff. Would definitely recommend as the shuttle bus transfers were comfortable and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Previous reviews are correct this is a great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: dotty500
Reviews.Content: Best airport hotel we have stayed in, staff are very helpful, breakfast buffet is wonderful, will come back again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent end to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: NeilGJ888
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here at the end of a two week family holiday in Southern Spain. We asked for adjoining rooms (as we were travelling with three older childen) and the first rooms we were allocated did not connect. This was addressed quickly and without fuss. The rooms are spacious and clean; the decor modern and stylish. The reception staff were consistently polite, courteous and helful, speaking excellent English. They provided guidance in getting to the Metro as well as suggestions on where to go and where to eat in the city. When my step-daughter lost an earring down the sink, a member of the maintenance staff arrived quickly and was able to retrieve it. The only minor fault was that the breakfast tables were not cleared very quickly. We picked the Airport hotel as it was easy to drop off our hire car and get the Metro into Madrid. It's a bit of a hike to the Metro station (especially in the full heat of August) but from the hotel to the city centre took less than an hour. And the mojito from the hotel bar was one of the best we have tasted! (We did decide that eating an evening meal in the hotel restaurant as originally planned was prohibitively expensive for a family of five...)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you need to be near the airport”
Reviews.Author: StevenPeter
Reviews.Content: Very modern in style with great rooms. Free shuttle to airport. Great club lounge as well. Nice pool and small work out area

Reviews.Title: “Amazing ultra modern high tech rooms and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: netcapital
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are road warriors who were in Europe enjoying a short vacation with friends. We a very early flight and needed a place to stay close to the Madrid Airport. Even though our overnight layover was for a few short hours, we slept peacefully at this wonderful jewel of a hotel. Nicest staff and amenities were great. Free shuttle to airport which is 4 minutes (literally) nearby. This Hilton has a very sleek 21st century high tech setup - not for everyone, especially those that like the more romantic Spanish style, but after years of traveling and staying at what are typically horrible hotels by Airports, this one was a breath of fresh air, business class all the way, and first rate in service delivery!

Reviews.Title: “business hotel at Barajas airport”
Reviews.Author: Jonnnie123142
Reviews.Content: This a business hotel located in Barajas airport. Nice room with super-modern bath-room. There is a fitness room with small swimming pool and sauna. It is possible to walk to metro (appr. 15 min) to get to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hilton I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: angelab59
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic value for money. We stayed for 2 days in between flights, the staff were fantastic and the room spotless. The breakfast was probably the best I have had outside of the UK with a good selection of both hot and cold food. We did not eat any other meals the menu looked good. There was a pool which was a nice touch The reception staff were first class.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel with lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: Anne B
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent three nights at this hotel as it had been recommended by my husband (a diamond card holder). He said it was one of the best Hilton's he had stayed in and I agree totally with his view. Our room was on the first floor which was conveniently situated next to the pool and fitness area - this was what my daughter had come to do. The room was first class - very modern and new, as was the rest of the hotel. On the day of our departure we had an evening flight and were given late checkout, which meant we could enjoy the hotel's facilities longer. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and the hotel is only a 10 minute walk away from the Metro, which took us straight into the centre of Madrid. I would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for airport”
Reviews.Author: Nevilledog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb since there were 3 of us girls traveling together, its the crew hotel so we got the airline rate 120.00 Euros including buffet breakfast and executive lounge access. Great location near airport but its a 400 meter walk to Metro and then at least 17 stops into main downtown area of Madrid. They have a shuttle to airport and thats convenient. The breakfast was fantastic and the executive lounge was also nice. Free afternoon and evening snacks and drinks. Very nice indoor pool. The flight attendants told us there was a mall nearby but we didnt go there.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms, amazing buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ianian76
Reviews.Content: great rooms, good bathroom, very comfortable bed. amazing breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hilton experience ever”
Reviews.Author: mvolkaneser
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Hotel several times, and was always satisfied. Whenever I visit madrid, I definetely book my room in this Hilton, basically because of its perfect location, easy to find and get Airport free Shuttle, extremely friendly, and professional staff. I always feel welcomed in this Hotel. Although room service, and mini bar prices are exaggerated like all Hiltons worlwide, everything else is not less than perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loisbeaty
Reviews.Content: New hotel, rooms large, very clean very comfortable bed. Staff very friendly and speak excellent english.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent end of trip choice.”
Reviews.Author: LC_SugarGlider
Reviews.Content: I've read some complains about the rooms but ours was in admirable conditions. My husband and I only stayed there for one night and we loved it. It's modern and beautiful. I also like the idea that they care about the enviroment. Outstanding service and breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton At It's Best, From a Diamond Member”
Reviews.Author: JPLODI
Reviews.Content: We extend our stay here because it was such a great hotel. From Miguel at checkin, Tarek who helped with our bags to Pablo who extended our stay they made us feel so special. Being a professional athlete I needed to train so they worked it out for me to workout at the fitness center at the mall across the way. We do over 200 nights with Hilton around the world and Hilton in Madrid did an awesome job. 10's across the board. They should have some of highest salt scores in the Hilton family! Thank you and we will be back in January.

Reviews.Title: “Super modern design, pricey -- and disappointing pool”
Reviews.Author: IQ140
Reviews.Content: We chose this because of its convenience to the airport. In general, the decor of the rooms and the lobby is impressive, imaginative and tasteful. The breakfast buffet was OK but not the best of our trip (and overpriced). Room service was excellent, well prepared and also pricey (5 euros for a 200ml Coke). Wifi access was good. The most disappointing aspect was the pool, which was one reason we picked this hotel. The only access was using metal ladders -- there were no steps in the pool allowing easy entry, unlike most pools. Obviously, it was not designed for the elderly or handicapped (and this design would likely have been illegal in the U.S.). I could not use it. I did use the small sauna, which was very clean. The fitness center consists of about three machines and a few free weights.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Braziliantraveler7
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Hilton Airport. The hotel is very modern and impressive. They have a great and personal shuttle service from the airport. The local is not ideal if you are really keen on stay close to the action in Madrid but, if Madrid is a stopover in your itineray, this is a great option. In our case, we spent 3 days in Madrid and then traveled to Barcelona, which made it perfect to be close to the airport. There is a Metro station at walking distance from the hotel so the access to downtown is not bad. Our rate included breakfast, which was amazing. Great variety, made-to-order omelets and different types of local cheeses and hams. Our room was very spacious and had an incredible and modern bathroom. I definetely recomment this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL BUT......”
Reviews.Author: bhgunders
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Beautiful amenities and room. Because of my diamond status, they upgraded my room to the presidential floor. The only gripe is that I left posters in the room and they couldn't find them when I called 35 minutes after I checked out. For that I'm very disapointed

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay! Definitely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JpoLgr
Reviews.Content: Visited Madrid for the weekend, enjoyed our stay and some remarks: 1)Prompt and precise answers to our e-mails from the Guest Service Department! 2)The king Hilton deluxe room was magnificent, had some small inconveniences addressed promptly by the concierge (hotel guide & second pair of slippers missing). 3)The indoor pool is just awesome!! We went near closing time at night, it was quiet and the lighting was perfect. 4)Ordered room service and the food & service were excellent! 4)The metro station is not that far from the hotel (10min walk). Excellent service from everyone, especially the concierge. When we'll return to Madrid, we know where we'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap prepaid prices EXPENSIVE TRANSPORTATION ACCESS”
Reviews.Author: cmentonelli
Reviews.Content: No access to public transportation. Not pedestrian friendly..Taxis and shuttles for 20 Euros or more will add to expenses. No soap in bathroom. No stopper in tub. Marks on wall. Location information on website and at call center unclear about accessibility to airport and city center.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was so nice that it was an extension of our vacation.”
Reviews.Author: TravelDotty
Reviews.Content: Not your ordinary end of the trip stay. Beautiful hotel and fantastic rooms with regards to decor, size, comfort and cleanliness. Extraordinary bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably expensive food”
Reviews.Author: tomhedge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is elegant and brand new. Rooms are beautiful. Eat and drink before you get there. They know they have you captive as there is nothing near it. Bar and food prices are outrageous. A Martini was 18 Euros. A burger 22 Euros. Internet access was outrageous as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a layover in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: MEDRoswell
Reviews.Content: We selected this Hotel basically as layover point for an early flight back to US. So I guess I expected a nice, clean Hilton hotel, but nothing to special. We were very impressed with the hotel. The rooms, while small in sq. ft. are designed in an hyper efficient modern style. So while small you still get a sperate shower and tub. Bed was large and comfortable. Nice HD TV and fast wireless internet. The Hilton Honors club was well stocked with local wines, and the night we were there they were serving small grilled pork kabobs and mini caesar salad. The clubs of the American Hiltons could take lessons from our concierge on service. The shuttle service to the airport runs about every 25 minutes, and our time from leaving our room to clearing check-in and security at Barajas was a mere 35 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel if you want to be close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Treva
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 3 days on my brief visit to Madrid. This hotel is a modern style hotel with lots of glass and the minimalist feel. Aesthetically, it is a beautiful hotel and the rooms are very modern contemporary and beautiful. It has a full spa with sauna and steam rooms and a pool. A small gym with tread mills and an cable machine. They also have a free shuttle to and from the airport and it is roughly a 5 -10 minute drive So if you want to feel like you have not left the US, this is a great place for you. They also have an executive lounge for Hilton platinum members with an open bar as well as snacks. the only negative part is you must consume everything in the lounge and cannot take it to your room. The hotel staff is amazing and very accommodating and were always eager to help , they were excellent!! Also, if you are staying and are Platinum, you do get free internet access. But overall, I didn't really like my stay, and this is what i struggled with. I was in Madrid and It didn't feel like I was in Madrid. The hotel is roughly a 20 Euro ride out of downtown Madrid and if you do take the metro , which we did, it is about a 35 minute ride and a 5 -10 minute walk, so going to and from the hotel can either be arduous or expensive. Also, since the hotel is "modern" the bathrooms are not exactly the most private. The doors to the bathroom are nothing more than sliding glass and they don't go all the way up to the ceiling, so if you want real "privacy" while you are using the toilet, that could be a challenge (especially if you are traveling on a romantic trip) Luckily we were a couple guys so we didn't care as much. I usually like modern contemporary design but for some reason , the hotel seemed very cold and sterile. All in all, If I had to overnight near the airport, I would definitely stay here, but if I wanted to really get a feel for Madrid, I would stay in town, especially with the prices this place charges.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent, first-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rynt
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay very close to Madrid airport for our return home to Canada (6 a.m. departure). It was difficult to part with 171 euros for the night but we did it anyway. Compare this price to other hotels on our trip (e.g., the Cala Grande on the Cabo de Gata) and you may wonder at the cost. We are not used to paying these prices unless we are going to a very special destination. However, convenience apart, it was such a beautiful place to stay in and I was very sad we could not stay the full 24 hours! The young staff are so genuinely interested in service and do their job with obvious enthusiasm and devotion. Although the meal prices are very high, the quality of the food at dinner matched its surroundings: magnificent! sumptuous! And, although it's true we had to pay a lot for our club sandwiches at lunch (17e each), they were the best I've ever had. Wine is much cheaper by the bottle, as we discovered at dinner. Considering the quality of the cuisine, 78e was a bargain compared to a similar meal in Canada!!! Yet, since we'd eaten our way through the delicious offerings of Barcelona, Valencia, Granada and Seville at ridiculously low prices, it felt expensive. The rooftop terrace and pool were a definite bonus....though the pool was icy, the sunbath afterwards was splendid. One more thing: the chic bathrooms! There was glass everywhere and beautiful green marble floors. However, having once been a chambermaid in my student years, I feel terribly sorry for the cleaners who must maintain these gorgeous glass vanities. But everything was immaculate in spite of it! I note that someone complained in his/her review, about noise. We heard nothing to disrupt our sleep. But I am also impressed that Sr. Clement Felus (General Manager) immediately replied to this concern in a personal note on Tripadvisor. This is the mark of a truly great hotel. I am sure this is also one reason the staff seem so happy to wrok there. And if you have any problems at all in a hotel, the time to complain is WHEN YOU ARE THERE! One more thing: I kept thinking of the British TV series "Hotel Babylon" while there! :) What goes on behind the scenes?

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive”
Reviews.Author: fulhamfcboys
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for one night after being stuck at Madrid airport, for one night room only was €186 per night, we had two small glasses of wine in the Hotel bar and cost us €17.00, very nice Hotel staff are very good but very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vacation209
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our last night in Madrid. We had an early flight the next morning so we did not want to get up too early that morning. The hotel was very modern and quiet. The rooms seemed dark but the beds were comfortable. It was a very nice airport hotel but it had no taste of Madrid. It could have been at any airport in the world. We ate breakfast at the cafe here and it was good. We did go into Madrid from the hotel. We took the Metro into town and caught a cab back to the hotel that night. The cab driver could not find the hotel and got lost...it is a bit tricky. The cab cost us just under 30 euros. Would stay here again if in the same situation.

Reviews.Title: “noisy”
Reviews.Author: just_me_Roma
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and with a very suggestive hall. It fully matches the Hilton standard unless you get a room facing the highway. I asked for a quite room and I was answered that all rooms are quite because built with soundproofed glasses. It is not true. Unfortunately I discovered the problem only when I was into the bed and I didn't have time to call for a change of room, even because I had an early wake up at 5,00 am. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “BRAVO HILTON!!!”
Reviews.Author: becjonyc
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, excellent welcome and service. Rooms are spacious, very functional and beautifully appointed. I would go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cruiseboy305
Reviews.Content: I was doing a tour of Italy and France and stopped in Madrid for a few days. This hotel was amazing, very modern, very spacious compared to most European hotels. My only complaint is, I wish this hotel was closer to central Madrid. It's quit a walk from the hotel and the subway stations. I'm very surprised that Hilton doesn't have a hotel in Madrid. It is very close to the airport which was convenient for me since I had an early morning flight to Rome and the shuttle service was great, on time and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Spiffy”
Reviews.Author: olliedawg
Reviews.Content: Close to the airport, this Hilton property looks a bit too spare on the inside, but the rooms are pretty spiffy -- high-tech, clean, with enough geeky things to keep the best road nerd busy for hours. Everything is over-priced, but the shuttle runs on time so get your meals at the airport (where they're only slightly less expensive).

Reviews.Title: “definetely a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: mvolkaneser
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel twice during last 6 months. Complimentary shuttle to/from Airport makes your life easier. the location is quite far away from downtown, but if you are in town for business than this Hilton is a good option. The room is big enough, but like all Hilton's, you have to pay for the internet connection. The Executive Lounge is very useful to enjoy drinks and snacks, and even have small meetings. although the price level is on the higher side, comparing to other Airport Hotels n Madrid, Hilton definetely deserves its name.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel high quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: Xymyz
Reviews.Content: Positives: the hotel is new and the room i stayed was both airy and bright. Very lean hotel and staff at reception was friendly. Whilst the hotel is bit out of city center and late evening taxi from centre didnt cost too muh. Negative: i chose this hotel as i was arriving late so wanted something close to the airport. There is a free shuttle but this takes quite long time as the bus goes arouns the airporr and i think in the end it took me same time as taking taxi to hotel near city centre although didnt icur the cost?

Reviews.Title: “very close to airport and really modern high tech hotel and rooms”
Reviews.Author: krfaller
Reviews.Content: we stayed here after 8 nites in several different cities to catch a morning flight back to the usa......really sleek and modern hotel! service was a little sketchy like they gave us a wrong room number so we are trying to access someone elses room who was less than happy with us.......but once we got into the correct room all was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: GGol2005
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice for business traveling in Madrid. Fine shuttle service to all airport terminals, fine environment and room condition, fine dinning, perfect stay. Only complaint would be the expensive internet connection

Reviews.Title: “Everything works”
Reviews.Author: 2010-Urbi-et-Orbi
Reviews.Content: A good hotel, almost a luxury one. If you can get this for under $200, then its a bargain. Probably the best feature about it is that the shuttle DOES come and pick you up at the airport by without you having to call, every 20-30 min. I have not had this experience with other hotels in the area. It's a good idea to add breakfast to your bill as it is really worth it: a huge buffet, you won't need lunch if you're going out to the city. Ask for directions to the metro, it's about a 10 min walk. All in all, a good deal and close to Barajas if you have a morning flight you'll save on the taxi from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Wish it was closer to the the city”
Reviews.Author: jlsterling226
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We stay at a lot of Hiltons and this one was fabulous. I never heard the airplanes and the airport offered a free shutttle to the airport for our flight. If this hotel was closer to the city center I would have stayed there for my entire visit. Very modern and clean and quiet. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel, Location leaves a little to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: PTJD01
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a Modern clean upscale Hilton property. Rooms are large and clean. Good sized Exec lounge with great service. Only stayed one night prior to flight back to US. I travel within Europe quite a bit and know how to get around quite well, but even for me finding this hotel was a small challenge after getting off the metro. You are basically in a apartment complex when you get out of the metro, you need to go left out of the station walk about 5-8 minutes till you hit a T in the road, now go left a few blocks then walk the overpass over the Highway. After crossing the highway you will see it to your right. If you have more luggage than carry-on I would not recommend this. Did take the shuttle to the airport which is close, they even made a special arrangement for us due to the early flight. The location does drop this very nice hotel a star or two.

Reviews.Title: “gr to find. eat airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtroner
Reviews.Content: this is so much nicer than our recent experience in paris at charles de gaulle airport. we had booked at a marriott with a shuttle service from the airport to the hotel. it was a disaster. hard to find the shuttle, it went to numerous other hotels and it was not very pleasant. the marriott itself was generic, and not very luxurious. how different this hilton was. shuttle was easy to find. took us directly to the hotel in 15 minutes or so. helped us to unload our luggage and actually brought it into hotel for us. just as nice on the revturn trip the next morning. and the hotel is superb, modern, sleek and comfortable and a lot less expensive then Paris ar 150 euros. great bargain if you need to stay overnight at the madrid airport. definitely a find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - But you pay for everything!”
Reviews.Author: daytripper39
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night just before leaving from Madrid Airport in the morning. We wanted a nice hotel for our last night in Europe. It was very nice but not worth it. We were able to check in early - at 12 noon. They also have a free shuttle to Madrid in the early afternoon but your return is on your own and a free shuttle to and from the airport every 30 minutes. This was the only free thing in the hotel. Water in the room was 4 euros, coke was 4.60 euros. The Internet was 30 euros for a 24 hour period. They have a business center where you pay .40 euros per minute and .65 to print a page. We spent 6 euros just to get a boarding pass. We didn't even bother with the breakfast - the price had to be off the charts. We probably paid for a pool and exercise room we never used. In our opinion, there are hotels in the area with as much quality but with free internet and free water. Next time we will go with one of those for about half the price of what we paid here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and service; about a 15 minute walk to Metro into Madrid”
Reviews.Author: CleopatraBunny
Reviews.Content: This 3-year old property at the airport has a free shuttle (no need to call - they run every 15-20 minutes during the day), and also a free shuttle twice a day into Madrid (9:50 am and 11:15 am). No pickup from the city but you can take the metro to the airport and then take their shuttle back to the hotel, or take the metro to the Alameda de Osuna Green 5 stop and walk 15 minutes to the hotel (ask for a map - we got lost the first time we tried it). The metro is 1 euro, one way, regardless of transfers but you can buy a card with 10 rides for 9 euro and share it among the people in your party. The room was standard airport hotel fare but clean and quiet. Executive lounge for Honors members was not very good compared to other international locations - continental breakast only and a mediocre evening offering of snacks. They do have an incredible full breakfast, however, in the lobby for Honors members, which was more than adequate (breads, fruit, made to order omelettes, hot and cold meats, potatoes, yogurt, cereals, etc.). Lobby has a Sixt car rental desk that is sporadically staffed. We'd arranged for an Avis rental at the airport before arriving into Madrid, but logged onto the Sixt site and booked a car for pickup at the hotel at the end of our 3-day Madrid stay and saved over $500 over the lowest price offered on Avis. On the day we picked up our car, the staff was there - very efficient with no problems. The car was parked in the hotel garage and came with GPS (we had reserved it). I would definitely do this again! Internet for Gold members is free and FAST - fastest I've ever had in a hotel which was good, since I had to download a significant number of videos related to my work during our stay. Overall, we were pleased with our stay and would stay again given the price and relative ease of getting into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TravlAgain
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here numerous times, and always find that they do a good job in terms of having a positive attitude and great service. The staff almost all speak English clearly, which makes it easy to communicate. The rooms are modern, clean, and well-cared-for. They have all the comforts that you'd want in a hotel room (except for an ironing board and iron). However, I will admit that the mattresses and bedding are not as luxurious as they could be, making them a little less comfortable than they should be! The breakfast buffet is wonderful! Although if you are paying out-of-pocket for it I believe that they charge 35 Euros per person, so best to get a breakfast included rate if you are interested (or have status with their hotel frequent stay program, which provides it as a benefit). It is not a great location if you are on-foot, and want to explore the center of Madrid. There is no easy way to get the the center of the city, and you must wait for taxis. You might feel trapped on the outskirts of the city if you don't have transportation, although I believe that it is a brief walk to the subway station. If you have transportation (e.g., have a ride, taxi, or a car) it is a great base. The parking garage is 15 Euros/night and it is almost always empty, clean and very convenient to get in/out. Be sure to use the ticket they give you to go both in and out (rather than picking a new ticket from the entrance - can you tell I didn't do that the first time?). :) Room service is fantastic. Their menu is not extensive, but the food is very tasty! Order local dishes, for which they do a great job. Overall, it is a very nice, modern hotel. I'd recommend it to anyone, except if you want to be in the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern, Great Value, Easy for airport. Easy into centre of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: manxman25
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hilton as the last stop on our way home from Spain as it was close to the airport and had a shuttle to take us there in the morning. We decided to get there by taking the Madrid underground to the nearest stop and walked the 1/2 mile or so to the hotel which is out by a free way in a business area. Thank goodness I had a street map as it is not easy to find. But what a surprise when we entered the rather nondescript concrete/glass building in which the hotel is located. A huge attrium with the rooms arranged on balconies around it. On checking in ( I am a Hilton Silver Member) I was greeted in English and offerred an upgrade to the executive level for a mere 30 euros - since the upgrade included a free evening buffet with drinks and breakfast for two we jumped at it and it was well worth it - more later.... On enetering I room my wife was in awe - This is possibly the best hotel room we have every had - very modern , light clean and spacious - a huge king bed. The bathroom was large, immaculately clean and all glass and steel. Just fantastic! After a long day on the AVE (Train) from Seville we certainly enjoyed a hot shower and then went over to the buffet - The tapas on offer were superb and you could help yourself to as much as you wanted. The wine choice was excellent and we had several glasses each - sitting a a really comfortable lounge. There are NO restaurants anywhere nearby! A very comfortable nights sleep and a fantastic hot and cold breakfast buffet made the whole upgrade an unbelievable value. The shuttle dropped us at the airport - no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice for Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: onedumgoy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at some of the other airport hotels in Madrid, and I think this one was the most comfortable and had the best service. All the employees are extremely helpful and they are masters of efficiency. Everything there runs very smoothly and I must compliment the chef as the food was exemplary. The only thing I didn't like was the decor and the archictectural style. I found the uber-modern blacks, whites, and reds just clashed with my personal taste. For me, it was very hard on the eyes. I also thought there was a lot of wasted space. If you go to the Airport HIlton in Rome, it too is very modern, but warm. The ambience at the Madrid Hilton comes off a little cold. However, as I stated earlier, the staff more than makes up for it and they make you feel at home immediately. Obviously hotel decor is a matter of personal taste, you might like it! If you have an early flight, this is the hotel to book. Otherwise, you might consider staying in town as there's not much going on outside of this hotel. It's only about a 30 minute cab ride in the morning from the Puerta Del Sol to the airport and you can get that last night of tapas or flamenco in before you leave. If you decide not to chance it and want to be 5 minutes from the airport and enjoy a really good dinner, stay here instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern,clean, spacious not a great location”
Reviews.Author: lilysouthcarolina
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms and bathroom, very up todate, quiet, nothing nearby although 15 minute walk to mall. Nice bar and lobby area, good restaurant although expensive. internet cafe/small grocery story 1 block around corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the airport!”
Reviews.Author: dcon1959
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, great staff, and fabulous breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “If you need to stay at the airport, this is the one!”
Reviews.Author: NaomiNYC
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice if you need to stay at the airport. Hotel operates free shuttle van to and from airport. Good value; reasonable price for comfortably large room w extremely modern bathroom containing bath AND shower, enclosed in opaque glass. Delighted by the restaurant. Had dinner there and quite impressed with food quality and flavor as well as service. No other restaurants are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “When in Madrid, this is the best hotel choice for service and satisfaction!”
Reviews.Author: granada2011
Reviews.Content: Awesome attention to customer/guest satisfaction on all levels. Staff is the best I have encountered in any hotel stay recently anywhere in the USA and overseas. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Madrid and even though the location is at the airport and away from the city center, downtown is easily accessible and affordable through shuttle and bus service. Room accommodations were clean/comfortable. Hilton should be very proud to have such a wonderfully staffed property as part of their chain. As a frequent business traveler who has been at many hotels, the Hilton Madrid Airport truly has taken the number one spot in my list on all aspects of accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anthony_Forman
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in an executive room. Shuttle from airpport is every 20 mins and you do not need to phone the hotel. Hotel is only a few minutes away. Restaurant is small, good and comfortable but pricey. Breakfast is very good. Overall the place is excellent for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: carol072
Reviews.Content: stayed in hilton for 1 night 16th march as over night stop the hotel provides courtsey bus which picks you up at terminal all you do is phone and it is free. we arrived at hotel given deluxe room which was very nice good standard as hilton are we had payed for breakfast in rate which if not included would have been 19 euros each which is over priced but of good standard. The only negative thing i can say about this stunning hotel is it is 20 to 25 euros in taxi to centre the food in hotel is over priced 16 euros for a chicken club sandwich ! my husban and i had a meal which was 1 starter 2 mains and bottle of water which set us back 130 euros which was a bit steep but the food was good. If not getting a good rate incl of breakfast and not on stop over for one night then this hotel is not for you as very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Drinks in the hotel are far too expensive”
Reviews.Author: tkfromgalway
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel on a number of occasions with my partner while he is on business, the last time being in March. The hotel itself is nice and finished in a very modern style, with tiled floors in the bedrooms as well as the bathrooms. Whilst I look forward to the stay in Madrid, I don't look forward to the 30-40 minute trip from The Hilton into the city centre on the metro. The hotel is very near the airport, and the free shuttle the hotel provides is very handy - the longest you normally have to wait for it is about 20 minutes. The immediate vicinity of the hotel is mainly offices and other business premises- almost like an industrial estate and unless you do make the trip into town, there are not a lot of places to go for food or drinks apart from the hotel. The one major issue I have with this hotel, is the ridiculous prices they charge in the bar. We had two drinks one of the evenings that ended up costing €24. I thought the barman had given us the wrong bill at first, but at €8 for a pint of local beer, and €18 for a gin (Hendrix) and tonic, two drinks did indeed come to €24.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Wxcellent space and place for the end of a family trip!”
Reviews.Author: MomDoc
Reviews.Content: We finished a long 3 week vacation with our 4 kids aged 6-11 here at the Hilton Barajas in order to be able to be close to the airport for the flight home the following morning. We were delighted! The beds were awesome, the indoor pool and sauna were awesome, and the free breakfast buffet the following morning was spectacular! Although the price was hefty - it was worth it after the long trip to be comfortable, have every convenience, free breakfast and airport shuttle!

Reviews.Title: “Good stop over hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler8Colorado
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of times for early flights out in the morning. I'm a diamond member and for this particular stay we were upgraded to a nice suite with jacuzzi. The shuttle to / from the airport is not ideal (would be great if it was actually connected to the airport) but normally only takes 15-20 min. To access certain floors, you have to put in your key card in the elevator. They have two towers in the hotel and key cards don't work for both so if you're in the S.Tower and have access to the Exec Lounge in the N.Tower, you need to have several key cards. The breakfast in the Exec Lounge is decent, cold only when we were there so we had the breakfast downstairs instead. Service there sucked but the food was good. The staff at check in/out were nice and did a good job. Exec Lounge snacks in the afternoon are decent. Wireless worked well in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, superb service all round”
Reviews.Content: none at all,faultless experience, absolutely loved it, nothing to criticize at all

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: elanem
Reviews.Content: After missing our connecting flight we had to stay in the Hilton Madrid Hotel for Christmas. The staff at this hotel were very accommodating and helpful, making a very horrible situation much more pleasant and supplying a very clean room with a comfortable bed for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Magic”
Reviews.Author: barrewasjulien
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Madrid exceeded our expectations. The staff is very friendly. The hostel is new and it is was a real pleasure to sleep two nights in the executive suite and to take advantage of the executive lounge. We will definitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Twiga2
Reviews.Content: All the reviews I read gave me really high expectations of this hotel. It was OK but not exceptional. I felt they tried but it was not that nice. The room felt "cold/modern". The black slate flooring was hard to clean so there was dirt in the corners, the bathroom door did not close all the way, the bathroom floor was not leveled right so the water after you got out of the shower or tub pooled and did not go to the drain. The breakfast in the business lounge was fair, but not worth paying for an upgrade. Open hours of the lounge and pool were very limited - pool did not open until 8 AM so we did not get to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - will return!”
Reviews.Author: Halls40
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Madrid with extended family and were very glad we chose the Hilton Madrid Airport Hotel! We found the airport courtesy bus to be very efficient and the reception and restaurant staff to be very helpful - it was lovely to deal with them. Our rooms were excellent - we had a relaxation room and an executive suite within our group and the standards of cleanliness and facilities contained within were also excellent. We used the pool and sauna areas - the pool was lovely, fab to take a morning swim with the sun rising! We also used the executive lounge and found this to be great value and very well stocked. We used the airport courtesy bus to travel to the nearest metro station and couldn't believe how clean and efficient the metro service was - within 20 minutes you're in the centre of Madrid and all it has to offer. Our weather was gorgeous when we were there and we took a picnic in the park - in March! We shall return to Madrid and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: SoulSabbatical
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful relaxing hotel. The rooms are extremely nice and hydro-therapy pool was nothing short of amazing. The food was ok, average, but the pool and the work-out area with sauna is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “the excellent staff at reception desk”
Reviews.Author: fiumanka
Reviews.Content: I had travelled much arround the world ( for business purpose), and I had visited many hotels. The staff at reception desk from the check-in to the checks - out was very professional and helpful in all situations. Everything in hotel is well, but this staff is unique in positive sense.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Terry_Paris1
Reviews.Content: I generally never have a very good feeling when I have to stay overnight at a property that is close to an Airport. But here was an exception to the rule. Arrival: smiling and attentive staff at the front desk. I had forgotten my telephone charger and they immediately had a spare one for me to use at my convenience. Also, there was a porter outside welcoming me, which is quite unusual nowadays. Room: The room is one of the largest I can remember ever to have stayed in. Very spacious, modern design but still warm due to the wooden floor and even a sort of Jacuzzi bathtub. The best however was that I could open the window which is something I sadly miss in most hotels. The breakfast had everything you could possibly look for on a buffet and they offered me some eggs and omelettes from the menu. When I inquired about the shuttle bus to take me to the airport in the afternoon, the front desk offered me straight away to reserve one at a convenient time (all free of charge). A great experience which makes me look forward to my next trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Beatuiful Hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Holger1980
Reviews.Content: I have been here for just 2 days and staff made me feel very welcomed and created a remarkably warm atmosphere. The hotel itself is beautiful, very modern and stylish. Service team is highly customer related and willing to do a extra step. There are alos various conference rooms. I would alss go there for vacation! I would definetely come back or recommend to others! Holger, Germany

Reviews.Title: “If you have a really early flight out Madrid, this is a perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: DillonPayton
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Madrid by train for an over night and early flight this hotel is the best. That said, it is a 20 euro cab ride from downtown. You would be better to stow your luggage if the train station has lockers and do a couple hours in downtown before heading out. But once at the Hilton service and comfort rules. Be sure to become an honors member and pay the upgrade option to the executive level. Snacks, drinks, online computers along with fabulous modern rooms with fantastic bathrooms make this a great stop to unwind while preparing to leave for home. That said this is a generic, though upscale Hilton experience. The fabulous bartender even knew how to make a proper martini. So this isn't my choice for a Spanish experience hotel, but when you need a shuttle at 5:30 AM and a lovely selection of coffee, juice and pastries in the lobby while you wait - this hotel is perfect. The experience is generic in that you could be

Reviews.Title: “Front staff very nice, but restaurant and billing a problem.”
Reviews.Author: ArnaudGagneux
Reviews.Content: We stayed there twice, on the 20th of Feb and the 1st of March. The staff at the reception and the shuttle driver are very helpful and polite. On our first stay everything was fine, no complaint. On our second stay things changed for the worst. The food from the bar was not good at all, my Hilton Burger ordered "raw" arrived well done, there was not much I could do. One of our guests' fajitas were simply inedible. We mentioned this to the waiter but he seemed unconcerned. Moreover, the same waiter was annoyed that we returned the house wine as the bar had changed it from one kind to the other between the 2d and 3rd glass without telling us. he was so rude when we complained. For breakfast the scrambled eggs were cold and tasted artificial flavours. Finally my credit card bill is still full of uncleared "authorisations" which prevents me from using it. It is overall difficult to recommend this hotel until matters have improved.

Reviews.Title: “For a local touch, try the tapas bars near the metro”
Reviews.Author: jaym01
Reviews.Content: We're not usually 5 star people, but we stayed here for one night in transit due to an early departure the following morning. The hotel itself was lovely. The room was gorgeous, pool area was great, restaurant service was excellent and breakfast probably the best I'd had anywhere. As it was a Sunday, the local shops were closed, but we decided to go for a walk and headed to the metro station - about 500 m. Randomly came across a group of nondescript shops including a litle tapas place - and had one of the most excellent meals of our time in Spain! The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars is no free wifi - the cheapest hostel offers this but the Hilton can't? With its location, you'd only stay here for proximity for the airport. Which is a bit of a shame. Because, really, it was (other than lack of wifi) flawless.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: suzie068
Reviews.Content: Having surprised our teenage son with a trip to Madrid for his birthday we arrived at the Hilton mid afternoon. On arrival we were greeted by fantastic staff who made sure we felt very welcome and sent us straight to the executive lounge for cocktail hour.During this time Miguel who had greeted us at reception organised a map for us and a suggested itinary for our stay...this proved invaluable in fitting in as much as we could in the time we had. During our stay we took full use of the pool (nightime is best to appreciate light effects) and gym. On his birthday our son was surprised with a beautiful bithday cake being delivered to our room which was delicious and a very kind gesture. From start to finish Miguel and staff looked after our needs and always with a smile on their face.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the value.”
Reviews.Author: timtimcars
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Friday the 28th of January and it was not just a sleep over because I had meetings all day so looking for the best place to have my meetings, I chose Hilton at the Madrid airport and I was not disappointed. Breakfast was included in my rate and it was very nice with staff continously bringing fresh coffee and tea. All staff were polite and friendly and at night I had my dinner at the grill resaturant and the choice of fresh fish was fantastic for an airport hotel. Also Carlos at the restaurant was very knowledgeable about his wine.

Reviews.Title: “It`s great!”
Reviews.Author: chik1171
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic Hotel!! Design and decoration fantastic. But what made this hotel 1st class!! was the extremely helpful staff. Especially the Doorman on our arrival. We didnt fly in until 2.00am so the free shuttle service run from the hotel was not running. Therefore we had to get a taxi from the airport. The taxi driver tried to overcharge us but the Doorman had the problem sorted in minutes. The checkin Receptionist was also good. Rooms pure luxury!! Shuttle service to Airport next day was brilliant. The driver was able to tell us we were going to the wrong terminal and took the time to see we got to the right one with full directions. Fantastic again. Many Thanks Beware if you are traveling to this Hotel in the early hours of the morning when the shuttle service is not available. because the hotel is so near the airport the taxi drivers loath to take you there as they can queue up to 3 hours to get a run out of this airport and it is not worth their while. Be perpared to pay 15euro minimum even though the meter reads about 9 euro The pool was also quite hard to find and poor changing facilities

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend rate at fabulous airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: mshbnyehud
Reviews.Content: Hilton is advertising an 85 Euros weekend rate at this hotel until end of January. Maybe they´ll repeat it again. This is a great, great bargain for a very modern style airport hotel. Breakfast is pricey but nice buffet. Internet is a ripoff. The only downside is the fitness room, which only has 1 running track, 1 cycling machine and 1 elyptical trainer. It looks more like a Courtyard by Marriott fitness room than a full service hotel. On the other hand, there is a wet and dry sauna in there, so that´s not all bad. Shuttle service is frequent and continuous. I was picked up within 8 minutes of arrival, and they run back to the airport between every 15 and 20 minutes. All in all, I´d come back here for another great value weekend.

Reviews.Title: “modern classy airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: mysterym
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern and georgeous. There is a free shuttle from the airport, which does not come as fast as we wanted, but, it gets you there. The bathroom is marble, sleek and very cool! If you can, upgrade to get the breakfast, it is worth it! This is too out of the way except to stay in between planes, but, very relaxing and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own STARS because this property is awful!!”
Reviews.Author: Dublinsome1
Reviews.Content: travel 300 days per year. I'm a diamond member w/Hilton......but that didnt matter.....staff can barely speak English.......... This is a dirty hotel. House cleaning personnel need to be re-trained on how 2 clean a chambre. My sink was stopped up, sockets out of the wall, dirty shower,toilet and BEST of all, LEFT OVER FOOD IN THE MINI BAR FROM THE PREVIOUS GUEST!!! & it STUNK!!! Dreadful hotel.....took reception staff 2 hours 2 get me another room as I waited outside the room in the cold because of the design of the hotel........ all that in the first 30 minutes after arriving from an international flight....NEVER AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LondonKat77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during all of the snow disruption before Christmas. A very smart looking hotel. Good food (room service) and outstanding front desk service. The fellow who helped us in with our luggage was also able to check us in. All the staff were very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “The nicest airport hotel we stayed in”
Reviews.Author: nononsens
Reviews.Content: Modern, comfortable, convenient, with free airport transfers. Pleasant room with that little extra luxury like leather recliner and separate walk-in shower. Full marks.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: inaba
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean, spacious, modern hotel with a spectacular internal scenic lift! Our executive room was lovely; there isn't much of a view, as this is an airport hotel but this did not detract at all from our enjoyment. The staff are charming and extremely helpful; the executive lounge provides good canapes and a wide range of drinks; breakfast was delicious, interesting and varied; the bar is in the main hotel reception - check out the fab red heart shaped chairs! The hotel is a 10 minute walk to the tube station, then you can be in the city centre within 30 minutes. There is a free bus from the airport to the hotel. Altogether a great hotel! This is our second visit and we shall return, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Beatifull Hotel and great staff!!! I will come back!”
Reviews.Author: Fworco
Reviews.Content: I staid at the hotel for 4 days, two days for work and the week end with family. For the first two days, I found the room very convenient with a big desk and nice chair to spend time reviewing the presentaion of the day... When my family arrived, the room was big enough to easily add an extra bed (they called it a relaxation room). The Location of the hotel can be an issue since it is not at the airport exactly but we discussed it with the concierge who gave us 2 very convenient solution since there is a free shuttle going to madrid's center and a Metro station 5 minutes walking distance... So finally we find our way quite easily back and forth to the center... But anyway, since it was quite cold and windy in madrid we spend quite a lot of time in the hotel ( and the heated swimming pool!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, stunning rooms”
Reviews.Author: jimtexas
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the room, i was stunned by the modern decor and especially the bath room. Absolutely beautiful hotel inside. The minibar charges are outrageous---$6 for a can of Diet Coke?

Reviews.Title: “just Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Rudolf_CRO
Reviews.Content: My review will be very short due to the fact that I checked in at 9pm and checked out at 5am. I had a stopover traveling from Valencia to Zagreb, and my flight from Madrid was very early and I had to sleep in Madrid. From the arrival to the airport, where you have dedicated Hilton complimentary transfer... to the welcome in the hotel. Extremely professional receptionists... Rooms quite big and luxurious (bathrooms, WOW). The only thing I didn't like and some other hotel chains do it properly, is the early breakfast and "non-complimentary" WIFI. There was only a tray with coffee and juice, no croissants or some similar pastry. But in general, definitely a HILTON.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarenandScott
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel ... first and foremost it was aesthetically pleasing to the eye ... we were upgraded to a suite and what a magnificent suite it was .... we compare this hotel with the best of the Four Seasons that we have stayed in ... I cannot say enough about this place. The staff was amazing, helpful, polite and really went out of their way to make our all too short stay there exceptional. Perfect room, amazing club food, unbelievable breakfast buffet ... but, the rooms. and the showers and the baths and the public places ... well ... do yourself a favor and stay there ... wow

Reviews.Title: “Airport Hilton exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: mozartmaraDuQuoin_IL
Reviews.Content: Fantanstic modern hotel with great upgrades for >Hilton Honors especially. Gorgeous hotel near airport! We meant to stay here and go into Madrid for one last night on our Spain vacation. Instead...it was so wonderful that we decided to forgo the Madrid visit and stay at the hotel to enjoy the wonderful amenities!!! Free transportation to and from the airport is also included.

Reviews.Title: “Well located airport hotel at usual Hilton standard”
Reviews.Author: zteu
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel after flying in to Madrid in the evening. The free shuttle was easy to find and Hilton branded so stood out amongst the others. Starting with the shuttle driver, the service was friendly and polite. The hotel is only two years and it shows, the hollow, square centre space is very impressive. As a Gold VIP member I had access to the VIP lounge, which while not the fanciest I've ever used was clean, well stocked and had delicious Spanish snacks. The room was appointed well, though the water from the taps smelled bad at times. Apart from that, the stay was without any downfalls. The location is good too, but only if you want to stay near the airport. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: Nula82
Reviews.Content: After problems at another hotel, we were able to book 2 rooms at the Hilton at 3am in the morning! Although situated out of town, the hotel is excellent. We were on the Executive level and could not fault the rooms - great bathrooms, comfy beds and a good experience all round. Breakfast is great! We took a taxi into town each day which was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: yarelicar
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is just 5 minutes from airport. They have free shuttle to the airport. A metro station just 1km away. Very convenient to business travelers (meeting facilities are excelent), to catch an airplane the next day or to visit Madrid on a slower pace, as it may take you 45 min to get to the city center by metro. Clean, spacious and modern, good and quick room service. Next time in Madrid, I will stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for short layover near the airport”
Reviews.Author: LongWayAcross
Reviews.Content: ..but just don't make any telephone calls from your room! I know we should have read the rates more carefully, but we decided to call a local ticket agent to arrange for some Real Madrid football tickets during our short stay. The phone call maybe lasted 5 mins and on check out the phone bill was nearly 40euros! Wow. We had a quick bite in the restaurant for dinner..it was pretty much average. If you just want a snack or small fare, outside of the hotel to the left is a big mall with many other food options. Breakfast was good though.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay within the airport”
Reviews.Author: Kairetu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night, and the service was good. The staff at the reception are really helpful and the room was spacious compared to european standards. They have an indoor pool which is lovely, but i never got a chance to use it. The nearest metro station is 500m away, within a residential area. It is easy to get lost at night while trying to make your way to the hotel from the metro station. I would recommend taking a train to the airport and catching the free hotel shuttle from there. I would not recommend this hotel for travellers wanting to visit central Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed at all...”
Reviews.Author: moncic
Reviews.Content: Don't know really where to begin this one... Let's start with the location....basically at the airport so nothing to see except the nearby shopping mall. Then when I got the room and after unpacking all my stuff I found used condoms in the garbage can and the toilet seat was burned with cigarettes....so after complaining I got a free upgrade of course. Then when I tried to connect to the internet they screwed something up so I had to talk to their provider swisscom to solve it....and then again the next day same thing... There is no serving of anything in the pool area, which otherwise was ok. Also there was no slippers and bath robe so I had to call for it, then of course I only got slippers so I had to call again for the bath robe.... The lunch buffe was at best mediocer so no plus points there either. Also no prep of the room during the evening. Then also some banging was going on from 10am in the morning from an adjecent room so no long sleep in the morning. Windows all over the hotel were not clean.... What was good though was the service at the reception. They were always ready to help you out with shuttle etc. All in all it's a good looking hotel with poor service, no attention to detail, but willing to fix the problems.

Reviews.Title: “It was one of my favorite Hilton....but it is no longer the case (new management??)”
Reviews.Author: MikePM
Reviews.Content: Well, no need to go into details, it is a superb hotel (see my previous review on this one). But sadly, the buffet restaurant is no longer in service, replaced by an a la carte very expensive and pretentious menu. Same for the Breakfast, the choice is not a good as before!! Limited to say the least, and on the cheap side if we compare with what it used to be. What is happening, are we under a new management or simply a cost saving policy? This hotel is not cheap, but it was worth every penny in the past, this is no longer the case!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationer81
Reviews.Content: * This review was previously posted under the wrong account* This hotel featured excellent service and a beautiful standard guest room. I stayed here with my husband and a family member -- the three of us shared one room. The room was ready early when we arrived with the extra twin bed already set up and an extra towel and toiletries for the third guest. The room is very nice looking, as is the hotel lobby. The best part about this hotel, however, is the service. They were very friendly and even had maps ready for those of us travelers brave enough (and cheap enough) to foot it to the metro station, which is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. We chose this hotel because we were departing very early for the airport after our one night stay. I'm not sure about driving distance, but it takes quite a long train ride to reach the sights of Madrid using the Metro system. The shuttle begins operating at 5:30 am and they had coffee, tea and some small pastries in the lobby while we waited for the shuttle to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: runner250
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a terrific two evening visit at this hotel on the way back from a Star Clipper Cruise. As diamonds we were upgraded to the fifth floor and given lounge access along with free wifi. The lounge was open until 11:00 (except for Sunday evenings when it closes at 9:00) and it had a good selection of drinks and evening snacks...maybe not as good as some other European Executive lounges but more than adequate. Breakfast in the lounge was juice, coffee and croissants but Executive Floor folks have the choice of breakfast in the lounge or breakfast in the main breakfast room on the first floor where there are lots of hot and cold choices. I was surprised to see so many posters mention the long walk to the metro grocery store or the metro. We chatted with the van driver and he drove us and another couple to Ventas which is the Metro station next to Plaza de Toros. The van also took us to the grocery store but we had to walk back. By the way, walk up (or down on the way back) the off ramp in front of the hotel to the rotary at the top of the hill. Don't follow the directions that the front desk people will give you when they say to take the long way and go the long way up the staircase. My only complaint was that they have an antiquated system of printing boarding passes for guests. You have to go to the lounge and email a PDF of your boarding passes to the hotel in order for them to be able to print them. Why they don't just have a printer in the lounge is beyond me. Also, if you don't have Executive Lounge access then you can't email them a boarding pass to print out. A couple we were traveling with did not have EL access and they were told that they would have to check in and get boarding passes at the airport (before I went back to the lounge and had their boarding passes emailed to reception.) All in all, though, we had a great visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hilton; Order the Chateaubriand”
Reviews.Author: Bloodman33
Reviews.Content: Nice modern Hilton with very responsive staff. The Executive Lounge is subpar (by European standards). Best surprise was the terrific restaurant. The Chateaubriand was the best hunk of dead cow i've had in memory. 7 minutes from the airport. Walking distance to a 20 minute Metro ride to downtown Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good option if you need to be close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Bringing_the_kids
Reviews.Content: We ended up only spending a few hours in this hotel, arrived there very late and had an early flight to catch the next morning. But we really liked what we did get to see. The room was small but very nice and clean, with a modern decor. I found it offered what we expected from an airport hotel, and we liked that we could actually park our car, as opposed to valet parking, where one always ends up waiting for hours. The location is not the greatest if you want to see Madrid, but it's excellent if you have an early flight - it only takes 5 minutes to get to the airport, even if you don't know your way around.

Reviews.Title: “So Helpful”
Reviews.Author: jamdoyle
Reviews.Content: Arried at airport hotel with sick wife. Hotel reception arranged doctor at 5am then delivered medicine at 6am. So helpful when you really need help fast. Great help too in arranging travel onwards after 5 nights to recover. Very professional. Hotel rooms great, breakfast brilliant, dinner excellent. But 33 euro for wifi per day a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous modern hotel, with beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: csteen
Reviews.Content: Convenient to the airport (we were flying out the next day), this is a truly beautiful modern hotel with incredible rooms. While the room wasn't expensive, everything else there was extremely expensive. Breakfast about $25 more, have to pay for WiFi. Restaurants excellent but also very expensive. Staff very nice and professional.

Reviews.Title: “A place you can call home in Madrd”
Reviews.Author: Cihat
Reviews.Content: A trully nice place to stay in Madrid. Close to metro station and staff answers all your questions and gives information about what to see in Madrid. I would like to thank the General manager for such a professionaly run hotel and wonderful staf for all their assistance during our stay. Cihat Istanbul September 2010

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with bad management practices”
Reviews.Author: Andrew098
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night to catch a connecting flight the next morning and decided to pay extra for an executive room with the lounge access, free internet in the lounge and breakfast included. Paid 180 Euros special non-refundable internet rate (60 Euros more than for a regular room). What they fail to tell you when you make a reservation is that the lounge closes at 9:00 PM. We came to the lounge at 8:45 PM to find some leftover snacks and drinks and a few minutes later we were asked to leave because the lounge closes. The hostess made sure that we only take out of the lounge an opened and unfinished bottle of water. No "free" internet service once the lounge closes. The rate charged for wireless internet available in the room is just outrages. After protesting and a having a long discussion, the manager finally offered a one hour credit for the wireless internet use in the room. The next surpirse to those who have a morning flight is that breakfast is offered only after 6:30 AM, unfortunately a common practice in Spain, even in airport hotels (some offer breakfasts starting at 7:00 AM). The lounge and breakfast hours may be OK in a resort hotel where people come to relax, not in the airport hotel where most of the guests are business travellers. Overal, a negative experience that I did not expect from a reputable hotel chain. There are many other decent hotels close to the airport in Madrid which offer a better value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: azbeachgirl
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! The staff was really friendly and helpful. The room was awesome. It was big, stylish and very comfortable. The bathroom was huge with a spa tub and seperate shower. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and newer, yet lacks basic functionality; staff underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: MJJ001
Reviews.Content: Disappointed with service staff in that there was always a wait to speak to someone at the front desk. Staff was not cross-trained beyond their immediate duties. Room design is modern and newer, yet lacks practical functionality like hooks or towel rods for towels. Also, moving glass bathroom walls do not close all the way (or have a handle for the glass door that leads to the toilet, I would like to have a handle on that door!) which does not give a lot of privacy. Think intention was to make the room look bigger than it is, but I want a bathroom door that closes! There is little to no room for a makeup case on the sink and the glass sink is so impractical to keep looking nice and clean. Bath just felt small. Slow draining sink. Bed did have the nicer quality sheets and duvets and flat screen TV. No view, though it was quiet despite being so close to the airport. The breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LunaLondon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel: very new, very smart, super-comfortable, excellent service, minutes to airport. It is probably the smartest airport hotel I have stayed in. Executive lounge is great, has free PCs and internet access, good views and good refreshments, but the breakfast offering was really limited and of poor quality. Room service food was also very poor and bad value. The buffet breakfast in the lobby, however, was excellent. Incredibly charming and helpful staff who really go the extra mile. Quick, easy and efficient hotel transfers to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frankalb55
Reviews.Content: it was a short trip, but it was fantastic ... In Fact it is all about service and the service there is great, staff are friendly. sure i go back soon

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business stop-over near Madrid airport”
Reviews.Author: deathracer
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at the Hilton Madrid Airport while in transit during a business trip. The hotel is only 5 minutes from the airport and close to a large shopping mall. The design of the hotel is ultra modern and looks to be very new. All staff encountered were very professional and helpful. For me, the room was the best feature of the hotel. I'm not sure if I had an executive room, but the design was excellent for the business traveller. There is a semi outdoor pool on the 2nd floor plus a small attached gym. The gym equipment is all top notch, but the size of the gym is very small. Buffet breakfast was very good (not spectacular) What I liked: - Very comfortable bed with premium linens - 2 nice chairs (desk and recliner....see pictures) - Flat screen TV with many stations, although only a few English news ones - Sound-proof - Rain shower nozzle - Venilation, water temperature/pressure excellent - Useful work desk with a telephone on it (as opposed to on a night table) - Hard wood floors (cleaner compared to carpet) To improve: - Size of gym is very small - Add a few English (non-news) channels - Change the 2 bottles of water in the room to free (instead of purchase) Also The premium internet is pricey @ about 22 Euro, however, the speed is the fastest I've encountered at a European hotel. Hotel shuttle to airport @ around 8am was running every 20 minutes

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prolix50
Reviews.Content: The Hilton's a new, large, and modern designed hotel. We chose it because I've had some bad Madrid airport hotel stays in the past, and our flight left at 7:15 am. Shuttle was parked at the airport when we arrived, and the first one left promptly at 5:30 am the next morning. It's about 5 minutes from terminals 1-3, and 10 from terminal 4. You can reserve spots on the shuttle you want by sending the hotel an e-mail ahead of time, via Hilton's website. They had rolls, coffee and juice out at 5:30 - don't know if that continues once breakfast opens. Check in was very smooth and polite; they accomodated my request for a quiet room further away from the freeway in front - soundproofing seemed good though - and brought a rollaway bed, extra towels, and our luggage up very promptly. Rooms have a very modern design with nice bathrooms partitioned off by sliding frosted glass doors. Restaraunt was way overpriced (19 Euros for a hamburger and fries?), with somewhat snobby and slow service (e.g., pushing bottled water even after I requested and was fine with tap), but there's no where else near to go, and for one night it was fine - the food was good. No free internet service, not even just for flight check-in, which seems strange for an airport hotel. Price during the August business doldrums in Spain was about 80 Euros via Priceline (purchased regularly - I tried bidding a bit lower but no luck). In short, a great airport hotel for one night, but I would never stay here if visiting the city for tourism - it's too far from the center to make that worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - it's a Hilton - close to airport”
Reviews.Author: TrekRef
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Had a hard time finding the Metro access but once I did it was only one Euro to go anywhere. When I had to leave before breakfast they had a carryout breakfast for me. Did not use the pay Internet but instead used the free Internet in the Executive Lounge if one has the privilege.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for those that need access to the airport”
Reviews.Author: withoutborders78
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a day before catching a connecting flight. In brief the highlights were: Modern hotel with large clean rooms and good amenities - sun deck, pool, sauna & small fitness area. (Steam bath STILL out of service). Less than a 5 minute ride from and to the airport via free shuttle. For those catching a flight the next day this is a real plus. Upgrades - I was upgraded from a standard King to an executive room with my Hilton Honors number. This gave me access to a restricted floor, with a lounge (free internet, coffee, snacks, pastries and drinks). do yourseld a favor and sign up. Value - I booked this hotel on priceline for next to nothing. Coupling that with my Hilton Honors made this a boondoggle. Lowpoints: The hotel is about a 20 minute and 25 Euro ride to the city center, so if you are looking to access the city center it will take a little time and or money. There is a Metro that is about a 10 minute walk away. You have to cross a busy street, climb stairs and have a decent sense of diection to access it, so be forewarned. The metro ride into the center is about 30 - 35 minutes, but will only cost you 1 Euro for a one way fare.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a overnight stay or business travel”
Reviews.Author: TraveLoverDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hilton for a afternoon and overnight stay in Madrid before leaving for home. In Hilton tradition, the hotel is nice, the staff friendly and the rooms comfortable. They have regular shuttle service to and from the airport (just be sure to book it with the front desk as we found out the hard way). It is also within walking distance to the Metro if you would like to go into Madrid and see the sights (which I highly recommend, Madrid is a beautiful city with lots of hidden treasures).

Reviews.Title: “4* hotel that can do way better!”
Reviews.Author: SkyE5
Reviews.Content: In the middle of nowhere, modern hotel, clean room (talking about the one I got) and good amenities - pool, sauna & fitness. Steam bath out of service though. Easy ride from and to the airport thanks to the shuttle. Hotel's website claim providing shuttle to downtown Madrid. Yes, they do but only to half way the city center. Tube is your next move to reach city center. Breakfast - although pricey, is pretty poor in terms of choice. What I most disliked was founding out rests of the day before breakfast being reheated and served as fresh ones. Same for pastry - you could break a teath eating one of their croissants. Dinner is limited too but food is tasty and very, very overpriced. Bar lounge - whatever you ask for, be sure they propose the high end of the product - I find it pittyfull since we all know expensive doesn't always stands for good.
