Although booked through worldwide leader in business travel, the requested type of room was no longer available upon arrival. This is rather negative knowing that Hilton Madrid relies on business travellers most. The day after I asked for changing to the room that it was requested and surprisingly enough I was offered a bad smelling one, I kindly refused and rather preferred going on with the one I stayed in. I would end by saying that staff is very available and does its utmost to make you feel comfortable. Would I stay there again? Not sure...

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place we will Stay when in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: ladyinmaryland
Reviews.Content: My Fiancée and I traveled to Spain for 10 days and stayed at this hotel while in Madrid. The hotel is fabulous and the staff was absolutely wonderful. I am a Diamond Level with Hilton Honors so this review is based on those benefits. Our roomy suite (Diamond Level Hilton Honors) was on the Presidential Suite 5th Floor and it was perfect. The Executive Reception area on the 4th floor was a wonderful perk that I would recommend purchasing if you are not a Hilton Honors member. The reception area offers unlimited food and drink and free internet access. The complimentary breakfast was okay as well with a variety of items as well as the cooked to order items offered at most Hilton properties. All of the staff speak English and were always very pleasant and willing to help. We experienced a problem while out to dinner when our hired driver had to be transported to the hospital. I was able to contact the hotel (the little cards the concierge gives you with the hotel info and other was vital that night) and had a bad connection and spoke very little Spanish. In frustration I just hung up. The hotel staff called back! We simply loved the staff and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Location Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ange2169
Reviews.Content: After four days in Pamplona I really needed a place to chill for the flight the next day. The Madrid Hilton fulfilled these needs, clean room, exceptional staff and a good business center. The room was well worth the value, it was comfortable and had a very elegant bathroom. The business center was relaxing and the food in it was actually very good. One thing I don't understand is my room was located on the business center floor, it had a mini bar in it thatwas very expensive. But, I could get the same thing in the business center for free! The breckfast buffet at there prices would rate a one star. It was horrible. The only good Hilton Breckfast was the Hilton in Hawaii, I've never stayed at a Hilton that had a good breckfast. Over all if back in Madrid again, I'd stay there if I needed a flight.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phil-Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: Modern and well run hotel. Van service to center city Madrid is limited to one-way travel into the city. Great rooms, breakfast and pool. Check in process was extremely efficient. Front desk staff were always prompt in meeting individual needs of the the party. In lieu of van service, metro is very close, safe and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a challenging location (for tourists)”
Reviews.Author: jeffsm5111
Reviews.Content: A really great Hilton hotel in many, many ways. Excellent staff - everyone we encountered seemed to feel privileged to serve us! Breakfast buffet (included in many rate packages, we assume) is quite good although somewhat repetitive. Restaurant good at dinner (although occasionally overwhelmed by larger dinner crowds). Frequent, free airport shuttles. This would be a perfect place to stay for a night on a layover at Madrid airport. For those who want to use this Hilton as a sightseeing base (as we did, as we were using Hilton points for a free stay), there are a few negatives. The only venue within walking distance of the hotel is a modest mall (and even that requires walking 20 minutes, part of it through a mid-level barrio, and crossing a busy street on a pedestrian bridge). It is possible to walk to the Metro in 10 minutes through a decent neighborhood - and the stop is the first on the #5 line, so it is easy to get a seat on a trip into the city. But the Metro ride then takes around 30 minutes to reach central Madrid, and changing lines can add several more minutes. There was a strike of the Metro workers while we were staying at this Hilton, and it really crippled our sightseeing for a couple of days. Taxis to downtown Madrid are 20 to 25 euros and hold a maximum of 4 passengers. We found that some taxi drivers could not locate the Hilton entrance (indeed, it is easy to see it but hard to drive to it). Once you are in the hotel, you are somewhat isolated with few options. We did locate one Madrid sightseeing company (Madrid Day Tours, aka Spain Day Tours) that will provide private tours of Madrid and nearby cities (Toledo, Avila, Segovia, etc.) with pick-up and drop-off directly at the hotel. We found this service well worth the extra cost given the location of the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “One of My favorite 4*”
Reviews.Author: MikePM
Reviews.Content: Perfect Airport location, but very hard to find by Car of Cab/Taxi. Very nice layout, fashion and Spacious....but to my test lack some painting and more Art pieces (although I can see the idea behind the architecture). -One of the best value for money Hilton Buffet meal!!! Great rooms, very modern and clean. -The Front desk management tend to rotate quite a lot though, I believe they have a new Front desk manager, all I can say is that the previous one (I guess he left in December) was excellent and did went the extra miles). I hope that the new management will be as good. -Top Breakfast. -Great service overall. -Poor selection of international newspaper (apart for the usual US one). -Not too sure about the Bar layout and the noise at night time when the bar is busy, you might want to get a room on the left aisle of the hotel if you are looking for a very very quiet night. -No free internet!! Hilton Policy I guess... -Easy car park (once you find the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: mm3003
Reviews.Content: This was a business and leisure trip as I went for work but my family, wife and 2 kids also stayed there, so business for me, leisure for them. We were upgraded to a suite as we were a family of 4 and the suite was just beautiful. Overall, it's a really beautiful property, rooms are very nicely decorated. A lot of choices to eat in the hotel which you need as the hotel is not close to any restaurants. Breakfast is a buffet and very nice. The hotel has a shuttle which is only good for transport to airport and they will drop you to Madrid but wont pick you from Madrid. The train station is a good 15 minute walk and not easy as you have to cross the highway and climb many stairs so very difficult with kids and stroller. This hotel is also very expensive around 150euros per night. Although i will say worth for the quality you receive. I would recommend this hotel for someone who has business in that area, otherwise I would advice to get a hotel near madrid if you are visiting madrid to sightsee.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and rooms; usurious rates on extras”
Reviews.Author: WhisperingSquash
Reviews.Content: Good: Stunning hotel with beautiful rooms; state of the art entertainment in room; free shuttle to airport; breakfast buffet was very good Bad: All extras were outrageously expensive, and clearly directed at business travelers who are billing to their companies; food and drink were extremely expensive and thoroughly mediocre Wifi: 22 euros per day for full access is an unacceptable rate to charge under any circumstances; 10 euros per hour for limited bandwidth is a sick joke Bed: king sized bed; room was very quiet

Reviews.Title: “Modern Upscale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DFHS
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before our flight home from a two week Spanish vacation. Our cab driver had a hard time getting off the freeway and around to the hotel - then dropped us off at the conference center! We ended up pulling our luggage up the hill to the Hilton - but it wasn't a very long walk. The airport Hilton is ultra modern. We had a large upgraded room and found everything quite comfortable. There really isn't anything around the hotel so we ate dinner in the restaurant. It was nothing special and expensive but convenient. There was a large selection for the breakfast buffet. The shuttle to the airport was reliable and quick. A very nice stay for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but hard to live in it”
Reviews.Author: AThena53
Reviews.Content: We selected the Hilton Madrid Airport for an overnight stay before our flight home from Madrid. I was concerned because some reviews said that taxi drivers had trouble finding the hotel, but the one who picked us up at the train station knew where it was and didn't even need to use his GPS. We were on a Reward stay but, as is typical of Hilton's gracious treatment of guests on reward stays at its European properties, we were upgraded to a room on the Executive floor with lounge access. The lounge actually had a better selection of evening food than the one at the Hilton Diagonal Mar in Barcelona where we'd just been, with a friendly young trainee named Pierre working hard to anticipate everyone's needs and offer refills and extra food. The breakfast offerings in the lounge were slimmer than in Barcelona; mostly breads and cereals. Free breakfast in the restaurant was also available so we chose that. It was fine- the usual breads, cheeses, meats as well as hot items. The lounge had 2 computers with free Internet access. Connection in the room was expensive so I didn't bother with it. I loved the pool- it had a moveable roof over both the pool and sundeck so that the extent of coverage could vary with the outdoor temperature. Ah, but then there's the bad news. They appear to have given some interior designer carte blanche to make the rooms stylish without any notion as to how it would work when actual humans lived in them. The floors in the bathroom, including the shower, were so slick when wet that we put down towels because my husband has a bit of a balance problem. The walls are frosted glass. This means that if you turn on the light when you use it at night you risk disturbing the sleep of the other room occupant. This might cause one to (theoretically, of course) use the bidet instead of the toilet since they both feel the same in the dark. Oops. The shower was lined with mirrors but they steamed up immediately, so my husband noted that they were useless for shaving. The sink was a giant scoop-shaped indentation in the glass countertop, which left little room around the edges for toiletries. This lack of attention to practicality was continued in the restaurant at breakfast where they eschewed plebian salt shakers at the table in favor of bowls of various fancy sea salts at the buffet. You should also ask about airport shuttle times; I overheard the doorman say that during certain times of the day the drivers take breaks and then the shuttle runs only hourly. Make sure you know which one to take. I suppose we'd use this hotel again, but the overwhelming priority given to appearance over practicality and comfort takes it down a notch in our view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent contemporary hotel outside city center”
Reviews.Author: cstratton14
Reviews.Content: A very contemporary design hotel with out-of-the-ordinary rooms, providing and interesting and enjoyable stay. Convenient, free shuttle service to Madrid Airport and surprising easily and readily accessible to Madrid city center by taxi, and probably by other public transportation. Very helpful, English-speaking staff. HHonors upgrade to the executive floor and breakfast was a real bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hobbyistravel
Reviews.Content: If I could give 4.5 starts, I would. As other reviewers have noticed, this is a lovely hotel with outstandingly well-designed rooms with every mod. con. There is a real big city Spanish flair in the decoration of the rooms and the common areas. Big leather chairs in the dining room downstairs. We were here for a short 12 hour layover, but we really enjoyed it. We splurged on the buffet dinner, which was well worth it. Many regional delicacies, along with the usual crowd pleasers. We were there at the same time as a U.S. company (Dominos pizza) were having a small conference - who knows what they were doing in Madrid, but anyway, the staff were a bit pushed trying to cope with so many of them. Even the products in the bathroom seemed a cut above. Our flight was too early to try and get breakfast, but we peeked in, and that looked good too. I was a bit nervous when we checked in, because it was hot outside, and the big stylish corridors were very warm. However, the aircon in the room worked flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Stopping By”
Reviews.Author: MaritimeExplorers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful! With glass elevators, hallways that are open and all look down to the lobby area below, and dark modern rooms the Hilton is very pleasing to the eye. We were upgraded to a nice corner room, with a rainfall shower, and whirl pool tub. We were there for less than a 24 hour period, so the location was perfect, a quick cab or free shuttle ride to the airport. However beware, if you are coming to Madrid for any extended period of time, there is nothing in this area of town except the airport itself. We also enjoyed the breakfast (which was complimentary, Hilton preferred guests). All in all it was a great stay, and I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Mewsic
Reviews.Content: Spectacular hotel. New and beautifully designed. My room was well-laid out, well-lit, very clean. I stayed here only because of a 12 hour layover in Madrid, but it was a nice experience. Gorgeous, fully equipped bathroom with a shower AND a tub. The bed was comfortable and even though the room looked out onto a highway and was very close to the airport, when the windows were closed it was very quiet. The food was quite good, too. However, I put a room service breakfast hang tag on my door in the evening for breakfast the next morning and no one came to pick it up. Fortunately, I checked the door in the morning (having learned from other experiences) and saw they hadn't picked it up, so called room service. Also, the room was a smoking room even though I had requested a non-smoking one. Fortunately, a couple of hours with the windows open and max air circulation, most of the odor disappeared. As for the location (a 5-minute free shuttle ride from the airport), I don't know how easy it would be to get into the city from here, but I suspect that the location of this hotel would not be ideal for tourists. And even though it's a great hotel in many ways, it could be anywhere. There was little about it that told me I was outside the US, let along in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great experience, worth the drive into Madrid city center”
Reviews.Author: jslwest
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times on business trips to Madrid. I have stayed at hotels in the city center, as well. However, because I am so very impressed with the staff and service at this hotel, I prefer to stay here. The front desk staff is friendly and attentive. The lounge staff is always there to help. The food in the restaurant is great. Drinks at the bar may take a little longer than most, but it is only because the bar staff takes extra care to ensure your drink is perfect. I have stayed at a lot of hotels and a lot of Hiltons and this one is the best because of the people who work there. I highly recommend this hotel and prefer not to stay anywhere else when in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average hotel airport experience”
Reviews.Author: Lanie54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a night at the Hilton because of a change in flights due to the Iceland volcano. We arrived at the airport via metro from the Chamartin train station, had a little difficulty finding the hotel's courtesy shuttle stop, but then didn't have to wait too long for it. The driver was extremely courteous and it was a short trip to the hotel). The hotel is ultra-modern, very much a "corporate" and American style Hilton but after all, who stays at the airport if they're looking for a cultural experience.Check-in was quick, with questions answered about dinner and shuttle for the next day. The rooms are ultra-modern....lots of glass and high-tech, which was amusing after a week in more boutique European small hotels. The only food available at night was the dinner buffet -- at first we were disappointed because we prefer menu service and thought we wanted something lighter. But after seeing the buffet, we were happy -- very complete, very fresh foods, and not outrageous (35 euros per person, with a 10% discount offered at check-in) for what many airport hotels can charge. (Still, many guests might want something less and there was absolutely nothing else available.) We also had 2 glasses of wine -- both free with coupons at check in. The airport shuttle the next morning left right on time -- although is was totally full. Not sure what would happen if there were more people than seats. If you need to be at the airport for an early or late flight, the Hilton is a good choice -- close, well-run, new, and the perks (discounts, free wine) certainly made us feel better about a slightly more expensive-than-average night. If we had been in Madrid before the flight, we would probably have stayed downtown and taken a taxi. But we had been in Segovia and had no need to go into downtown Madrid for the last night. It was very convenient to get from Segovia by local train to the Nuevos Ministerios metro stop, then take a short metro ride to the airport. If we had gone downtown for the night, we might have spent less on a hotel (maybe) but probably had taxi fares in both directions.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice motel.”
Reviews.Author: 2dogsAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for a single night prior to an international flight. It was great and far better than expected for an airport hotel. The rooms were very clean and modern. Nice bathroom. We had dinner and breakfast at the hotel dining room which was good but not great. I agree with others that it is a bit pricey for meals. You can walk to a metro station which we did and for a euro were able to travel downtown. Shuttle to the airport is about every 20 minutes. The pool in the fitness center is very nice with a retractable roof and large open windows that give you the feeling of being outdoors despite cold weather. I really liked the stay at this hotel and would recommend it to others who are transiting through Madrid or even for a several night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel but overpriced & too "Corporate" American”
Reviews.Author: Khas3chikas
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled to have such a great place to stay the night before catching our flight home to the states. Spain had treated us right & although we loved our vacation, we were ready to go home. The Hilton staff was friendly, helpful, and welcoming. It was nice to be at a place that melded our European experience with some little reminders of travel in America. Unfortunately, those reminders turned into corporate gouging when we had to pay $8 for a cerveza & $14 for a glass of sangria! It ended up costing us more to stay at the Hilton on our way out of town (for less than 12 hours of time there) then it did staying 1 night at a beautiful palace in Sevilla earlier in our trip (Hotel Palacio De Villapanes)! That seems crazy & woefully American. Aside from that annoyance, it truly is a comfortable & well appointed hotel that would be agreeable to anyone willing to spend the money.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: mishka1809
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hilton for 2 nights in November 2009. We were looking for a hotel close to the airport given our flight schedules. Our expectations were low. We didn't realize that the hotel had been recently developed and opened. We were extremely surprised by our experience. Starting from check-in, the front desk staff was extremely professional and helpful. Check-in was relatively problem free. Once we arrived in our room, we were shocked by how large and clean our standard room was. The bathroom was quite large and clean. The tub had ample room for two. The water pressure in the shower was wonderful. Our bed was extremely comfortable. Did I mention how clean the room was? We ordered room service during our stay. We found the food to be satisfactory. The delivery was timely. I was able to utilize high-speed internet services with no difficulty. Although located close to the freeway, we did not hear any noise. This hotel is perfect for someone who needs to rest between flights. The Hilton offers free shuttle service to the airport. Given its distance from Madrid, I wouldn't recommend the hotel if you plan on visiting the city often. That said, I would happily stay here again if I wanted a comfortable place to relax before leaving Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, but not close to Madrid sights”
Reviews.Author: stlouistraveler007
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is terrific. Very modern, cool rooms (good size), amazing space-age bathrooms. Great food, great bar, but one big problem: it's not really in Madrid. Very good if you are going to Madrid airport (we stayed there 2 nights before leaving; free hotel shuttle at very frequent intervals), but not easy to get into city. You can take shuttle to airport and then walk about a mile thru terminals to Metro, which is great, clean, or walk from hotel about a mile to closest metro stop, then many stops into city. Metro is nice, and hotel is great, but not cheap, and the food is quite pricey, with nothing else nearby. Wouldn't suggest it except on your way in or out of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Dafsmum
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 day stay at the Madrid Hilton which offered a convenient free shuttle from and back to the airport upon our departure. The hotel was clean and modern, was staffed with very friendly and helpful employees, and with my Hilton rewards membership, we were upgraded to the executive floors with access to the private lounge which offered snacks, beverages, and internet access. Our room also included the extensive breakfast buffet offered in the hotel restaurant each morning. The room itself was modern and had a very large bathroom by European standards. While the hotel is not near the downtown area, it was an easy (approximately 10 minute) walk to the metro station. The hotel also offered periodic shuttles to the bull-fighting museum from which one could grab the metro from that location in order to avoid the walk to the nearest metro station from the hotel. If you like your hotel to be in the heart of the action, this hotel is not for you. But we were not inconvenienced at all by taking the metro in and out of the city during our stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest Airport Hotels I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: caricature
Reviews.Content: The Good I chose this hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. I had a long layover in Madrid so I had to stay overnight but didn't feel like going all the way downtown. I do not regret my decision! This is one of the nicest and modern airport hotels I have ever seen. Think glass elevators. Think open concept. I paid about 80 euros including breakfast for a Saturday night. I realize that this is usually the slowest time during a week for an airport hotel, but nevertheless I was happy! the rooms were gorgeous, sleek, modern and very spacious. I could stay in there all day! The breakfast is basically served in the front lobby I guess you could say... there's no partition to the breakfast room (like I said open concept). Very very nice and service was excellent. The Bad Well, since it IS an airport hotel, you can't give it bad rating because of the location. What do you expect? But I do give it 4 stars out of 5, based on the fact that there are other airport hotels within easier walking distance to restaurants and to a shopping mall. This Hilton is not surrounded by much at all. HOWEVER, they do offer a free shuttle service to attractions in the vicinity, like a shopping mall (which I did use it for, and it was a great shopping mall too!). Please check the shuttle schedule though. I was there on a Saturday and the shuttle service stops sometime in the evening, I don't remember. Overall, I would loooveeeee to stay here again. I went through Madrid on another layover a week later, and well, unfortunately the price was higher this time so I picked the Melia airport instead. Not the same thing at all. This Hilton is MUCH nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptably long wait for the courtesy bus.”
Reviews.Author: misstic
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel rather than travel to the city centre as my flight arrived late in the evening. What a mistake. I waited for an hour for the courtesy bus and had to call the hotel to rouse the driver who had been on a break for all of that time, along with his fellow drivers. At least this was the best I was offered by way of an explanation. When I finally arrived at the hotel, cold and tired, there were half a dozen large police officers at reception following up an incident of some sort. The room was fine but in the end it would have taken less time to travel into the centre, so I'll be giving this one a miss in future.

Reviews.Title: “truely 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: shoshosho
Reviews.Content: We stauyed at this hotel for 1 night. The hotel is extremely modern and clean. the staffs were very nice. They gave us a free shuttle service to Madrid. When we return, we took a Metro. It was ~ 10min walk from the hotel. the hotel is nice at al aspects. This was our first night in Spain, and t was a truely great experience. BTW, I am a Gold HH, and as compared to other hotels I stayed, this is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern”
Reviews.Author: daisymiami8
Reviews.Content: This was a one night stay for an international flight. The hotel is ultra modern but cold without personality. We came to a dark room and it took about five minutes to find the lights. The bed is comfortable. The breakfast is expensive 20 euros in advance or 26 in the morning. The hotel is so isolated that there is no other breakfast choice. Convenient but only recommended for travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel.........”
Reviews.Author: Susannealtea
Reviews.Content: We just spent a night at this great hotel, on our way to Punta Cana. It was great, we almost didn't want to leave!!! They had kindly upgraded us to a fabulous suite, and we enjoyed every minute of it. Check in was easy.....and as we got there late, we went straight down to have dinner, in the lovely "courtyard setting". Next days breakfast was also enjoyable. After which The Hilton shuttlebus took us back to the airport, in time for our next flight.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Convenient Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaArchitect
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton for four nights. It is wonderful for air travelers with a convenient location to close-by Barajas. It is quiet, lovely, and the staff is very friendly. The cost of food is absurd. The cost of internet is even more absurd $30/Day. They swear the airport shuttle runs every 20 minutes. That was not our experience. My wife has bad knees, so we took the metro to/from the city via the airport to use the hotel shuttle. We spent two nights freezing in the dark waiting for airport shuttles, One night we waited 55 minutes, the next we waited 75 minutes. We also had the experience of one zipping right by us without even looking at the stop to see if anyone was there. If you arrive into Madrid by train getting to the hotel would be a very expensive cab ride. Take the metro (watch for pickpockets) to the Airport T-2 and take the hotel shuttle. Don't try to arrive using the (closer by) metro stop Alameda De Osuna as there is no shuttle or taxi service and you will be lost in a mid-rise housing jungle near that metro stop. Not fun in the rain. So, in the future. if I were to coming to Madrid to see Madrid, I'd stay somewhere closer in. If I were coming to use the airport, I'd absolutely stay at this lovely Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DublinBrenGun
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with very helpful staff. Shuttle from the airport was great and only took 3 -4 minutes. The reception staff were also happy to arrange shuttle to the nearest metro station if shuttle was available. Walk to metro only took 10 minutes anyway. Room was very modern and comfortable. While it's an airport hotel and a bit out of town (15 - 20 mins on metro), it's well worth the trouble and I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable for Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-Roo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hilton Madrid Airport for one night when traveling back to the US from Morocco. When I arrived at the airport I called to see when I would be able to catch the shuttle and they said it runs every 20 minutes. As I walked over to the shuttle pick up area, the Hilton bus was arriving but instead of stopping to wait it cruised right though, not even slowing to see if anyone would stand to get on board. I was quite frustrated with that so when the next shuttle came through I immediatly flagged it down. The ride to the hotel is very short and the hotel was very comtemporary and clean. I was on the Hilton Hhonors floor and found my room to be very comfortable. I went to the HHonors lounge and the staff was very friendly and helpful, especially when printing my boarding pass for the next day. Their English was very good and there were no problems with communication. My only complaint is the 22 Euros for internet access in your room - I thought this fee was quite high compared to most hotels that I have stayed in. Room service was very good and their service was prompt. I also found several English speaking channels on TV which was refreshing since most hotels have only one channel.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: Airport hotels have many different uses but for the most part, they cater to the overnight guests who are between two flights, or "connecting" to/from another mode of transportation. Such hotel need to be conveniently located, with frequent shuttle service (if not connected to airport directly), clean, efficient for check-in/check-out, business amenities (internet...), flexible hours for room service/restaurant and so on. From the perspective, the Hilton Madrid met my expectation (only "negative" was the wait for the shuttle from the airport which was above 20 minutes). The hotel has a very modern and contemporary look throughout. This Hilton property use the NOR-1 system for upgrades at time of check-in. For those not familiar with this system, after booking, it allows one to be on a waiting list for a room in a higher category (such as executive floor or suites) at a deep discount versus regular price. If the "requested" upgrade is available at time of check-in, the guest is automatically upgraded for the agreed upon extra. There is a lot of debate on the merit of such system, especially among members of Hilton's frequent guest programs. Some would argue that top members should have access to any rooms, including suite, without having to premiums whereas others see the opportunity to get access to a better room that what they would be entitled to for a deep discount. I actually decided to apply for the upgrade and requested the Health/spa room which include an oversized bathroom with jacuzzi. The room as well is much larger than the standard room and seem to feature upgraded amenities - for a very reasonable premium of 19euros. This was a great room and did not regret my decision The hotel has an executive lounge which features two internet/computer station. Standard complimentary breakfast is available in the morning but top-tier members are also invited to enjoy a complimentary full "american" breakfast in the main restaurant. Food was of good quality and service was friendly. Another good thing is that the hotel room had been prepared as requested. Due to allergies, I always request feather pillows/duvet to be removed prior to arrival. i have found that this request is carried appropriately only 50% of the time. Upon check-in, they acknowledged my request and indicated that the upgraded room had been prepared as desired - this is even more important at an airport location where you often either check-in late or check-out early and don't want to waste time dealing with problems/housekeeping... Very friendly staff throughout the hotel, including shuttle driver. As an airport hotel, there is not much to say about the location, other than it is close to the airport, and one of the main highway. Not much to really see and do around. Very highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Grear Airport Hotel...Yu can trust it ...”
Reviews.Author: mpremoli
Reviews.Content: I was left on hold by Iberia on December 22nd and went by mysef to the Hilton, great, clean, excellent food and breakfast...if you are left in Barajas go to the hilton

Reviews.Title: “Slick hotel, rooms so cool, need ph.d for lights, eat before you arrive”
Reviews.Author: thsNewYork
Reviews.Content: Got a really good rate on the rooms- lost all the savings on food. Staying as a layover - came directly from airport. We were starving. Ate in the hotel's restaurant - literally there is no other show in town near this hotel ( unless you want to go into madrid). The food was obscenely expensive. Hamburger 22euro ~$36! and not fantastic. Rooms so cool! My suggestion, stay here for convenience but eat at the airport before you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, but very far from center city Madrid”
Reviews.Author: HobokenTravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, although feels a bit "sterile". I was shocked at the extremely high rating for this hotel. While I would recommend the hotel to someone with an early morning flight the next day, there have to be many better options for those touring Madrid. Also, the prices for their restaurant and room service were a bit outrageous, but we had no choice as there are no other restaurants that are a reasonable distance to the hotel. Overall, I'd say the hotel was very nice, but certainly not worthy of a top 20 ranking on TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Logistics from / to Hotel can be improved”
Reviews.Author: TravellerPoland
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Madrid aiport at just before 2300 and I was not at this hotel until 2350 due to the Hotel's shuttle service. The Hotel is just 2 miles from the airport so Taxis do not want to make this trip and the shuttle service is very poorly organised (or at least was the night I arrived). At first I was told it would be 15 minutes for the shuttle. Then after 20 minutes I was told it would be another 15 minutes as the driver was confused as to where I was - Terminal 1 should be well known as it is the Star Alliance terminal. Then when no one showed up I took a Taxi (Euros 15 for 2 miles which is a huge overcharge) and demanded the hotel reimburse me which they did. Conclusion do not stay here if you want the supposed convenience of an aiport location as it would have been quicker to take a taxi most of the way into town (20 minutes at that hour) than to wait for the shuttle. Of course if the real purpose of the trip is to stay near the airport then OK this is a fine hotel with many top quality features.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: nbhanage
Reviews.Content: Hotel is excellent for Business purpose. Rooms are quite large due innovative design. Interior is stylish & modern. Service is very good. Only drawback is location as it is outside of main city.

Reviews.Title: “Very far from city center”
Reviews.Author: flyingmg
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days during Thanksgiving break for leisure. VERY far from city. It took 1 hour to get to the city center. AVOID this hotel if you want to visit the city instead of airport. There is no nearby restaurants, shopping or anything ! No fun at all. Officially shuttle runs every 15 minutes but drivers took breaks. For example, no shuttle between 10:15 and 11:05 AM. You could end up waiting at airport for 50 minutes without shuttle and not knowing it. Madrid is cold ....... so be aware. The young doorman is very friendly, responsive and helpful. But front desk was a little less eager to help and rushy sometimes. The check-in lady became obviously less warm after I rejected her upgrad offer (35 ERO extra a day for a jacuzzie room). Room is modern and comfortable. But my computer chair armrest is about to fell off. Maybe they used some cheap but flashy furniture. House keeping is really BELOW AVERAGE. Problems almost daily. Bathtub was not cleaned, no soap one day, sink stop working, two conditioners without any shampoo ..... Breakfeast buffet is high quality. But again service is poor. If you don't ask for coffee when seated, you have to make special request for it. Staff took long time for any request. They also let dirty plates accumulating on your table. The worst of all is no FREE INTERNET. For business, 33 ERO a day and For personal use, 20 ERO. OUTRAGEOUS !!! Overall, nice facilities but poor services. Stay for one night for next day flight is OK. More than that, avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “I’m surprised that this hotel scores so highly on Trip Advisor.”
Reviews.Author: Just-one-trip-a-year
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel is not at the airport: It must be about 6 miles away. If your flight to Madrid arrives at Terminal 1, 2 or 3 you’ll have a 10-minute ride in the shuttle bus to the hotel. If you arrive at terminal 4 it’ll be more like 20-25 minutes, as you’ll swing by the other terminals to pick up passengers. We waited 30 minutes before being picked up, making our total journey time from the airport to the hotel almost 55 minutes. I grew up in Glasgow, Scotland and a 2-minute walk from the Holiday Inn lobby takes you right into the terminal building! It’s worth bearing these times in mind when you’re heading for an outbound flight too. When we requested a bus to the airport we were told the driver was on his break and it would be about 45 minutes before we could leave. We opted to get a Taxi instead which cost 18 Euros, despite the meter reading 14 – either that’s something to do with being dropped on the airport, or it’s a scam! Secondly, the price: Clearly their market is Business Travellers, so this might not come as a shock to some of you. The room price is fine – I have no complaints about this - but Hilton know how to charge for extras. Examples from the minibar: Coca Cola – 4.50 Euro; bottled water – 3.50 Euros; Snickers bar – 4.50 Euros; and Pringles (a 43gram tub containing perhaps 25 of the potato snacks) – 6.00 Euros. If you fancy a Gin and Tonic it’ll set you back 13 Euros. The nearest shop selling soft drinks and snacks is about 10 minutes walk from the hotel, but it closes at 8 or 9pm. You’d get the Coke, the water, the Snickers and the Pringles for the price of a Coke at the hotel. I also consider the cost of Internet access to be high (That’s right, you have to pay for it!). 24 hours will cost you 22 Euros at the business rate or 17 Euros for the, slower, Economy rate. I pay about this for 1 month’s access at home! You can buy 1 hour of non-consecutive use for 10 Euros. We recently stayed at the lovely Parador de Santa Cruz in the Canary Islands where the Internet access was fast and FREE (and the room rate about half that of the Madrid Hilton!) Here’s a tip though: I didn’t pay for any Internet access but found that Skype (the Voice Over Internet Phone) worked just fine! A couple of other things: The hotel is located in a business area. Nearby buildings are either office blocks or industrial units. If you like to take a stroll after dinner, this place isn’t for you as there’s nothing of note in the vicinity. The Metro station is a 10-15-minute walk and the train takes 30 minutes to get to the heart of Madrid. The two rooms we had were both of a very high standard. Both had a very modern décor of polished wooden floor, glass-fronted wardrobe and glass and chrome furniture. The bathrooms had glass bowls, which were beautiful if slightly impractical. The wall from the shower, which faced into the room, was made of frosted glass - which meant that showering wasn’t a wholly private affair! Overall the rooms were very stylish, but perhaps slightly ‘cold’. During our second stay we had a ‘Hilton Deluxe King’ room which was 40 Euro per night more expensive than the standard 79 Euro room. If I chose to stay again, I’d stick to the standard room because I don’t think the difference merits 40 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for early airport flights”
Reviews.Author: anchmer
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel as purely a stop over between flights - one that arrived late and the other that left early the next morning. The free airport shuttle was wonderful - it was waiting for me as I arrived and the journey was very quick. As others say, the rooms are very roomy with all the bells and whistles - tea/coffee, air con, shower, bath, etc. The only thing that disappointed was the high charges for use of the internet - something around 35 cents per minute. Considering the rate of the room, free or cheaper access would have been appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “If you need to be close to the airport would not dream of staying anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: MtyMom
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel. After vacationing in Europe it was like coming home because the rooms were big, there was a fantastic spa like tub, wonderful bed, plenty of towels and pillows, roomy....it was just great! It was also beautiful, and the breakfast buffet was over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: James_in_LPdeGC
Reviews.Content: Superb airport hotel with regular (every 20 minutes) shuttle transfers to/from each terminal. Brilliant staff - all communicate in English extremely well and articulately. Service was excellent, breakfast was by far the best we've ever come across at an airport stop. Hotel is a little way from the city - but you stay here for its proximity to the AIRPORT, not to the city centre. Even so, the metro line is a mere 5 minutes walk away or take the shuttle to Terminal 4 and take the metro from there (but you'll pay the airport metro supplement). The building is very modern and stylish. Massive atrium and clean corridors with the grandeur you expect with entering a 5 star hotel. In our experience Expedia have the best rates. Try an Executive room if you can - you get slippers and access to as much bubbly you like in the evening in the exec lounge!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Kathy064
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Madrid Airport Hilton for two nights en route to Rome and a cruise. Hotel ultra modern, close to airport but inconvenient to Old Madrid. Not sure of our terminal and gate, called the desk for local number of Iberia. After a couple of tries and long hold, was connected to English speaking person. The total cost of the call was 64.75 euros! The hotel was almost empty and felt they were gouging their customers. Best way to get to historic Madrid is to take shuttle to airport and then take the Metro. Overall a nice hotel but was left with a bad impression. Don't use the phone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Close to the Airport far from town”
Reviews.Author: Taymur M
Reviews.Content: Transiting from Seville, Spain to Karachi, Pakistan , we chose the Madrid Hilton for the one night stay. Following an early morning check in we soon realized the metro train station was only a 7-10 minute walk from the hotel. However the station is the last one on the track and thus it takes 30+ minutes to reach the center of Madrid. Besides the long trek on the train to town, the hotel is excellent and highly recommended by my wife and I. For those who enjoy steaks, the fillet in the room service menu was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let them call you a taxi!”
Reviews.Author: hcmjkm
Reviews.Content: This is overall a nice hotel; very modern and clean, with mostly friendly staff. The breakfast is huge and delicious; make sure your rate includes it. Also, be aware that the hotel is located in a very hard-to-find place and isn't on many taxi's GPS systems. But you need to know about a big surprise when you let them call you a taxi instead of just getting in one yourself. This problem was experienced by two other guests as well as me within two days. We went to the lobby to catch a taxi, and planned to go outside and get a taxi that was dropping someone else off - there are always taxis coming and going and you never have to wait more than a few minutes. We were stopped (politely) by the front desk staff asking if we needed a taxi. We said yes, and they said 'we will call you a taxi.' I said no, we'll just go outside and get in a taxi that is dropping someone off, and they said 'no, we need to call you a taxi because no taxis will be outside'. I said 'there are taxis outside all the time and we can wait a few minutes for the next one, there is no rush' but they said 'please let us call a taxi'. So we waited about 5 minutes and a taxi came to drop someone off. We went to the taxi but he said 'did you call? I don't want to take you because this hotel likes to call taxis and they give me a hard time if I pick someone up and I'm not the taxi they called'. Then another taxi came and the bellman said 'this one is your taxi'. We started to get in the second taxi and noticed the meter already had time on it - about E3,75 ($5.60). We said 'you need to reset your meter' and the taxi driver said 'no, I start the meter when they call me'. We got out of the taxi and told the belllman that we would not pay for time when we were not in the taxi, and no one said anything about this policy, and besides we had wanted just to get in a taxi as it was dropping someone off, and it was the hotel that had insisted that we let them call a taxi. He acted shocked and offended and said 'no, you asked us to call a taxi and this is the way they do it and you have to pay'. I said 'I am getting in the other taxi and you better not try to stop me', so we walked toward the first taxi, but the bellman told the other taxi driver to get out of the taxi and went inside to get the manager. So the manager came out and started arguing with us herself! She said the same things: 'you asked us to call a taxi, you have to pay the amount on the meter, you can't get into the other taxi,' etc. We refused and said we would walk down the street to get a taxi but we would under no circumstance pay for the added fees that they caused despite our clear request to get a taxi that was already there. By this time, the meter was up to almost 6 euros. Then the bellman said 'look, I will pay the taxi myself for the fee - I pay it myself from my own money if you want a free taxi' whereupon I walked up to him and said 'what did you say? I didn't ask for a free taxi - I also didn't ask you to call me a taxi when I get one myself without your extra fee, so don't accuse me of trying to get a free taxi' At long, long last, they finally relented and let the original taxi driver get back in his taxi and take us, and we left the taxi they had called. The following day, the day manager said to us at the front desk 'oh, you are the ones with the taxi last night - my bellman paid for your taxi'. Obviously our story had been shared with the entire staff - how inappropriate. When we arrived at the hotel two days earlier, a very nice couple was arguing with the bellman about the taxi, and they were very upset. I had not known what they were arguing about at the time. But then I got to know that other couple, who were at the same conference we were, and after all this happened, they told me that the same thing had happened to them - exactly. They were visiting from Nigeria and were still quite upset that the hotel was forcing them to call a taxi when there were taxis right in front of the hotel, and not disclosing the fact that calling a taxi results in an extra fee being added to the fare, in addition to having to wait longer. In other words, this is not an isolated case of someone not understanding something, or an isolated case of some crazy customer wanting special treatment. This is in fact a common occurrence, which demonstrates that normal people do not expect to be treated this way, and also demonstrates the hotel didn't just forget to tell us about the extra fees - they apparently hide these fees from everyone. This is POOR customer service at best, and at worst, is probably indicative of a scheme with local taxi drivers to share the extra profits caused by this absurd policy. It is quite telling how hard the front desk staff tries to get guests to let them call a taxi, and NEVER says a word about the extra fees, or that fact that in most cases while we were there, it would have always been faster to wait for an arriving taxi than to wait for one you call. It was also incredible how long the hotel staff argued with its guests! Not just us, but the other couple, and another couple they knew about - THREE times in two days, hotel staff causing a huge scene outside the hotel trying to force this corrupt scheme onto its own guests. And for the bellman to use sarcasm with me, telling me I wanted a 'free taxi'? It's now been almost a week since this happened, and it amazes me every time I think about it how hotel staff two or three times allowed an angry scene to develop as they argued with their guests about hidden fees. This is a Hilton?

Reviews.Title: “Awesome design and service”
Reviews.Author: SihamA3
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, a bit expensive breakfast, but great service and very nice furniture. And the bathroom was just so nice designed. Its a bit far from city but very close to the airport so its perfect if you just want to relax on a transit route or something.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but its too expensive...”
Reviews.Author: Visidigi
Reviews.Content: A recent stay in Madrid for a week resulted in me needing a hotel change (see my review of the Holiday Inn Express Madrid Airport as to why...) I decided to try the Hilton Madrid Airport for a couple of nights, at 150 euros (£150/$225USD) room only it certainly wasn't cheap, but I figured for two nights it was worth trying given I had to now find a hotel for my second week in Madrid too. The two nights were fine, the room given was on the 6th floor and the first irritation occured at check in, with me being asked if my company allowance would cover 65 euros to add Internet, Breakfast and Executive lounge access, I advised with the cost saving measures and more so the horrific £/Euro exchange rate they wouldn't. I was still given the executive floor room (3 of the 6 floors are) but told I was not entitled to the upgraded features without paying 65 euros as mentioned before (it reminded me why I like IHG group hotels, when you get an upgrade you get the full upgrade not a half hearted attempt) Aside from the check in the room was nice and well appointed, as was the bathroom - the room lights were irritating though, with the master switch causing either all lights to be on or off, even from the bed side switches... Room service was quick, the Club Sandwich is good in any Hilton I go to it seems, although 29 euros for one with a beer is steep - thats £29/$45USD for ONE sandwich. Then there was the breakfast - 28 Euros, £28/$43USD each - the WiFi was 1 euro an hour charged in 24 hour intervals, yup, 24 euros £25/$35USD for 24 hours internet access - absolute rip off. Its too expensive, just far too expensive, what's more there are less and less companies out there who are now willing to pay these prices. I am in a different hotel over the road from the Hilton as I write this, the WiFi is free, the hotel is better equiped and is MUCH cheaper - I will of course give it the full review treatment when I checkout. The Hilton needs to look over its shoulder and over its charges - its now far too expensive - but I guess if you have the money then its good enough...

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, comfortable and convenient for airport”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCelt
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room on the executive floor for two nights. I choose the hotel as I was flying in late Sunday night and leaving early Tuesday morning. When staying in a Madrid airport hotel I normally use the Novotel, but decided to try something different. From now on this hotel will be my first choice in such cases. My room was impressively designed and equipped. Very comfortable indeed. All the small touches were there e.g. good toiletries, absolutely huge bath towels and a bath robe. Room service was quick and the selection better than average. The quality was also more than acceptable. The executive lounge had a good range of food and drinks, but was laid out like a cafe with lots of small tables and upright chaits. This was the only disappointment, but could be easily fixed by providing more armchairs and coffee tables.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAPMAN
Reviews.Content: OK. I dont normally stay at 4-5 star hotels, but did the night before our flight. It is a super hotel. They offer us a 65 Euro upgrade for Exec. floor. A good deal if you get there in early afternoon and leave noonish the next day. Exec. lounge has heavy snacks in afternoon and desserts and drinks (incl beer and wine). Open til 11pm. Also it incl. full breakfast. So if you figure dinner and breakfast for 2 (and drinks and PC free access) worth the price for 2. Very quiet and everything functions well (hot water, A/C, evevators,etc.) If you go out, walk 4 blocks East (away from freeway) for some small local restaurants, at much less than Hilton prices. Hilton does shuttle people to Metro at Ventas, but not sure of schedule. From Ventas, can get downtown in about 4 metro stops. Hotel is hard to find as Google maps not accurate. But the Metro stop ¨Alameta de Osuna¨ if coming from Madrid downtown is a 3.50 Euro taxi to Hilton. And in Madrid the Handicap metro stations, about 40% and indicated on most maps, have elevators to the metro platforms -- good for bags. Just travel at non-peak times 10am - 4pm. Of course, Hilton does offer shuttle to-from airport (a different Metro line than above). Hilton does have a decent map of Madrid downtown AND area around airport - issued by Sixt rental car. And offers good directions if you need it. Overall, a great hotel and available thru priceline at a good price. I think my room was $100 before the upgrade that I took. Can upgrade to Exec. level, if you wish, at check in. As mentioned earlier, not a good hotel to tour Madrid as it is a 20 - 30 min. ride to downtown. A caution - pickpockets are a plague of crowded areas, like the Metro. Secure your money and passports if going to such areas. Overall - an excellent hotel to relax upon arrival or before departure. Expensive to eat /park and not real close to many restaurants/shops. If you can get it for E110 or less, a good deal for Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Madrid Hilton is Unique and that is in Black & White with Red all over.”
Reviews.Author: EpicureanFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: No one would or should ever stay at an airport Hilton Hotel if they plan on being a tourist in the city. Okay, so we knew that going in but I am a Hilton HH members and I like my perks so instead of staying downtown at the Ritz or the Westin Palace (wasnt that the Sheraton Palace a few years ago) I picked the rediculous Airport Hilton. By the way, I have stayed at both the Ritz and the Palace on previous visits and enjoyed them both. The first impression at any hotel is very important witness my review of the Kensington Hilton where I stayed prior to arrival in Madrid. The situation at this hotel was totally different and took me totally by surprise in a good way. The front desk manager made us feel like we were special in welcoming us to his hotel. The entire staff at the front desk gave a powerful first impression for the hotel. While the hotel is an airport location getting to and from downtown Madrid was easy. The hotel will take you to a central location about half way to the city center where you can get the subway. The hotel, of course, will drop you off at the airport where you can get a subway. And, there is a subway stop in walking distance (a good hike) from the hotel property. Most of all, the subway is easy to navigate and fun for a visitor. The hotel was fun as it breaks the monotonous expectations of typical Hilton properties around the world. This is not your boring airport hotel. The rooms are a nice break for seasoned travelers looking for something different in their sleeping environment. The bathroom doors open up at the V or corner of the bathroom. There is a clear glass sink, seperate commode area and both a shower and tub. The actual bedroom, like the hotel, is black and white with one piece of modern red furniture. Behind the bed is a water color that looks original and provides muted tones in the modern room. No matter how much I travel I am always surprised. This hotel stay took me by surprise when we were stopped walking out of the executive club drinking bottled water. We were told that we had to go back into the lounge and finish our waters before leaving the lounge. I could understand if it were alcohol, but this was water. Oh well, always something new. One morning our order for breakfast (eggs and waffles) took much too long. It appeared that the lady who took our order never followed up to make sure that the food was done. This was a minor problem and rectified on other mornings. My babysitter and children complained that there were not enough chairs around the pool. The pool was very nice and unique as well. I would stay at this hotel again and suggest you give it a try if you want a unique Hilton experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, good experience”
Reviews.Author: coolercb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here both when we landed and then came back to wind down after we saw the rest of the region. Overall we enjoyed our room very much - very modern, very clean, with a wonderfully comfortable bed. The only complaints we have is that the internet is NOT free, and the cab rides to anywhere from here are a total rip off. Other then that its a great place to be near the airport. However if you plan on going out at night and then taking the metro back you will be screwed. But it was a great place to just wind down, eat some good food, get cleaned up and organized. Also a very helpful staff is always a bonus when you're in a new place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Good for business but not leisure”
Reviews.Author: SkipAhoy
Reviews.Content: Looks new. Monochrome style, giving it a very modern look. Room: Excellent. King bed was perfect. Price: on the high side but corporate rates are available and I could have got a good internet deal. Dinner: very good but very expensive Drinks: again very expensive.....€10 glass of wine Business facilities: very good. Meetings rooms are spacious Breakfast: Very good Location: great for airport, not so good for city Shuttle service to city is one way only and on request. So...shuttle to city and metro back (€2 pp). Shuttle to airport is every 20min from 6am to 1230pm. It is on request @ 5am, 530am . Note: make sure the driver closes the luggage door!!! I was working from my room yesterday (7 Sept) and saw the shuttle drive on to the main road/motorway with the luggage door up and a bag flew out the back as it turned the corner. Cars narrowly missed running it over. 3min later the bag was recovered by the driver. The driver does think he is Alonso! Taxi from airport to city (Plaza Santa Ana): Be wared. €29 BUT then they ask for luggage allowance AND airport surcharge without prior warning (I should have known!). Total €36.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: rileychas
Reviews.Content: We anchored a three week visit to Spain at this hotel staying two nights each on arrival, mid trip after a tour of Andalusia, and after side trip to Barcelona prior to our return home. The location was very convenient to airport and just few blocks from Metro station for easy access to all parts of city. Hotel shuttle takes you to Ventas Metro station for shorter trip. The facility was very modern and comfortable. I am a Gold Hilton Honors member and received upgrade including access to excellent happy hour lounge. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great stylish AND functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: TripAdviserGB
Reviews.Content: It's true that the hotel isn't near the City centre, it's near the airport, which is why it's called Hilton Madrid Airport. It is very well designed and has a high level of fittings etc. It is stylish and the staff are excellent. It's not a budget hotel and doesn't pretend to be. Cab rides are about E25 to the City centre. The pool and outside area are excellent and there are Turkish baths and Hammams. If you are a Hilton HHonors member, the lounge is very well equipped. Nice bar area and the food looks good although we ate out. The rooms are very well equipped and a pleasure to be once you get used to the glass and mirrors everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good only if you need to be by the airport”
Reviews.Author: FresnoSurfer
Reviews.Content: An ultramodern hotel, with an impressive black-white-and-glass theme. That theme, however, is taken to an extreme when you discover that the bathrooms have only semi-tinted glass walls separating them from the bedroom. That’s a problem when you try sleeping and the other person needs to use the facilities: the light gets right in your eyes. In addition, sometimes even close friends and couples want some privacy; it is not available here. The location is excellent if you want to be right next to the airport: the quick shuttle ride makes it perfect if you need to catch an early morning flight. Getting to the city, however, is a 20-30 minutes car ride. There is absolutely nothing within walking distance. The pool is disappointingly small, but the covered lounge around it is quite pleasant. Some of the charges are outrageous. Parking is offered at 30 Euros per day (although street parking is available for free), and WiFi at 22 Euros per day.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for an airport hotel,downtown Madrid about 25mins away by metro”
Reviews.Author: enma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton Madrid Airport one night before our flight in the morning. We arrived early in the afternoon and were able to check in right away. The shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel was easy to find and free. The rooms were very modern to the point that I thought the bathrooms were unpractical. Not much privacy with all the glass and sliding doors. The rooms were little small and the A/C didn't work very well. The beds were OK, not like beds at Marriotts. There is a metro station about 15mins walk away. We took the metro to Madrid, took about 25mins and was only 1 or 2 euros. The metro station was little bit hard to find. Overall our stay was pleasant just for one night, especially for the price, only (pre)payed 79 euros per room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel if you want to be by the airport!”
Reviews.Author: GoUCLAbruins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last night of our trip because we had a early morning flight. We used Hilton points for the free hotel night and it was well worth it.The hotel is amazing and reminds me of a trendy "W" Hotel. Excellent service at check in, fabulous room with all these fancy amenities and gadgets. Large room and exquisite bathroom- separate bathtub from shower. Great pool, internet access, service. Restaurant is too pricy. We walked to the metro (about 15 minutes) and took it in to Madrid for dinner. (One metro line for about 20-25 minutes.) We were on the club floor that offered complimentary drinks, breakfast and happy hour foods.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Modern Hotel, but a little outside the city”
Reviews.Author: NomadicBeth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the first night I arrived in Madrid. I could not have been more pleased. The location next to the airport is very appealing when you are getting off a 10 hour flight and just want to get to your hotel easily and quickly. I waited for the shuttle for about 20 minutes, but was then at the hotel within 5 minutes. My room was available even though it was not even 11am. So I was able to get in and take a nap. The room was probably the coolest hotel room I had ever seen. It had such a neat modern decor. The room was incredibly comfortable, it had a separate shower and bath tub. It also had a great TV, which had speakers in the bathroom as well. The hotel staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. I was on the executive floor, so I had access to the executive lounge as well, which was convenient because it had free internet access as well as beverages and snacks throughout the day. The main drawback to the hotel for a long term stay is that it is a little far out of the city. It is easily accessible by metro, there is a station about 10 minute walk away, and then it's about a 20 - 25 minute train ride into the very center of the city. However, this also means that the hotel is in a very quiet, somewhat residential area. I loved this hotel and would definitely stay here again on my way in or out of Madrid when I wanted to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with outstanding service, tricky - but good - location”
Reviews.Author: Fretliner
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights during July in my trip to Madrid and the surrounding area. It's a new hotel - finely decorated and equipped, staff is exceptionally helpful and professional - so the overall stay is a real pleasure. For business traveller it's perfet. For leisure traveller the location is tricky - it's off the airport but in a very hard to find (on the first time) location. However, once you figured it out the location is actually great as it's immediately on the exist to both westbound A2 that spurs into the city centre, and southbound M40 that enables you to go down to Todelo, Aranjuez etc. Only reason I did not give it 5 starts is the outrageous price of underground parking which is 30 Euro per night, however I was lucky to park outside at all nights. Bottom line - a great hotel, would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from anything!”
Reviews.Author: mareGuelph
Reviews.Content: This is convenient hotel if you need the airport close by and it has free shuttle service. We wanted to enjoy our last night in Spain but nothing was closeby! Taxi into city costs about 20-25 Euro. Metro stop was a 20 minute walk away and in a very isolated part of Madrid-Metro ride into core is 13 stops away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Phenomenal Service”
Reviews.Author: rharris333
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here 13-15 July 2009. The staff was incredible, smiles everywhere, and extremely accomodating. When we arrived I had only booked one night. When I inquired about staying a second, Maria was able to get me a better rate for the 2nd night. I am a Hilton gold member, so we recieved an upgrade to the executive floor, which was really nice. Breakfast was included with the room and while nothing was cooked to order, there were plenty of choices. We had dinner at the restaurant, and the only negative was that because it wasn't busy, our waitress spent alot of time at the bar. It took 50 minutes to get our food, and while the flavor was exceptional, it was lukewarm at best, as it had been sitting awhile. The rooms are very nice and modern. The parking is very expensive...30 euro per night, so we just parked on the street and didn't have any problems. The hotel shuttle dropped us off at the metro station and picked us back up at the airport when were were through sightseeing for the day. This was the best hotel we stayed at all week - highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “How Much?!”
Reviews.Author: PK173
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel but way overpriced for it's standard and location. Rack rate (OK who pays that anyway) is obscene, but I guess most people stay here on packages. The location is handy for the airport but if you arrive after the last hotel shuttle, you will find that the taxis are reluctant to carry you the short distance, and trust me, you can't walk it! Front desk staff are very good, but the service staff are poor. 3 reminders to pick up laundry is not acceptable and for some strange reason they do not restock the minibar - which is probably a good idea as the cost is exorbitant. The bar and restaurant are similarly expensive. €28 for a mediocre buffet breakfast is not acceptable. The rooms are nice. I would say twee and not very practical. I loath glass basins so maybe this is personal. Bed was comfy though. Room rate is one thing, but the ancillary costs are worse. Fortunately it is only a €20 ride to the centre of Madrid - or even €1 if you are willing to take a 20 minute walk to the nearest metro station. Internet is €17 per 24hours - I loath this too, it should be free. And expect to pay €30 per day for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: kalirick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here both before and after flights to/from Paris. Nice facility, although we had problems with the room air conditioning both times. We were first placed in a room on the Exec level that had no air conditioning and then moved to a room that had marginal AC. Same marginal AC in room second time. The AC is not turned on when you arrive so I recommend that you turn on the AC and wait to confirm it is working before you unpack (my wife and I travel extensively and always seem to learn something each trip). Nice place - but a bit overpriced for what it is - just and airport stop off.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with minor defaults”
Reviews.Author: deary2000
Reviews.Content: we've been in Hilton madrid Airport for 3 nights - good hotel with minor defaults ( undersized swimming pool - 12 seats !!!???? for a huge hotel , weak air conditioning for hot summer days ) .average 16 euro to reach downtown by taxi .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room, great value”
Reviews.Author: SuttsDublin
Reviews.Content: We used the hotel as an overnight stop as we were taking a connecting flight out of Madrid the following morning. We were travelling with two young children. The hotel does not have family rooms but when I contacted them by phone they were able to offer inter connecting rooms with the second at a 50% discount. Total cost of two rooms was EUR120. If you contact them by phone you will have to ask for the internet/prepay rate (i.e. the cheapest one). The rooms are as sleek and modern as the other reviewers have stated. We declined breakfast as it was c. EUR20 each! Overall excellent place to stay if you need to be close to the airport. Not suitable if you are spending a few days in Madrid as you are not close to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Jessica's trip comes to an end”
Reviews.Author: Reno12
Reviews.Content: What started out as a very bad day at the Hilton, turned into a very good day...I had sent a picture and a gift and Roses were to be added so that when my Two Granddaughter's Megan and Jessica entered there room there would be something waiting...NO GiFT no picture and no roses....The staff tried to rally while we went to lunch....Lunch not much better, had to wait over 45 minutes for a sandwich...Nobody in restaurant but us...Thingswere falling apart and I was getting very upset, Italian you know...But to the rescue came Lars Sammelius, Patrick Forestier and Henrick Calles.....Lars appoligized for the lunch and paid for it..Patrick had a cheese cake made and saw that it got in the room with the Roses...No charge..The no charge was nice but the attention to my granddaughter's was the best, as they are very special tom...Gentelman I thank you...Lars and Patrick are examples of the word service.....The chees cake was assume..... Would we stay here again??????? Absolutely

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Stay!”
Reviews.Author: PDX-World
Reviews.Content: Splendid Stay! Hotel is within 10 minutes of Madrid Barajas Airport. Hotel is modern with goregous rooms/bathrooms. Staff could not be more helpful or friendly. Complimentary shuttle begins operating at 5:00am. Need to be at the airport before 5:00? No promblem... Hotel had a taxi waiting for us outside the lobby at 4:30am, and had prepared orange juice and coffee at that early hour before our departure, too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for airport...great staff!”
Reviews.Author: smiley2703
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights here before heading out on a long journey through Europe and I loved the atmosphere of this hotel! The pool was fantastic, very quiet. Staff was very nice and willing to help with anything. Breakfast was outstanding, so make sure you add that into your agenda in the morning! Close to tube stop to get anywhere in downtown Madrid. The shuttle bus to the airport was a great perk! The rooms were awesome, bed very comfortable!! Being a Hilton Honors member they were very attentive to that, which made my stay much more pleasurable. Only thing I didn't like was that they charge you to use the internet.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, poor management”
Reviews.Author: Maritel Garcia
Reviews.Content: The room is really nice and the bed is outstanding. The front desk staff one of the nicest I saw. The pool great. But, ... the shower in the sauna was out of service!!! both days and the hotel offers a complimentary shuttle service to Ronda metro station. That service is outsourced and the driver could or couldn´t get you to the hotel. That's a problem because you have to guess meanwhile you´re waiting in the pick-up point and the problem happened twice in two days. Those aspects were managerial ones, could be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern stylish airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: doghouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for an airport stopover. As soon as we walked through the door we felt relaxed - all the staff were pleasant and helpful. The pool area is lovely and calming. The only down side is the very high price for food and beverage. To overcome this we walked to the nearby shopping centre. This involved walking through a residential area - not a problem on a light summer evening. The buffet breakfast was excellent. The shuttle bus service was prompt and efficient. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing after stay in Copenhagen Airport Hilton”
Reviews.Author: MDDad
Reviews.Content: When I recently reviewed the Copenhagen Airport Hilton, I raved about the location and service at the hotel. Unfortunately, these were precisely the problems at the Hilton Madrid Airport Hotel. Located approximately 1 mile from the international terminal, this hotel is a good choice for the international traveler looking for a clean room prior to or after a long trip. For anyone planning to stay for over 1 night, this hotel cannot be recommended. The hotel is located in an isolated area adjacent to the airport. There are no nearby restaurants, and travel to downtown is not convenient even for those comfortable using the Metro. The nearest Metro station is located 600 meters from the hotel. Following the 15 minute walk though some isolated areas, it is another 30 minute subway ride to the center of Madrid on the busy and crowded line 5. The location was not ideal, but the biggest problem was the service. When I purchased the executive package, I was told that it came with internet access, use of the lounge, and breakfast daily. Unfortunately, the employees were dishonest, and the internet access was only available when the lounge was open which was only for 4 hours on the day that I arrived. Even during those 4 hours, the internet was difficult to use since the 2 computers are in high demand. There is no reason that in-room wireless was not included in the executive package which cost an extra $100. The executive package is clearly a scam. I do not mind paying to allow efficient work during business trips, but I at least expect to receive what I pay for. On a positive note, the rooms were clean and modern. They have good air-conditioning which is a problem in many Madrid hotels. The breakfast buffet was outstanding, and the airport shuttle service was adequate with trips every 15 - 20 minutes. In summary, this hotel if fine for an overnight stay, but there are better choices for the tourist or business traveler who desires more than an overnight bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: okarr
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel overall. Very modern and clean but not cozy. Great service. Excellent breakfast. Room service over-priced. 20 euro for a burger and drink at bar 14 euro. Airport shuttle helpful. Location of hotel is hard to find. Metro stop is a good walk (500 meters). Area feels safe though. Mall around hotel is not in working distance like others have said. Taxi service around area is not the best.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: sophs1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night and made use of the free shuttle service to and from the airport which was great. The room was lovely, very clean and luxurious, we didn´t have time to use the pool, but we could see it from our window, and it looked very relaxing, so we are planning on going back for a longer layover in september. The one problem was the food, we decided to treat ourselves to a buffet dinner, the appetizers were amazing, but the main course was, well, inedible!!! Maybe a la carte would have been ok, but the food on the buffet was dried up or soggy and the veggies all undercooked or overcooked! and 5euros for a small coke, just a bit ridiculous! Next time we´ll eat at the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: NlPt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a typical 5 star Hilton and has got spacious and modern rooms. The staff is very friendly and everyone speaks English if you prefer not to adventure yourself in Spanish. Great sdandart Hilton buffet breakfast. The only less positive aspect is the location, as it is not close to the centre. Still, you can take the shuttle bus to the airport (and take the metro there) or else ask for directions to the closest metro station, which is about 15 minutes walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but only for airport use”
Reviews.Author: Hobartgirl
Reviews.Content: This is a modern and clean hotel. The room was large and the bed was huge too. Great bathroom - large and clean. The bathroom products are Crabtree & Evelyn and very nice too. Used the room service for a club sandwich which was great with lots of chips and three sauces. The price was double in Australia though. Very quick delivery although nowhere on the bill for a tip and I had no coin left. Convenient shuttle to the airport. Being close to the airport would be the only reason to use this hotel as it is too far from Madrid city. Did not have breakfast or use any other services.
