Very friendly staff that signed me up to HH without having too fill in the form and offered a wakeup call and shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: motovar
Reviews.Content: I was super pleased while staying at the Hilton. Not only is the location perfect for business travelers due to the proximity from the airport, but the room was spotless and the amenities are awesome. The pool was very relaxing and well maintained and the front desk staff was very nice. I can honestly say I'd return to this property anytime I have to come back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most modern and beautiful hotels, unfortunately airport”
Reviews.Author: EricCR2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just great for travelers who are going to IFEMA or just need an airport hotel. Is very new (1 year) and is very modern and nice. Rooms are the most beautiful and modern I have ever been. I congratulate the arquitect and designer who did this hotel. Free shuttle to and from the airport is also a plus...

Reviews.Title: “Surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: happy2travelnow
Reviews.Content: When we checked in and went to our room, we were greeted with a welcome on the flat-screen TV!! What a pleasant surprise! The room was large, with modern furnishings, and the bathr0oom was incredible - large, with an unusual class sink with bowl, all one piece, extremely clean. I've never seen such a sink. Incredible! walls and bathroom doors were made opaque glass. Very unusual. Considering all the furnishings and design in our unit, we really were delighted. We had free shuttle service to and from the airport. There is a business center that we didn't need to use. Breakfast selections were great - but be sure you understand exactly what you get for each person at each of two price levels. Also, be aware thaa the coupon given to you and described by desk staff when you check in does not provide a free breakfast, though the staff presentation may make it seem that way. It just describes the offerings. Also, be fully aware of phone charges - what the costs are and what calls are free. There can be some confusion here and their per-minute charges, depending on where you call, can be steep. We used the sun deck and I enjoyed the outdoor pool on the top of the middle section linking the two tower sections with rooms (not that tall, though). Hotel signage, as others have noted, is not good. Road access is confusing, so we were happy to have left the driving to the shuttle staff. Still

Reviews.Title: “Way Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Mdap64
Reviews.Content: This hotel is way overrated. Let's start with the good points. There's an excellent swimming pool. A little small for some maybe, but it has a retractable roof that can be opened and closed by remote control in seconds. There's also a good gym and sauna, with pleasant staff in attendance. The breakfast buffet is very good. But - and there are a few buts - the hotel was not even half full when we stayed there and the tables were dirty every day we sat down for breakfast. Similarly, each time we tried to get near reception, there was a 15 minute wait. Understand me - the staff were pleasant, just thin on the ground. We had the impression that the staff were quite frankly overworked, not helped by some of the lengthy and frankly ludicrous queries we overheard from mostly US tourists just grateful to find an Engish speaker. Whatever you do, do not hire a car at the Hilton in Madrid. Their agency - Sixt - is frankly a disgrace. Suffice to say, after weeks of fruitless e-mails, I got through to the ever-helpful Amex to arrange a refund for Sixt overcharging me (2 days car hire instead of 1). Incidentally, if you're driving to the hotel, be warned. It's badly signed (almost non-existent, in fact) and extremely difficult to find. And I lived in Madrid for 11 years. The hotel is fine for a brief, preferably 1-night stay if you're flying in and out - the hotel has a very convenient shuttle to Barajas airport gratis. If you're planning to use the hotel as a base to explore Madrid, forget it. Try the Wellington in downtown Madrid (c/. Velazquez near the Retio park), one of the best hotels in Madrid. The rooms are minimalist, and ok. Beds are not particularly comfortable. Food is very expensive. Brits - order a pint in the bar, not a half measure. A pint costs 7 euros (bad enough, I know), but the half meaure is 5 euros - and that's what they'll bring you, if you're not careful.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel covenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: cw691431
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand new, and has modern rooms and conference center. The location is near the airport, and a shuttle runs there regularly without the need for reservation. They recently added a 3rd shuttle bus to take customers to the Ventas metro stop in the city center, which is a major benefit and improvement. Going into town now only takes about 20-30 minutes, although coming back you have to go back to the airport, meaning a return trip of about an hour. Overall, it's great for airport connection, and reasonable for single trips into Madrid itself. If you are planning a longer stay, the return trips would add up in terms of time. There was no free wireless or wired internet, but a nice fitness center and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Airmay
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton in Madrid for one night before heading back home to the states. It is everything you would expect from a Hilton. Great rooms, modern, updated, comfortable bed, excellent bathroom. They run a convenient shuttle between the hotel and airport, which was nice. It is not centrally located to Madrid - so if you are on a sightseeing tour, this may not be the best option. As you would expect, the 'extras' do not come cheap. Food is quite good - but pricey. Pool and health club are nice - fairly rare amenities for Madrid. Professional, courteous staff round out a very nice experience. Overall, very nice hotel by the airport. It was a great last night to my trip through Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel, very friendly staff, very cool modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: swisstourist
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel near the Madrid airport and saw good reviews about this hotel and I agree. The shuttle at the airport was easy to find and runs frequently. The staff was very friendly, received a welcome letter from the manager when I checked in. The room is the coolest, most modern room I have ever seen. Everything is very sleek and modern. Individual temperature control. Flat screen tv. The bathroom has frosted glass walls/doors. Glass sink is very modern looking. Has both a tub and a separate shower. Separate toilet area. The audio from the tv can be turned on to hear in the bathroom. There are alot of switches in the room - including a nightlight in the bathroom that gives just enough of a light Desk, three telephones, refrigerator, coffee maker and hair dryer. Internet available at the hotel but it costs money. Restaurant is on the ground floor of the atrium and they offer typical American food - pricy but expected in a hotel. The atrium is in the middle of the hotel and the only problem is the noise. You can hear the yelling/cheering from the bar - but not much of a problem (there was a big soccer match that night so expected). Airport shuttle is by request before 6am. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who needs to stay near the airport in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter2
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect airport hotel..We spent one night there & walked to the mall (many restaurants) for dinner.. Close to airport with complimentary shuttle service (& convenient shuttle times), though this would be difficult to find if you are driving---there are no large signs & building does not look like hotel. (you would need very specific directions). Very new & very modern. It is perfect for overnight for timely flights. The shuttle will also drive you to the mall if it is available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but Niggles”
Reviews.Author: LiztheWhizz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night (myself, my husband and our 7 yo son) at the start of a 5 day break in Madrid province. The hotel is very smart and we got a good rate on the room. But there were some niggles.... Location As noted by others, the hotel is almost impossible to find. We hired a car, followed the instructions from the hotel website and got lost almost at once. We are well used to driving around cities all over the world but Madrid road signage reaches new heights of unhelpfulness and confusion. Even when we got back on track and could actually see the hotel, we could only find the entrance road at the third attempt. We complained to the receptionist who sympathised and told us he got lost on the way to his interview. The only answer is to take the courtesy bus. This also avoids the hefty hotel parking fee. We decided to pay it as the surrounding area looks a bit too dodgy to be sure your car would survive the night intact. Hotel: Once inside, the hotel atrium is very striking. The reception staff were exceptionally courteous. We upgraded to a room on the executive floor which included breakfast and complimentary drinks and snacks in the executive lounge. We found the executive lounge a bit of a disappointment as though the drinks flowed, the snacks were pretty limited and the staff a bit cranky. The room itself was excellent, pristine and with nice furniture (large swivel armchair with footrest), all in striking black, white and silver. The bathroom was striking, with a large transparent oval sink as a centrepiece. We ate very well via room service which provided a proper table to eat from. The carpaccio of pineapple dessert was very creative. The breakfast buffet was extensive though as usual the hot food was a disappointment to a Brit. All in all a great hotel, not cancelled out by the niggles!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay apart from Antonio, the very unfriendly bartender.”
Reviews.Author: traceyincambridge
Reviews.Content: A very nice, modern business hotel. Spacious, clean rooms. Extremely friendly and helpful staff apart from one bad apple. 10-15 minute walk to the Metro which then can take you anywhere you need to go. Convenient airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “very very very nice”
Reviews.Author: Delveling
Reviews.Content: we stayed there just 1 night as stopover before our long-distance flight out of Madrid. very cool and beautiful rooms - the perfect bathroom. just food ist very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: fifibunnie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last night in Spain after leaving car back to airport, we got the hilton shuttle bus to hotel. Staff exceptionally helpful. Great swimming pool and very good buffet breakfast. Would highly reccommend as an ariport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience I had”
Reviews.Author: Ninak78
Reviews.Content: We arrived rather late and from the minute we got out of the car in the parking lot, the hotel staff was ready to help us with whatever we wanted, and with a big smile. It was a really positive service experience, and it made our stay in Spain complete. Both I and my boyfriend would love to come back, and will look for a Hilton Hotel wherever we travel after this.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of an Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyavtech
Reviews.Content: This is not your typical airport hotel. From the moment I set foot through the door to my departure, I felt welcome. The multi national staff were very helpful and friendly, happily dispensing ideas on what to do and how to get there. The room is modern in feel with the dark wood floor, with floating shelves, desks everywhere. The bathroom featured green marble with the glass shoji-screen like sliding doors. I loved the all in one glass sink vanity, very hip. The complimentary shuttle to and from the airport and the shopping bus to downtown Madrid came in very handy during the trip. My favorite part was the spa. The pool with it’s retractable roof, the sauna and Turkish bath is what makes this a non typical airport hotel. Calming and serene, they helped take away the stress of business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent AIRPORT Hotel, emphasis on Airport”
Reviews.Author: FPodesta
Reviews.Content: Notably the Hilton Madrid Airport is a 5 minute walk to the Madrid Metro, and a 20-30 minute Metro ride thereafter points of interest in the city. Specifically, it is 30 minutes from the Opera stop, which affords access to the Plaza Mayor and the Palace. The walk to and from the Metro appears safe enough at night. The hotel is spectacularly close to the airport itself, with a relatively reliable shuttle to and from all terminals. A taxi will cost roughly 15 Euros. The hotel itself is immaculately clean, extremely modern and very well staffed. The free breakfast is outstanding! The food is fresh and bountiful, with a wondrous selection. The staff is helpful almost to the point of becoming annoying. I prefer to carry my own bags to my room, largely to keep tip money in my pocket. The staff is very interested in helping with this. Nonetheless, I believe this was not due to greed, as the manager of the hotel pounced upon me as well to ensure that I was having an excellent stay. I am convinced the staff has been instructed to be exceptionally friendly and accessible. The pool/spa area is beautiful. There is free parking out front, if you can get it, which will save you the 17 Euro fee per night. As long as you do not intend to stay in the heart of Madrid, this hotel will not disappoint you, and the proximity to the airport will make your arrival and departure very smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalism, both in design and service, located in a concrete wilderness”
Reviews.Author: JamesRadish
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel designed by Miguel Oliver Pérez. A strong plus is the archtectural integrity that exists throughout the hotel. The sad thing is it's being leased and run by Hilton. The hotel is located 10 minutes off airport but take the hotel bus from your terminal - lots of airport taxis have no idea where to find it. The longest journey by one of my colleagues took well over an hour. The design is powerful minimalism. There's lots of black granite and very little colour anywhere and the theme is carried though the public areas and the rooms. Rooms are reasonable size, are well equipped and they generally work well. Small niggles are the inability to have just a reading light when you're in bed. It's the full array or nothing and the taps are badly designed so that you can't turn them off when your hands are wet. Doh! The world divides betwen those who think clear acrillic basins look good (all of us) and those who think they look a real mess once you've run a tap and used some soap (me and a few others) Food is uninspiring, to put it kindly. Breakfast is the best meal. Conference staff not well trained and suffering from a serious mañana tendancy. Rubbish gym but lovely pool. Outrageous bar prices that would look expensive in a well located 5 star + hotel in Paris, London or Los Angeles, let alone one located in a concrete desert near an airport. Internet access available but again, Hilton charge a staggering amount to use it. It all gives the impression of a rip-off mentality that I've noticed in other Hiltons. I really cannot see why anyone would want to stay here of their own volition.

Reviews.Title: “A super Hilton”
Reviews.Author: MarilynBrien
Reviews.Content: This brand new Hilton is one beautiful facility. The large comfortable room had a mod bath with separate shower and tub and a glass lavatory. There is plenty of room for a 3rd person. The complimentary shuttle service takes you to the airport in 5 minutes. This is a great relaxing choice for the beginning or end of a trip to Spain. Be aware it is several miles from the center of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “good qaulity hotel, not brillant location to see the city though”
Reviews.Author: robcfarmer
Reviews.Content: OVERVIEW Get past the dull looking exterior of pored concrete and rendered pebble dash and you will be treated to a fantastically modern and comfortable hotel. With its super cool interior finished to give it a contemporary feeling you will settle in with the warm and friendly atmosphere. There is a nice shopping center just across the road but because of the crazy road system it takes 15 mins to walk there and 10 mins (around €13) to get there by cab. STAFF The staff were very friendly and breakfast was good. For no apparent reason I was upgraded to one of the president rooms which was a nice surprise. ROOMS My room was lovely, very comfortable bed with a nice feather pillow. Good sound from the Sony LCD, under floor heating in the bathroom and quiet air con was great. There is also very effective double glazing, you can't hear any traffic noise or the passing planes. FITNESS ROOM / POOL I always look for a good gym, this is the only negative I can spot with this hotel. The fitness room is tiny, too warm and has cheap equipment. Also the steam rooms wasn't working, there were no locker keys so I had to leave my stuff out. WOULD I STAY AGAIN Yes for business but not for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A good reason to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Suomessa
Reviews.Content: I never realised how awful and tired hotel airports were until I had a hotel like this to compare them to. Recently opened and gleaming in all directions, this Hilton is so nice, I'd rather stay at the airport than downtown. I mean that literally. I am literally going to move out of downtown and stay at the airport tomorrow night. (Ok, I'm flying out the next morning - but still...) It has a wonderfully chic lobby restaurant (if you like black on white) and very modern rooms with clean lines, lots of polished wood, glass and metal. In a way, the rooms are kind of Scandinavian. WLAN costs 22 euros, which seems about normal in Madrid with swisscom or swissport or whatever it is called. The breakfast was adequate without being great. But, the general feel of being in a new and well designed room was wonderful - and it actually lives up to the billing of being at the airport which is always a bit of a relief. Seriously, one of the best hotels I've stayed at and definitely THE best hotel airport. Ok, the neighborhood is an airport - but if you are here for one night this is definitely the place to stay. You know it's good when your first instinct is to pull out a camera.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: CruisinFlorida
Reviews.Content: Recently we stayed at the airport Hilton at the Madrid airport the night before catching our return flight to the States. It is unfortunate that this hotel is not located in downtown Madrid as we would absolutely have stayed there when we first arrived. The Hilton is a new ultramodern hotel and while we were not there very long, we enjoyed every minute of our short stay. The front desk was courteous and accomodating. The lobby is amazing especially when viewed from the high floors looking through the glass elevators into the atrium which contains part of the hotel's restaurant. The room had down comforters with a lot of glass in the bathroom, flat screen television and wood floors. The hotel is within walking/short driving distance to a mall and the airport is 3 minutes away. The hotel has a free shuttle to the airport which starts running around 5 am and is a real plus.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: HGDLondon
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best hotel I've stayed in. Excellent service, clean room, nice staff. Me and my girlfriend went there to celebrate new years and it was great. We had a party in the bar area and the manager (Patrick) was excellent. Location is not great if you want to go in and out of the hotel to the city all day. You'll have to stay out all day then come back as its too far to travel. But the metro is only 10 mins walk away. And hotel also do a free shuttle to the airport every 20mins which also has a metro but the metro at the airport charge 1 EURO per transaction to get through so best to walk it instead. Staff were very helpful and always smiling. Restaurant is really over priced so best to eat out in city centre at Sol or plaza da espana. Overall I would come back but I would prefer something closer to the city so I can come back and relax before heading out again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for airport access, NOT CLOSE TO ANYTHING ELSE”
Reviews.Author: jut87
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Hilton are wonderful. They are large, very modern, and clean. They definitely went with a modern, trendy decor in the rooms, and they are great. The bathrooms are very cool, with frosted glass doors to the main entry to the bathroom, the shower, and the toilet. Here's the huge negative on this hotel. IT IS NOT CLOSE TO ANYTHING ELSE EXCEPT THE AIRPORT. Although the Hilton website says that it is within walking distance from the Metro, and their staff says so as well, IT IS NOT MY RECOMMENDATION TO DO SO. The walk, if you knew exactly how to get from the Metro to the hotel, should take 10-15 minutes. However, this walk involves crossing a major highway, that only has one bridge to cross it. If you don't know where this bridge is or how to get pedestrian access to it, it is impossible to get there. Also, once you get across the bridge, you still have about a 1/4 mile walk, with no sidewalks. I STRONGLY RECOMMEND ONLY GETTING TO THIS HOTEL WITH THE SHUTTLE SERVICE OR BY TAXI (particularly if you have luggage). It's only a 4 euro taxi ride from the metro station, if you can hail a cab. In addition, there are not any restaurants or shopping within walking distance of the hotel. The front desk recommended a mall nearby that was a 15 euro taxi ride. The other option was restaurants back toward the metro station, which is also a cab ride away. There is nothing to do in the near proximity of the hotel, unless you're willing to take a cab. The hotel is very close to the airport and operates a free shuttle to and from the airport, running pretty much whenever you need it, with no more than a 15 minute wait. The pool is very nice, has quite warm water, and some very cool fountains and jets. There is also a sauna in the changing rooms at the pool. The restaurant at the hotel is very expensive. We ate there, just to avoid having to catch cab rides and waste time riding in a cab. The cheapest thing on the menu was a club sandwich at 17 euros, a burger sets you back 23 euros, and a glass of wine was 9 euros. My advice is this is a great hotel if you only need a place near the airport and can utilize the shuttle to and from the airport to get there.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay at the Madrid Hilton was better than the first”
Reviews.Author: NERoth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Madrid Hilton in September and thought the hotel was superb in all respects. I stayed again on January 3, 2009 with my family and found it to be even better. The service was impeccable - it could not have been better, from the bellmen, to the front desk, to housekeeping, to the restaurant. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are quiet and comfortable, and it is situated perfectly to catch a morning flight without any hassles. I also found the rates at the Hilton webbsite to be extremely competitive. I recommend this hotel without hesitation and will undoubtedly stay at this hotel again on my next trip to Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Glass bathroom doors that don't close all the way”
Reviews.Author: Salsera6
Reviews.Content: New property, though nothing to write home about. A decent stopover hotel if you want to stay near the airport, as it does have a shuttle. Staff is very welcomming and helpful. A few issues. Bathroom doors are glass, and do not shut all the way. Room service was outrageously expensives (23 euros for a burger). Burned hand on hair dryer provided in the room - the metal barrel gets extremely hot while in operation. Rate was decent (133 euros), but not sure I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GovBizzTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night because I had an early flight from Madrid the next day. I found this a great place to stay. My room was beautiful and sparkling clean, and the soundproofing was some of the best I've ever encountered. I was staying close to a busy highway, but never would have noticed it. I got in late that night, and was pretty tired, but they had a very good dinner buffet which made things easy for the weary traveler. The airport shuttle was free, and you didn't even need to make a reservation. And the room rate of 175 Euros was quite reasonable considering what you get. The only drawback is that the hotel is near the airport but not very close to anything else. So it is a very good place to stay if you want to be close to the airport, but not as good for tourists or general business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: platinummedallion801
Reviews.Content: BEAUTIFUL, modern property. Very friendly staff. Shuttle runs between airport and hotel, allowing easy subway access. Only complaint is price of hotel food--yikes!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hilton”
Reviews.Author: apvac
Reviews.Content: New modern hotel near the Barajas airport. Underground safe parking with direct access to elevators. Very modern and large room and bathroom (separate shower and tube). Excellent acoustic insulation. Business Centre and Executive Lounge. Very helpful personnel. It is a wonderful new Hilton. The location is good for people visiting Madrid and surroundings by car. I was in the centre of the city in 20 min. All the nearby attractions (Toledo, El Escorial, Avila, Segovia, etc.) are easily reachable by car. I think that it is quite difficult to find similar accomodations at comparable prices in the centre of the town.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money, 5Star, nice pool, local shops and mall”
Reviews.Author: FussyJustABit
Reviews.Content: Basic room £155 B&B, but what a room. Nice pool and free shuttle us to/from airport. Service is first class Everything looks classy and expensive and it is 14Euros for a large beer, 4.5Euros for a glass of coke But worth it. Within walking distance to local bars, cafe and a few shops. All cheap and cheerful. Used by locals. Longer walk across bridge to the shopping mall, worth the walk. Plenty of shops and eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Good start to say its only opened about 2 months ago!!!”
Reviews.Author: littlei101
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really modern and well presented. From the airport their is a free shuttle bus which taks you to the hotel, which only takes 5 minutes, 10 at the most . When we got their they took our suitcases and took them up to our room.The room was lovely it had a lcd plasma which we found very helpful, because we took a portable dvd player which we connected to the tv to watch on the tv. The only downer about the room is the view out of the balcony window. On every floor there is an ice room which is very helpful. They have a pool which is sort of inside but the roof opens up. The sun loungers are the best the are leather. They also have a gym,sauna and a steam room.The staff are very friendly and helpful. To the nearest shopping centre is about 20 mins away. You can see it out of the hotel but you have to walk the long way because the hotel is situated on a motorway. You can also walk to the nearest metro station, which is about 10 mins away. This can take you to the main town Sol and other places in Madrid. | recommend that if your are intrested in sightseeing that you go on the Madrid vision in Sol.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous new hotel”
Reviews.Author: CathyNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: Ultra-modern, decor. The interior design of the room, especially the bathroom is quite striking. Very beautiful green marble panelling in bathroom, Sink of molded glass lovely to look at, but not entirely geared toward functionality as user must be careful not to splatter water. Hi-tech fixtures. Great ligthing, comfortable beds. Convenient to airport, but cab driver couldn't find the place even after being shown the hotel's website map. So ran up a fare while cabbie circled the neighborhood asking locals for directions. The hotel should send driving instructions to the cab company that works the Osuna metro stop area, which is closest to the hotel. Staf is pleasant and eager to do their job well.

Reviews.Title: “New is not always best”
Reviews.Author: DTNPROMAN
Reviews.Content: While this new Hilton property is well decorated and within a 10 min. taxi ride from the airport, there is nothing in the way of restaurants or shopping within walking distance of the hotel. You must take a taxi should you decide to dine outside of the hotel. The food in the hotel restaurant is good, but it is VERY high priced. Outrageous really. The front desk or guest service is good during regular day hours, however, I tried to call down for a wake up call and got no one. I tried over and over again and finally called room service to go get someone at the front desk to call my room. I had even tried to call the hotels main number directly to get a response, but they didn't answer that phone either. I speak only English and found many of the staff unable to understand me, but I guess there is two ways to look at that. Perhaps I should learn Spanish if traveling to a mostly Spanish speaking country. I had a "Presidential Floor" 5th floor room and while it was spacious and well appointed, my 5th floor view was of another wing of their building. This may be trivial, but there is not a gift shop at all where you can get simple things like lip balm (Chapstick) or such items you may realize you need or want. In short, new is nice, but consider if you want to taxi everywhere, if you want to spend a bundle on food at the hotel, if you want front desk sevice whenever you need it, a gift shop, and perhaps you may want to stay elsewhere. New is not always best. Oh, and the elevators were not working on my arrivel, but then, the property is new and I guess they have to work through some things like that. All said, overall, I rate this Hilton property as average and will probably stay elsewhere in Madrid on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish stay”
Reviews.Author: Grenouillesansleau
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Madrid Hilton by the airport on the last night of my business/holiday trip to Europe, and it was the best of the five hotels I stayed in during my 2-week trip. The hotel is still working out some glitches, but all staff at the hotel were trying very hard to please and did an excellent job. Luckily, the shuttle bus arrived at Terminal 4 just a few minutes after I got there. The hotel's phone number is not on the list of shuttle buses at the stop, so I'd recommend that you bring the phone number with you so that you can call if necessary. On arrival, I was upgraded to the "Presidential" floor (one of two Executive floors) and given access to the Executive lounge. This might have been a perk of having Gold status with Hilton (but no doubt was also due to the fact that occupancy levels were low). My large room was stylishly decorated in black and white, with a striking and quirky red armchair. The bathroom featured a separate shower (with rain shower head) and bath, a heated floor and speakers. I visited the Executive Lounge, where I enjoyed a glass of cava, a few munchies (not as good a selection as the Paris-CDG Hilton but still decent) and checked my email. (The Lounge has two terminals; in-room access to internet is about 17 or 18 euros a day). I also tried the restaurant for a light dinner (well-executed linguine with clams) and for breakfast the next day. The breakfast spread is extensive. I would recommend budgeting at least 45 minutes from the time you check out to take the shuttle to your terminal. I was told that the shuttle was expected at 10:30, but it didn't show up until close to 10:50. Because I was in a hurry, I asked to be dropped off first (at T1), and the trip took a little under 10 minutes. If you're going to T4 and the shuttle stops at other terminals first, it could take you 25 minutes or so to get to your terminal. All in all, in was a very pleasant experience. I would even consider staying here again for a city-focused visit, because the price was great and it would be feasible to take the Hilton shuttle to the airport and then the metro into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Roger_GB
Reviews.Content: This is a stunning new property – opened 1st June 2008 – bright, large and modern rooms, stunning public areas, funky bar and restaurant. If you are looking for a hotel near the Madrid airport this really is the obvious choice. Also great value for money.
